column2: ['I loved my time there, it helped me prepare for college in a way that other students who come to college are not. The academics are off the charts. One thing I would like to see is a bit more diversity.', "I think Stuy really challenges (in the best way) its students in terms of classes and workload, which is a really important thing because it helps develop the way you think but also exposes you to so many new things. After Stuy, college (even a top university) is significantly easier. The faculty here is amazing and very involved with their students; we get the opportunity to hear from politicians to head surgeons to CEOs. We also have access to so many different resources within the school and outside in NYC. Even though it can be tough sometimes, I would choose Stuy ten-times over if I could go back in time. The people that I've met here are seriously brilliant and caring, and the conversations held in the hallways and classrooms alone can teach you so much. My only regret is that I'm a senior and will be leaving soon.", 'Stuyvesant can be very stressful but I think it prepared me well for college. There are so many clubs students can join and you can even make a new one if you want.', 'I love Stuyvesant!  Great school with a lot to explore.  It is very competitive but you learn a lot in the meanwhile.', "I started this school last month and so far, it's been fine for me. I won't say everything is just peachy because I wrecked my sleep schedule and am a huge procrastinator but overall, considering the schools I've already been to, I think it's wonderful. They're strict on their policies (just trust me on that one), but they really do try to make sure you're doing okay. The teachers offer help if you don't understand anything and there are great tutoring programs too if you don't feel comfortable with a teacher. My Global teacher even offers help with creating a schedule to make sure you aren't overloaded. There's one teacher I particularly don't like, but hey that's just me. There's a lot of clubs here and the school tries to pull you and your parents into practically everything. Oh, check your transportation every day. You don't want to be late.", "Stuyvesant High School is one of most prestigious public high schools in the nation. Despite a lack of student diversity, the faculty excels in preparing students for college. Admission to the school is screened. For me, I found the vast amount of extracurricular activities to choose from really help me understand what I was interested in when I was unsure. At Stuyvesant, competition to be at the top of your class and maintain good grades is especially tough, and so extracurriculars give most people, including me, a life outside of that. One thing I would like to see changed is the attitude of some faculty members after they have been tenured. Very few but still some of them lose their interest in teaching and it is reflected in their students' experience. Overall, though, Stuyvesant High School offers the best education out of any high school in New York City and is among the top in the country.", 'Overrated and I have 34 kids in all my classes, the teachers just don’t care because they can’t care, there are just too many students. Some of the teachers are really nice but I have one or two who are TERRIBLE. Know that if you are thinking about going here, it’s hard af. You have to be really on top of your work and know how to manage time, if you don’t coming in, you need to learn it fast. Even if you do manage time well there’s gonna be a lot of sleepless nights and stressful days. Also the staff is suuuuper rude and disorganized if you need anything to be done involving them you really have to work for it they don’t do anything', 'Stuyvesant is a very good school, there’s not as much pressure as you are told though, it’s not really that bad only if you put that pressure on yourself.  You were probably ode smart at your old school here everybody is smart and that’s what freaks some people out you could go from top of your class to not even above average at this school.  It prepares you well for college, but your gpa would be higher at another school.  I’m in track team that’s dope and there are also a lot of other opportunities in general, you should come here and join sprint team of you’re fast we have a freshman who’s top in the country so we boutta be straight fire out there pull up.', 'A highly competitive high school full of brilliant students as well as caring teachers that are very knowledgeable in their respective fields. The facility is very modern with lots of electives focusing on a variety of fields. The administration is also very helpful with weekly announcements and regular presentations for both students and parents.', "Overall, Stuy offers a full, well-rounded high school experience. It boasts more clubs and sports teams than any other public school in the city, and coupled with its absolutely phenomenal academic departments, prepares its students (perhaps a bit too well) for college and also allows them to properly enjoy the best years of their lives. Being a large school, there's a space for everyone, and it won't take much effort for even the quietest introvert to find their niche. However, the school is very cutthroat and the students actively compete with one another in a race to obtain the best grades. Still, this is to be expected when you pool the greatest teenage minds in the greatest city on earth. Would personally strongly recommend this school to anybody with a passion for learning and a competitive edge.", 'An excellent high school, providing tons of opportunities for students to explore and develop their interests.  Majority of the teachers are loved.   The system for class selection could be more flexible and transparent.', "The school is pretty big as it has 10 floors. Half the escalators and non operational and its pretty hard when you have to transfer from the first to tenth floor. The majority of freshman teachers were pretty nice and the courses aren't too hard. Sometimes, the homework assigned in a day is quite a lot.", 'Stuyvesant HS is a very demanding school, but the teachers are excellent. They will help you acclimatize yourself during freshman year, and help prepare you for college with many AP classes and electives. AIS and Arista tutoring are also available to help you, if that is what you need. The culture at Stuy is also great: the students are generally cooperative.', 'Well, Stuyvesant is a great school that nourishes and sends great people to colleges. Everyone in school was friendly. There were a lot of resources for students. I had a best high school life there. PS: I love escalators!!!', 'Stuyvesant High School is rated number one high school in New York for many reasons. It has hundreds of successful clubs, ranging from STEM to humanities, and even "fun" clubs like board and video games. The teachers teach their subjects rather quickly to allow students to learn the maximum, without overloading too much. The school is also very massive with 10 floors, escalators, and also has the policy to be able to leave school during lunch or free periods (there is a very closeby park called Battery Park) Overall, Stuyvesant has many opportunities that everyone can enjoy.', 'Although the school is very prestigious and difficult at first, as a graduating senior, I now realize how beneficial it was to me and my fellow peers. The competitiveness of the school urges students to keep improving and to not limit themselves academically. Additionally, over 200 clubs allow students to take a break and wind down after hours of stress and tests. +', 'The clubs and activities that they have to offer at Stuyvesant is different from any other school. There are so many resources that other schools do not get to experience and the location of the school is very good as well. Many things to do around there, because it is in the city. School is filled with intelligent people that will succeed environment is very friendly. Some teachers are not the best though.', "The overall atmosphere Stuyvesant can definitely be intimidating. It's not an easy school but it's not impossible. The best part about this school is that the academics are excellent, and most teachers are amazing. The people are really nice and really smart too. It's an excellent environment to challenge yourself and let yourself grow in.", "Okay so, I just want to say right off the bat: Stuyvesant is a school where the students have to practically teach themselves.  The massive loads of homework and readings combined with the teacher's lack of enthusiasm is a terrible combination.  That said -- if you choose you can take part in hundreds of extracurriculars and sports, but most people simply can't.  The workload makes it near impossible.", "Really great school! I've made a ton of friends here and it's great to be in an environment where most people are dedicated to learning and furthering themselves as a person and as a student. The teachers and faculty are also fantastic."]

column6: ['I really like the academics and the school culture there because everyone is supportive and helps each other when we are going through hard times. I also like the clubs and events that the student union funds because there is such a wide range of clubs and many fun events.', 'You will be college ready without a doubt if you go here as the educational environment and your peers will enable you to succeed; however, there is an overemphasis on achievement culture.', "Stuyvesant High School has the most amazing high school community. No matter what your interests are you can find a community of people dedicated to it. Even when you encounter something new, the students are very supportive and welcoming. Our school harbors a competitive yet supportive academic environment. I always felt the need to push myself to my academic limits when surrounded by my peers, but this pressure helped me gain their respect and got me into the college that I wanted. If there is anything in the college application process that you are not sure about, you can always ask your guidance and college counselors. They are available for in-person meetings and phone conversations, and they have made my college application journey easier. Your dedicated student government will listen to your advice, so don't worry about writing them an email, the students there have become my best friends.", "Stuyvesant High School is an incredible school with a student body that is extremely hardworking and determined to succeed in their future careers. Throughout my four years I was always motivated by the students around me who had diverse academic interests both in and out of the classroom. There are so many extracurricular activities to choose from, including clubs, research projects, sports teams, volunteering, etc. In addition, Stuyvesant has amazing, well-educated teachers that care so much about providing their students with an education that surpasses the standard and prepares them for college and beyond. My math, French, and AP US History teachers were the best teachers I've ever had in my life. Overall, attending this school was a great experience.", "Stuyvesant high school really opened my eyes as to how big this world really is. Coming from my local middle school, everybody was just like me: a Bengali-American Muslim living in Jackson Heights, Queens. However, at Stuyvesant, I was exposed  to people of many cultures, religions, ideas, and mindsets. It helped me prepare for college because of how rigorous and big the school was. There was always a sense of competition, yet friendliness in the halls. However, this competition-like atmosphere negatively impacted me. I always felt like I was preparing to do well in school and in college, that I never got to really just enjoy high school. There were many opportunities that helped me grow my passion, yet I still felt out of place. I want to see change in this aspect. There was no need to give me 6 hours of homework a night, giving me little time to even breathe. I felt like I was always trying to do better, not that that's a bad thing, but I never got the time to just sit and smile.", 'Stuyvesant High School has many great resources to provide their students for college readiness and overall skills in the real world. Although the work has the potential to be overwhelming, it enforces a habit to time management within the student.', 'I liked the students and the many classes they had to offer, however the administration and the teaching staff could be improved.', 'The education you can get here is very good compared to many other schools in New York City, but it can get extremely competitive sometimes when everyone is trying to get into top colleges. That being said, there are many activities and courses for students to explore their interests, although the administration makes it hard to take the courses they want because of limited space.', "Although it's stressful and not everything is perfect, I cannot imagine being anywhere else. All the students have high dreams and are constantly striving for them which forces you to always do your best. It can be overwhelming, but the teachers, counselors, adminstration, and resources available help every student handle the workload, learn to time-manage, and become independent in all aspects.", "I like the interior design of the building. I think the aesthetics contribute a lot to feeling motivated and gives a more positive connotation to education than a school with low ceilings and poor lighting. In addition, I appreciate the vast number of extracurriculars; whatever you're interested in, there will be a club that will help you grow in that area and there will be other people that have the same interests as you. Finally, I love how we have more advanced math and science courses in addition to electives, which allows students to really go deeper into a field or major they are interested in. This prepares us really well for college.", 'Stuyvesant High School is very diverse and great in terms of academics. There are a lot to learn and gain out of the experience. It sounds absolutely amazing. You should definitely apply. You gain access to valuable learning experiences.', 'Everyone in Stuy is very nice. Most people are willing to help as long as you are troubled. There are SO many opportunities and activities that could help you find your interest or develop your skills. There are also many hardworking and awesome people.', 'This is an amazing school if you take the test in the first or second year the bill is passed you can still take the shsat but it will be a lot harder to get in study hard because it will be very competitive', 'Increased course selection. Give opportunities for students, great staff, and good academics. Lots of resources.', 'While the overall experience is good and I did learn a lot here, there are just some teachers you wish you never met.', 'Put it first on your application and study hard for the SHSAT, because I swear to the doe gods that stuy will be some of the best 4 years of your life.', 'Extremely amazing high school, however, the school is very competitive and the students in it are also very competitive.', "The school crams a lot of information in your brain which will be useful in college. It's helpful for the ACT and SAT subject tests. Diversity is not good and that should be addressed. Also wide variety in quality of teachers--same subject could look like your best or worst depending on teacher.", "Stuyvesant High School offers the best quality education to their students, as well as diversity. Our student population is enthusiastic about learning, and there are hundreds of clubs that students can choose to further their interests. The school is passionate about college readiness, the environment and the students are very friendly, the school is very clean, and the general atmosphere is incredible. The only complaint is the workload; students spend hours per night on homework and are expected to attend clubs and volunteer. Additionally, it's very hard to stand out in a school of exceptional people.", 'My overall experience as a Stuyvesant student was bittersweet. Being a highly regarded specialized high school, the school required all students to be mentally, emotionally, and physically tough. The curriculum was rigorous, and workload was even heavier. However, with that said, the friends I had made in Stuyvesant had been the greatest thing that has ever happened to me. Although extremely difficult, I would not change a thing about Stuyvesant High School.']
column8: ['This school is very competitive! Honestly, you need to be able to handle stress well or else you will fall behind in school. The administration provides many opportunities for all the students, ranging from scholarships to jobs.', 'Very rigorous classes and coursework. Excellent extracurriculars and support groups. Downside is that it can get overwhelming if you overload on AP classes.', "I liked that Stuyvesant High School attempts to be as inclusive as possible and gives you a chance to improve your academic skills. Parts of Stuyvesant that I would like to change is the student run government. Most of the time, the Student Union and other similar organizations, don't change leaders often. For example, if you were voted as the president for Freshmen Caucus, it is very likely for you to be voted in again for the president for Sophomore Caucus and likewise for the Student Union. Once you get involved, you're always involved and it is difficult to enter once you pass freshmen year if you did not get involved with the Student Union yet.", 'Being in Stuyvesant forces you to develop your time management skills and ability to prioritize, making you more college and career ready. That being said, the workload is tough and stressful. However, there are many clubs and resources Stuyvesant offers to help deal with this stress!', "Stuyvesant has always been a beacon of knowledge and scholarship. There was no doubt  that I was going to this high school ever since I first heard about it. However, after getting in, I realized that more than the rigorous courses  and workload, it was the magnitude of the student body that left an unforgettable first impression. The mere fact that there were more than 3,000 students roaming about in the ten-story building was enough to make me feel like a lost fish swimming in a sea of students just as motivated and in many ways much  more talented than I am. God knows adjusting to this environment took me more effort than I'd ever admit, but the thing that I value the most and have been able to take away from my experience is the relationships and opportunities we can take advantage of—with other students, passionate teachers, or even guidance counselors. I think what I want to say is that Stuyvesant has not broken me; it has molded me into the stronger person I am today.", 'Good school. But it is highly competitive and academically demanding. Most students are super smart.  Not for those laid-back, take-it-easy types.', "People weren't joking when they said that Stuyvesant is stressful. Its is a very academic based school, but still provides a wide variety of extracurricular activities. The school is full of scholarly students and it can be easy to feel self conscious once in a while. What I prefer from the school is that they make a better effort into introducing us to colleges. It would be better if they didnt start right before we are supposed to make our decisions.", 'A heavy grade culture and your experience is based on the teachers you have but there are a ton of opportunities available.', "This school is very stressful and overrated. Colleges won't give a crap if they see you went to Stuyvesant. They will only see your horrible GPA and your tears.", "There were so many opportunities available at this school that I don't think you could get at most high schools, and the fact that you are surrounded by intelligent students drives you work harder.", 'What I love about Stuyvesant is the emphasis that is placed on the individual student. It’s easy and sometimes encouraged to start clubs or organizations, talk with teachers about a subject, or try to change something in the school.', 'While some of the teachers there are pretty bad, the school has a ton of very awesome teachers who make their classes really engaging. I really like the diversity of clubs and extra-curricular activities at Stuyvesant.', 'Stuy is a really engaging community. Most of the teachers are great, there are no sorts of bullying, and the other staff members are so positive and knowledgeable.', 'Great school to attend. great faculty and supportive students. The school is a rigorous yet lovely place to attend. Best four years of my life. Best High School in New York City. Various clubs exist and are open to everyone. The community is very welcoming and unlike any other.', "Loved the abundance of opportunities available. Great facilities and faculty really try their hardest. Teachers are hit or miss, sports aren't great b/c city location.", 'Stuyvesant High School is such a challenging yet supportive school that it helps you with your goals in life.', "What is great about Stuy is that you will find people passionate about all kinds of subjects, teachers who are sincere about what they teach, and an abundant amount of resources available. Many Stuy alum who leave says that the prep we go through is harder and more rigorous than colleges (these are people who go to colleges like MIT and Harvard)! That being said, Stuy takes a physical and mental toll on many students. FYI: I'm a senior of class 2019", 'Stuyvesant High School offered me a large variety of club activities to choose from. The academic courses are rigorous and the teachers are very helpful. The school also offers numerous resources for its students. The students themselves are motivated, talented people who make going to this school a worthwhile experience.', 'Stuyvesant has an amazing community of staff members, teachers, and students. Alum have helped improve the school by donating back. Our parent association also comes together to help raise funds. Within the school, teachers set a challenging pace to help students grow. Students are allowed the freedom to choose their courses. Outside of academics, this school occurs everything from debate to the origami club. There is something for everyone.', 'Stuyvesant High School offers students soooo many extracurriculars that other may not have the opportunity to be a part of in any other school. For example, we have a rowing club, a rubiks cube club, amazing robotics teams, a speech AND debate team, and various other activities. The resources and money available is very abundant. However, teachers overwhelm their students unhealthily with the amount of work they give to the point where one does think oof education as learning but more of memorization and sleepless nights. Some teachers should be more understanding and allow us to balance our life more.']

column2: ['Bergen County Academies is a very good school, classes are engaging and teachers are nice. Great academies, especially science and business.', 'I love the school! I was actually excited to wake up everyday and go there. The classes were enjoyable and as someone who likes challenging work I felt like I was actually using my brain instead of sitting in a class and rotting.', "My time at BCA has been overall very good. The classes are challenging and I have found the academy system (choosing and concentrating on a major) to be extremely rewarding. However, the school's environment encourages student stress and puts pressure on everyone.", 'This school is very challenging and very rewarding. Students are bright and eager to learn, teachers are very competent and ready to help. Research facilities are superb.', "Excellent high school, because it is like going to college. It will help with scholarships and college readiness.Only bad thing is social life, but you'll really learn time management and have a better idea for what you want to do for your career.Teachers are very knowledgeable, and they will push you to work hard.They understand stress, so it's fine to struggle with school. You might feel like everyone is smarter than you, but you will become smarter because your standards will be made higher.", "My time at BCA prepared me well for my undergraduate studies at Stanford University and carried me well into my PhD at Columbia University. In terms of academics and the administration, they're open-minded to all students and have the flexibility to unlock a student's potential.There's an undue focus on the biological sciences, chemistry, and mechanical engineering in terms of their STEM funding and activities, but otherwise they do pretty well.", 'Very rigorous School. Hours are from 8 am to 4:30 pm. Amazing work ethics can be found in this school. Lifelong friends can be made here as everyone here is at the same academic level. Bergen County Academies requires all students to first pass a maths and English test and go through an interview process.', 'Bergen County Academies offers unparalleled opportunities for students to flourish.  Run more like a college than a high school, gives students a great experience to be college ready.  Trips to visit out of state colleges all over the country, and a Junior year weekend conference where college admission officers help students write their college essay. Classes of the highest level with opportunities for research, incredible arts and theater programs, and almost excessive parental involvement. Consistently ranked in the top High Schools in the nation, deservedly so.', "I wouldn't trade my time at BCA for anything. Your experience of the school will be pretty different based on your academy, but I loved mine.", "One's time spent at BCA will heavily be influenced by their academy. Even though each academy has different workloads, there are some academies with bigger workloads than others, meaning students in those academies have to sacrifice more of their time to get the same high grades as students of other academies. Some classes are geared to a specific academy, meaning students only of a certain academy are allowed to take them. However, there are many clubs, electives, societies, and sports students can take to enrich themselves in various ways. Also, the school is structured like college, having multiple free times throughout a day, allowing students to relax, have fun, take extra classes, or work on schoolwork throughout the day.   BCA's student environment can get very competitive, but at end of the day all the students are respected by others. The students thrive with the help of teachers, administrators, and, of course, their peers.", "It's a pressure cooker, but I suppose that's what you would expect from a highly competitive high school. The guidance department is pretty helpful, but most of the school's accomplishments are the results of independent student effort. School spirit wise, there is no school spirit, but what the school lacks in school spirit it makes up for in academic zeal.", 'Bergen County Academies is a very rigorous school and is known mostly for STEM. There will be a big emphasis on these classes no matter what program you’re in. Everyone is very competitive, and this makes the social aspect unappealing to many, but if you want to be prepared for college, this is the place to go.', 'The environment at the Bergen County Academies is sometimes too competitive. Sports and school spirit are lacking from time to time, as they are not given much importance. However, it is excellent for college preparedness and will let you meet some of the most interesting people.', "Amazing amazing people– the people I've met here are supportive beyond measure and have had a deep impact on me. Just don't focus too much on academics, like don't attach your self worth to it and stuff. H e l p I m T r y i n g T o H i t T h e 1 0 0 C h a r a c t e r M i n i m u m .", "The kids at this school are really smart, but most are incredibly socially awkward, often to the point where you wonder how they got in.  Most people in administration don't seem to care about the students, and there is a lot of red tape about changing classes or altering your schedule.  This is an issue because there are enough awful teachers that you really wish you could switch easily.  However, they offer a lot of advanced classes so if you are really passionate it could be a positive experience.", "Bergen County Academies is one of the best schools in New Jersey. This is due to the fact of concertation based classes. However you take very driven kids who know what they want to do in their lives and put them in an environment with a ton of work where they can't succeed as easily, and they begin drowning because they know what they want to do, but now they have no time. Workload reduction or time management classes would be beneficial. I do believe that we are given a lot of privileges at BCA that other schools do not have like. Essentially Bergen county academies are run as a college.  The people there are some of the nicest you'll meet, and I think that overall the school is better than any other option, but it defiantly has its stressors and significant faults that could use improvement.", 'Overall I have a had a positive experience at Bergen County Academies. It has provided me with the resources to pursue research and projects of my own interests and given me the chance make lasting friendships.', 'Bergen County Academies provides an academically rigorous environment for students to thrive within, pursuing their interests through their academy specfic classes as well as out of class opportunities such as through sports, clubs, electives, etc.', 'This school is exactly what you think it is--among the best of the best in that special slice of land you call the USA. Who cares if this is New Jersey? The school works for what it is.', 'Academically challenging- pro: variety of opportunities available and prepare well for college/university life; con: can be stressful at times']
column4: ['Bergen County Academies is a very good school, classes are engaging and teachers are nice. Great academies, especially science and business.', 'I love the school! I was actually excited to wake up everyday and go there. The classes were enjoyable and as someone who likes challenging work I felt like I was actually using my brain instead of sitting in a class and rotting.', "My time at BCA has been overall very good. The classes are challenging and I have found the academy system (choosing and concentrating on a major) to be extremely rewarding. However, the school's environment encourages student stress and puts pressure on everyone.", 'This school is very challenging and very rewarding. Students are bright and eager to learn, teachers are very competent and ready to help. Research facilities are superb.', "Excellent high school, because it is like going to college. It will help with scholarships and college readiness.Only bad thing is social life, but you'll really learn time management and have a better idea for what you want to do for your career.Teachers are very knowledgeable, and they will push you to work hard.They understand stress, so it's fine to struggle with school. You might feel like everyone is smarter than you, but you will become smarter because your standards will be made higher.", "My time at BCA prepared me well for my undergraduate studies at Stanford University and carried me well into my PhD at Columbia University. In terms of academics and the administration, they're open-minded to all students and have the flexibility to unlock a student's potential.There's an undue focus on the biological sciences, chemistry, and mechanical engineering in terms of their STEM funding and activities, but otherwise they do pretty well.", 'Very rigorous School. Hours are from 8 am to 4:30 pm. Amazing work ethics can be found in this school. Lifelong friends can be made here as everyone here is at the same academic level. Bergen County Academies requires all students to first pass a maths and English test and go through an interview process.', 'Bergen County Academies offers unparalleled opportunities for students to flourish.  Run more like a college than a high school, gives students a great experience to be college ready.  Trips to visit out of state colleges all over the country, and a Junior year weekend conference where college admission officers help students write their college essay. Classes of the highest level with opportunities for research, incredible arts and theater programs, and almost excessive parental involvement. Consistently ranked in the top High Schools in the nation, deservedly so.', "I wouldn't trade my time at BCA for anything. Your experience of the school will be pretty different based on your academy, but I loved mine.", "One's time spent at BCA will heavily be influenced by their academy. Even though each academy has different workloads, there are some academies with bigger workloads than others, meaning students in those academies have to sacrifice more of their time to get the same high grades as students of other academies. Some classes are geared to a specific academy, meaning students only of a certain academy are allowed to take them. However, there are many clubs, electives, societies, and sports students can take to enrich themselves in various ways. Also, the school is structured like college, having multiple free times throughout a day, allowing students to relax, have fun, take extra classes, or work on schoolwork throughout the day.   BCA's student environment can get very competitive, but at end of the day all the students are respected by others. The students thrive with the help of teachers, administrators, and, of course, their peers.", "It's a pressure cooker, but I suppose that's what you would expect from a highly competitive high school. The guidance department is pretty helpful, but most of the school's accomplishments are the results of independent student effort. School spirit wise, there is no school spirit, but what the school lacks in school spirit it makes up for in academic zeal.", 'Bergen County Academies is a very rigorous school and is known mostly for STEM. There will be a big emphasis on these classes no matter what program you’re in. Everyone is very competitive, and this makes the social aspect unappealing to many, but if you want to be prepared for college, this is the place to go.', 'The environment at the Bergen County Academies is sometimes too competitive. Sports and school spirit are lacking from time to time, as they are not given much importance. However, it is excellent for college preparedness and will let you meet some of the most interesting people.', "Amazing amazing people– the people I've met here are supportive beyond measure and have had a deep impact on me. Just don't focus too much on academics, like don't attach your self worth to it and stuff. H e l p I m T r y i n g T o H i t T h e 1 0 0 C h a r a c t e r M i n i m u m .", "The kids at this school are really smart, but most are incredibly socially awkward, often to the point where you wonder how they got in.  Most people in administration don't seem to care about the students, and there is a lot of red tape about changing classes or altering your schedule.  This is an issue because there are enough awful teachers that you really wish you could switch easily.  However, they offer a lot of advanced classes so if you are really passionate it could be a positive experience.", "Bergen County Academies is one of the best schools in New Jersey. This is due to the fact of concertation based classes. However you take very driven kids who know what they want to do in their lives and put them in an environment with a ton of work where they can't succeed as easily, and they begin drowning because they know what they want to do, but now they have no time. Workload reduction or time management classes would be beneficial. I do believe that we are given a lot of privileges at BCA that other schools do not have like. Essentially Bergen county academies are run as a college.  The people there are some of the nicest you'll meet, and I think that overall the school is better than any other option, but it defiantly has its stressors and significant faults that could use improvement.", 'Overall I have a had a positive experience at Bergen County Academies. It has provided me with the resources to pursue research and projects of my own interests and given me the chance make lasting friendships.', 'Bergen County Academies provides an academically rigorous environment for students to thrive within, pursuing their interests through their academy specfic classes as well as out of class opportunities such as through sports, clubs, electives, etc.', 'This school is exactly what you think it is--among the best of the best in that special slice of land you call the USA. Who cares if this is New Jersey? The school works for what it is.', 'Academically challenging- pro: variety of opportunities available and prepare well for college/university life; con: can be stressful at times']
column6: ['I loved the people I met and the opportunities I had. We knew going in how lucky we were to be accepted to this school, and I definitely felt honored to have so many valuable experiences and to have made so many special friends through my time in high school. At times, the course load was difficult and it was hard to schedule my time, but it was worth it and it taught me a lot about time management.', 'Toxic environment where kids are overworked, over competitive, and generally unhappy. Grades become students’ lives and everything else is devalued. Friends steal opportunities from each other. Horrible place to be as a teenager.', 'Honestly one of the best high schools you can go to. It has everything a student could need, regardless of what you want to study. Having the opportunity to pick an "academy" is very similar to picking a major and is a great way to prepare for college. The one and only downside is that you can\'t switch academies after you apply.', 'Bergen County Academies, for my grade at least, chose a very supportive group of students who I enjoyed going to school with. I knew that if I wanted to try something different, I would find support from my friends. The atmosphere of the school is not competitive, but the school work is challenging and students learn a lot about time management.', 'Bergen county academies is undeniably one of the best schools in New Jersey although there remains things need improvement. The needed improvement goes to show how much the United States education system needs to change. Some things that I would like to see implemented are more freedom regarding having time to do activities that we enjoy and want to pursue in life, but with all the opportunities BCA does have such as senior internships, academies and passion projects do an excellent job of doing so.', 'Bergen County Academies certainly offers a unique range of opportunities for high school students with only the best resources devoted toward educational advancement. After a long admissions process, students of BCA are enrolled in one of seven academies, or majors, where they are able to take part in high level medical research, earn spots in competitive orchestras, and have access to a Bloomberg Terminal- one of just two owned by a high school in the United States. The environment is far more welcoming than that of most other public high schools and the atmosphere is one of trust and comfort- to the point where students frequently leave their belongings unguarded without the fear of them being stolen. The availability of clubs, competitions, and activities is unrivaled at BCA and the rigorous courses and intense workload makes the school a place known to prepare its students for college very adequately.', 'BCA prepares students extremely well for their next steps - whether it is entering college or the business world.', 'BCA cares more about having a competitive environment than a nurturing one. Students brag about grades and lack of sleep, since they were doing hw. We\'ve had assemblies telling us that we can\'t even have study groups because it "gives certain students an unfair advantage" and about how we all need to work for ourselves. I\'ve had teachers who were intentionally as bad as they could be so that they wouldn\'t have to teach the next year (teachers at BCA aren\'t fired, they\'re transferred to other positions). There is blatant racism against students who aren’t white or asian, which the school ignores. Finally, many of the reports by the administration are misleading: the drop out percentage for my grade is about 6% with more than 15 students having dropped out (this isn\'t counted as dropping out by the admin tho, since they still graduate from other high schools).', 'Bergen County Academies is a great high school to attend if you are looking for a challenge. It is most definitely more difficult than your local town high school, and it is not for the faint of heart. There will be many nights spent studying, and a lot of time being spent on school work.That being said, BCA is a school that not many, if not none, regret coming to.  The school prepares you for college like no other. You are forced to learn how to utilize your time wisely, with opportunities such as free periods available to savor or to squander. Secondly, the classes, clubs, projects, and electives offered are countless. There are so many opportunities to take hold of. Lastly, the people at this school are amazing, passionate, and work hard to accomplish their goals. There is much to learn at this school, whether it be about chemistry, building relationships, or time management. No matter what, one thing is for certain; I would not trade this high school for anything else.', "The competition isn't as high as people say it is, just put in what you want to get out of it. There are so many classes and electives to choose from; this was one of the biggest reasons I chose BCA.", 'Work Load is high but its worth it.  Most teachers are good. Very competitive.  You do have free time during school', "BCA has a lot of different opportunities that other high schools can't offer. From amazing people to Senior Experience to research opportunities, this school has it all. The workload is stressful, the hours are long, and you won't get a lot of sleep, but it all pales in comparison to the environment you're put in, with so many bright students who are all very supportive. Drama is very rare and everyone gets along with each other.", "The school is great for the highly motivated student. The teachers and academics are nice as well but expect a heavy course load at times. There's plenty of extracurriculars and clubs that you'll fit into and you'll make many friends along the way. The culture can sometimes be pretty toxic though as sometimes grades are talked about pretty openly and stress can become pretty common. Would I recommend the school though? Yes, its an amazing experience and  you'll be able to challenge yourself academically.", 'Excellent academic school.  However, the stress put on the students is a bit much.  The work load needs to be reduced in order to allow the kids to have more of a well-rounded experience.  Although the students do take advantage of the extracurricular opportunities, it does come at a price.  Many kids get no sleep as a result.  The teachers are well aware of the stress level of the kids and do their best to assist.  But the administration must address this issue.', 'I had a great 4 years at BCA. It was definitely an experience unlike any other school. They do a great job in term of college preparation however, sometimes they do take themselves too seriously. Administration and guidance is a little bit lacking however, the students themselves are some of the brightest kids you will find a in a long time. I am proud to be an alumni. Get ready to work hard for the next 4 years but you will be surrounded with the best of the best.', 'It is an excellent magnet school with abundant resources and first class faculty to work with the talented students from all over Bergen County to reach their highest academic potentials.  Students are well trained and have a balanced life at the Academies.', "I have made the most amazing friends and even though there are some things to complain about, that's true everywhere and overall this school has set me up really well and benefited me more than it hurt.", 'My experience was very good here. I was academically challenged and I believe I am prepared for attending college next year. Administration recently changed so a lot of new things have been implemented, most that I have not been a fan of, but I hope to see it work out. I hope to see the more creative academies get some more recognition though.', 'The challenging, competitive atmosphere of Bergen County Academies (BCA) provided students with a rigorous environment similar to what they would experience in college. In this way, BCA prepares students for the amount of coursework and the level of difficulty that they will ultimately face during their college career. However, while some teachers are extremely knowledgable in their respective fields, many do not teach well and do not encourage students to pursue their interests due to the amount of difficulty and confusion that they encounter during the course. Additionally, there is a heavy focus on STEM rather than the humanities. The STEM courses offered have more resources and are given more attention than the humanities courses. The student counseling offered at BCA has also been known to be unhelpful, and discourages students to reach out during their struggles.', "In terms of academics and college readiness, there is no doubt that BCA excels in this area. However, the culture at this school definitely can change. Stress and no sleep is basically a norm, it is almost odd to be getting more than 5 hours a day. It can cultivate an unhealthy mindset of what is failing or doing well. There have been instances of teachers embarrassing students in class for whatever grades they receive. Of course it's important to clarify that this does not make up the entirety of BCA. There are teachers, counselors, and faculty members that clearly care and have been nothing short of amazing. However, it's also important to note this school may not be the best place for mental wellness. In addition, there is a clear disconnect between the administrators and students. As far as activities, there is a lot of people to meet and a lot to be involved in, so take advantage of it. BCA has been mixed with the good and the bad. How to perceive it depends on you!"]
column8: ['As a current junior at this school, I must say that despite the difficulties that I faced academically, I have no regrets applying here. This school has become my home away from home. I would not have the opportunities I have here in any other school, especially because I am in the Academy of Visual and Performing Arts. I learned and am continuing to learn so much about art that I would never be able to in a regular high school setting. But the greatest thing about applying here personally was the people I met. I thought I would struggle in finding people like me but ended up meeting so many of my best friends in the past 3 years. <3', 'Bergen County Academies really does prepare you for college, even though your years at the school will be difficult. While taking college courses, I breeze though because of everything I learnt from high school, especially time management skills.', 'Overall, the school is great. The academics and student body are very good. The teachers are also helpful.', 'While BCA offers many unique opportunities including research, advanced classes, internships and an environment to grow as an independent person, I was not rewarded by my hard work.  I took advantage of many opportunities, worked very hard in my classes and sacrificed a normal high school experience.  After four years of working hard, I was not admitted to schools I believe I have earned the ability to go to and seeing others with lower credentials get accepted only furthered my distaste for BCA.  Overall I am leaving this school an overall smarter and more independent person, however, I was not rewarded for my hard work when it came to where I will be attending college next year.', 'So many students claim to hate this school, but secretly most of us prefer this to our town high school. Is there a lot of work? yes. Is there stress? Of course. Does this school prepare me for college? absolutely. Overall, there are so many opportunities at this high school compared to a typical high school that us students take for granted. While there are the few teachers who are not understanding and make the overall experience worse, I have found my closest friends and most amazing teachers at this school. It all depends on your mindset coming here. If you think you are going to hate it, you probably will. If you keep an open mind and remember the long-term opportunities stemming from this school, you will realize how truly lucky you are to go here.', 'I think that this is a great environment for kids to become both great students and people.  What is learned here reaches further than what textbooks can do.', 'BCA provides one of the most academically challenging educations in New Jersey. It is widely rated as one of the best schools in the United States. It has great facilities, lots of opportunities to succeed, and prepares one for college, but this comes with its own problems. Due to the academic focus of all the students, there is a culture of pure academic focus with minimal focus on social interactions. The culture in bca is purely academically focused, but it does not matter what your interests are, if you are admitted to bca, nearly all students are very friendly.', "Honestly, I am happy I came to BCA. I am a Med freshman, who would not have nearly as many opportunities to succeed if I went to my town high school. However, BCA is extremely hard and you have to really want your goals for this school to be worth it. My advice: Don't come here unless you are ready to compete in everything you do, and are willing to give up your sleep to succeed.", 'Bergen County Academies is an extremely competitive school. Not only is the curriculum vigorous, but the students are also very studious and diligent. As a current student, I believe that the administration should be more lenient. There are so many unnecessary detentions that, frankly, is very upsetting. However, the academics is extremely challenging, even if the workload should be lightened up more to allow students to feel more relaxed, especially since everyone is extremely stressed with in school and out of school activities.', 'BCA offered an incredible community of intelligent, collaborative, and highly-motivated students and incredible faculty that really challenged me to keep improving myself in academics, extracurriculars, and social situations. The work load certainly was stressful at times, but the depth of the classes and assignments prepared me very well for my first year of college, especially when it came to science courses and time management.', "I love BCA. Opportunities and possibilities are endless, and everyone's always pushing you to be better.", 'I liked the rigor of the courses at Bergen County Academies and the opportunities for research and competitions would not be available to me otherwise. However, I have consistently felt that the administration did not value the voice of the students. Many of the problems at this school arise from the fact that the administration does not communicate effectively with students. Many teachers are very knowledgeable in their respective subject area but do not have experience in teaching it just in knowing it. This causes a lot of information to be thrown at the students without being properly explained to the students. Finally, the long school day could be shortened and start later in the day to allow students to sleep in which would assist the large amount of coursework and overworking culture at BCA.', 'Unbeatable academics and preparation for college. Knowledgeable, helpful teachers. Talented and friendly students. My experience at the Bergen County Academies has been amazing.If you are applying, I suggest the science, engineering, computer science, and business academies (if you are interested in these subjects/related careers).', 'Bergen County Academies is a school that will definitely prepare you for life. This idea of an institution where students are focused on their education builds an atmosphere that is upbuilding and inspirational for all. After the competitive application, the number of resources and opportunities are endless for anyone. The clubs, projects, and electives distinguish BCA by offering courses that fit with all interests. In addition, the free time in between classes makes this school seem more manageable and convenient. Also, the sports here are incredible but require a lot of commitment. In reality, however, BCA is overwhelming as the rigorous classes, successful and intelligent teachers, and high standards placed upon the students make life seem impossible to conquer. However, I think BCA puts this stress on us, the students, in order for us to prepare for real life. This means that the complexity of this school makes our future seem brighter, more accessible, and approachable.', 'Yes, this school is prestigious and rigorous. However, this leaves you little time for other activities. Your whole life revolves around academics. While some teachers are helpful and knowledgeable, others are bullies and make you feel stupid for not understanding something. A lot of the teachers don’t teach but still expect you to know the material. Competition is toxic at this school. Students always try to outdo each other, and it leaves you feeling stressed all the time. Cheating is common, but nothing is done about it. All the students want to go to an Ivy League school, and end up feeling like a failure if they don’t get in.', 'Bergen County Academies is what would be expected of a public magnet high school. The opportunities in academics, research, and clubs are immense and students can really do what they want to do. The schedule is unique in that there is free time throughout the day to do homework, socializing, or taking more classes. The work culture is not for everyone as it can be intensive at times and students complain/brag about how little sleep they get. The school day is the longest in New Jersey (8:00AM-4:10PM) and the bus can add up to 3 hours to that (6:35AM-5:30PM). Teachers are required to be intelligent, but some are not the best at actually teaching. Overall, nerd culture reigns supreme and going here a student will learn a lot both in knowledge and other skills like time management, but they may have to give external activities in the process.', 'One of the issues with BCA is how little you sleep. The workload is a shock as a freshman, and is very intense and rigorous throughout the four years. There is a lot of toxic competition in the school, which leads to a lot of negative emotion and feelings of failure.', 'Bergen County Academies has prepared me for my future. I have had a wonderful experience with other students as well as teachers. My knowledge has expanded beyond what I expected.', 'The teachers here don’t teach and they expect you to know so much. They’ll assign a reading and yell at you if you don’t know what something is and expect you to know it without even teaching you. The teachers don’t care about mental health at all and every student wonders why they are still they and why they don’t just transfer out. Kids are always distressed and teachers never care. It seems like they’re setting you up for failure and if you’re not as smart as everyone else then teachers will look down on you and make fun of you. It is a miserable place to be.', 'Since I applied here last year, in a good way, I am a different person. I am more self- confident because of all the amazing people and opportunities there are. Although the work is challenging, it will prepare me better for college.']

column2: ['High Technology High School is a great school with a strong focus on its students, offering all the resources they would need for college and beyond.', 'All around terrible experience.  You will be constantly stressed.  If you want to have a life outside of school don’t come.  It won’t even help you much for college because at your home high school you will get way better grades, have more time for extra-curricular stuff, and more time to focus on SAT prep.  Worst place ever', "It's a super stressful and competitive environment. If you aren't interested in engineering or think you might enjoy something else, do not even think about applying. Class choices are extremely limited so if you're hoping to explore, this is not the place from you. School spirit is pretty low. However, I have made a lot of amazing friends here and if I was given the choice to go somewhere else, I'd say no simply because of them.", 'Overall, my high school experience has been anything but ordinary. HTHS as a school demands hard work and dedication to your studies, and if you are not able to work at this high caliber and keep up with the rigorous coarse work, you can find yourself in a bit of trouble. All of the teachers are wonderful and supportive, and are really some of the best teachers I have every had. The students are competitive, but that is to be expected when you are thrown in a pool with so many intelligent and driven people. Although some students prefer to read their physics textbooks over having face-to-face human conversations, HTHS is charming in a nerdy way. Accommodations for health issues, however, are far and few in between which really puts a damper on all of the other positive attributes of the school. However, High Tech is still a great school full of opportunities for those willing to work hard and take on the challenge that is High Technology High School.', "It's a rather typical magnet STEM school. Probably better than the average school in the area, but not amazing per se.", 'I liked the sense of community in the school throughout my years here. I am able to ask for help whenever I want because of the strong connections here. One thing I would change is introduce more diversity in the current clubs, such as adding more language-based clubs.', "It's an easy place to make a group of very close friends considering that each class has around 80 students. The academics are challenging and a lot of classes are hands-on with project-based learning.", 'HTHS is very rigorous and challenging, but incredibly academically rewarding, particularly (but definitely not only) if you end up wanting to pursue a STEM-related field in college.', 'Competitive yet loving atmosphere. Small school where everyone seems like family. STEM focused so you get to learn a lot about engineering and other technologies.', 'There are so many opportunities at High Technology High School to engage in engineering, as it is a project based school.  I love the academic rigor, and the school surrounds me with a ton of friendly people who also share my interests in academics, especially engineering.  I would definitely recommend this school to others.', 'I want to love my school but I don’t. It’s definitely geared toward very smart males, particularly in the area of math. Yet, I don’t feel so challanged. Socially, it’s meh. There are very few clubs or sports and not much school spirit. If your parent is a doctor or engineer, you’re going to be better off, but monitority groups win at all things academic. I started out at Stuyvesant and was much happier and more challanged. Also, it’s not uncommon for every other person to be on “smart meds” and drugs are prevalent.', 'High Technology was a disappointing experience. The teachers at this school are a mixed bag, with some being excellent and some being lackluster. There is no social life at this school, and the workload can be excessive.', "The coursework is mostly focused on engineering rather than software, no matter what anyone tells you. It's pretty clique-y and school-sanctioned social gatherings get pretty awkward. Plus, there's really no creative outlet - most people go back to their sending district for sports and music.", 'High Technology High School has many interesting and enjoyable classes, and I have gotten many opportunities here that I could not get at any other high school. The school culture is a great part of the school as well. I feel like I can relate to everyone in my grade.', "At High Tech, I feel like I've overall learned to handle a high-stress environment, and I've advance pretty far in STEM classes, as the teaching is great here. However, I wish we were put under much less pressure to be #1 at everything, because it makes joining new clubs and activities quite intimidating.", 'The school has outstanding faculty and a great community of students. Since the class size is so small, everyone is really close. This means that your friend group is pretty much the entire class. I feel this is unique and is a huge contributor to student ability to work together on projects, assignments, and studying.', 'High Technology High School is a perfect fit for our son.The school teaches the students to study properly and all the students are like minded in wanting the best education.the campus is beautiful.The teachers are the best and work very well with the students.', 'There are a lot of excellent teachers who really care about the kids.  There are also lots of opportunities that other school districts may not even be aware of.  My son has competed in Technology Student Association, which he has won on the state level and went on to compete in the national tournament.  He has also competed in several hack-a-thons, which are really rewarding experiences.  He entered into a math competition at Princeton with classmates, placing pretty high for their first time.  All freshman enter into a state-wide science fair, his team having won a prize for their submission.   The teachers and fellow classmates are very supportive and encouraging, it is a wonderful place to go to school.', 'So far my experience at HTHS has been pretty good. The classes are engaging, the teachers are slightly lax, but pretty knowledgeable. Most of the students are nice and willing to help each other out.However, even as a sophomore, the workload could be very overwhelming, resulting in just a few hours of sleep every night. A few students actually drop out Overall, attending HTHS is a great decision for me; I couldn\'t imagine myself being in any other school. We have a diverse student body here, all students are involved in extracurricular activities (yes we have many varsity athletes despite being a nerd school). Unlike many teens in the "regular" high schools, kids in this school don\'t really party and stuff because we are too focused on school work. If you are a middle school student interested in STEM, you should considering applying here; you\'ll meet people who have the same interest as you and the best facilities to guide you through high school.', 'Great STEM school that offers a ton of research opportunities. Diversity is lacking due to it being test in']
column4: ['High Technology High School is a great school with a strong focus on its students, offering all the resources they would need for college and beyond.', 'All around terrible experience.  You will be constantly stressed.  If you want to have a life outside of school don’t come.  It won’t even help you much for college because at your home high school you will get way better grades, have more time for extra-curricular stuff, and more time to focus on SAT prep.  Worst place ever', "It's a super stressful and competitive environment. If you aren't interested in engineering or think you might enjoy something else, do not even think about applying. Class choices are extremely limited so if you're hoping to explore, this is not the place from you. School spirit is pretty low. However, I have made a lot of amazing friends here and if I was given the choice to go somewhere else, I'd say no simply because of them.", 'Overall, my high school experience has been anything but ordinary. HTHS as a school demands hard work and dedication to your studies, and if you are not able to work at this high caliber and keep up with the rigorous coarse work, you can find yourself in a bit of trouble. All of the teachers are wonderful and supportive, and are really some of the best teachers I have every had. The students are competitive, but that is to be expected when you are thrown in a pool with so many intelligent and driven people. Although some students prefer to read their physics textbooks over having face-to-face human conversations, HTHS is charming in a nerdy way. Accommodations for health issues, however, are far and few in between which really puts a damper on all of the other positive attributes of the school. However, High Tech is still a great school full of opportunities for those willing to work hard and take on the challenge that is High Technology High School.', "It's a rather typical magnet STEM school. Probably better than the average school in the area, but not amazing per se.", 'I liked the sense of community in the school throughout my years here. I am able to ask for help whenever I want because of the strong connections here. One thing I would change is introduce more diversity in the current clubs, such as adding more language-based clubs.', "It's an easy place to make a group of very close friends considering that each class has around 80 students. The academics are challenging and a lot of classes are hands-on with project-based learning.", 'HTHS is very rigorous and challenging, but incredibly academically rewarding, particularly (but definitely not only) if you end up wanting to pursue a STEM-related field in college.', 'Competitive yet loving atmosphere. Small school where everyone seems like family. STEM focused so you get to learn a lot about engineering and other technologies.', 'There are so many opportunities at High Technology High School to engage in engineering, as it is a project based school.  I love the academic rigor, and the school surrounds me with a ton of friendly people who also share my interests in academics, especially engineering.  I would definitely recommend this school to others.', 'I want to love my school but I don’t. It’s definitely geared toward very smart males, particularly in the area of math. Yet, I don’t feel so challanged. Socially, it’s meh. There are very few clubs or sports and not much school spirit. If your parent is a doctor or engineer, you’re going to be better off, but monitority groups win at all things academic. I started out at Stuyvesant and was much happier and more challanged. Also, it’s not uncommon for every other person to be on “smart meds” and drugs are prevalent.', 'High Technology was a disappointing experience. The teachers at this school are a mixed bag, with some being excellent and some being lackluster. There is no social life at this school, and the workload can be excessive.', "The coursework is mostly focused on engineering rather than software, no matter what anyone tells you. It's pretty clique-y and school-sanctioned social gatherings get pretty awkward. Plus, there's really no creative outlet - most people go back to their sending district for sports and music.", 'High Technology High School has many interesting and enjoyable classes, and I have gotten many opportunities here that I could not get at any other high school. The school culture is a great part of the school as well. I feel like I can relate to everyone in my grade.', "At High Tech, I feel like I've overall learned to handle a high-stress environment, and I've advance pretty far in STEM classes, as the teaching is great here. However, I wish we were put under much less pressure to be #1 at everything, because it makes joining new clubs and activities quite intimidating.", 'The school has outstanding faculty and a great community of students. Since the class size is so small, everyone is really close. This means that your friend group is pretty much the entire class. I feel this is unique and is a huge contributor to student ability to work together on projects, assignments, and studying.', 'High Technology High School is a perfect fit for our son.The school teaches the students to study properly and all the students are like minded in wanting the best education.the campus is beautiful.The teachers are the best and work very well with the students.', 'There are a lot of excellent teachers who really care about the kids.  There are also lots of opportunities that other school districts may not even be aware of.  My son has competed in Technology Student Association, which he has won on the state level and went on to compete in the national tournament.  He has also competed in several hack-a-thons, which are really rewarding experiences.  He entered into a math competition at Princeton with classmates, placing pretty high for their first time.  All freshman enter into a state-wide science fair, his team having won a prize for their submission.   The teachers and fellow classmates are very supportive and encouraging, it is a wonderful place to go to school.', 'So far my experience at HTHS has been pretty good. The classes are engaging, the teachers are slightly lax, but pretty knowledgeable. Most of the students are nice and willing to help each other out.However, even as a sophomore, the workload could be very overwhelming, resulting in just a few hours of sleep every night. A few students actually drop out Overall, attending HTHS is a great decision for me; I couldn\'t imagine myself being in any other school. We have a diverse student body here, all students are involved in extracurricular activities (yes we have many varsity athletes despite being a nerd school). Unlike many teens in the "regular" high schools, kids in this school don\'t really party and stuff because we are too focused on school work. If you are a middle school student interested in STEM, you should considering applying here; you\'ll meet people who have the same interest as you and the best facilities to guide you through high school.', 'Great STEM school that offers a ton of research opportunities. Diversity is lacking due to it being test in']
column6: ['High Technology High School is a great school with a strong focus on its students, offering all the resources they would need for college and beyond.', 'All around terrible experience.  You will be constantly stressed.  If you want to have a life outside of school don’t come.  It won’t even help you much for college because at your home high school you will get way better grades, have more time for extra-curricular stuff, and more time to focus on SAT prep.  Worst place ever', "It's a super stressful and competitive environment. If you aren't interested in engineering or think you might enjoy something else, do not even think about applying. Class choices are extremely limited so if you're hoping to explore, this is not the place from you. School spirit is pretty low.
