column8: ['HTHS has given me a once in a lifetime experience. The competitive environment of the school makes me want to strive for the best and to work hard. However, HTHS has also decreased my self-confidence and it makes me focus on things that are not the most important. There are many things outside of academia that are just as important.', "High Tech is very diverse; our student population is composed of different people of different races and religions. All races and religions are accepted in our school. Sexual orientation does not affect anybody's ability to have relationships with other students. We are a diverse and accepting community.", "Students don't do drugs and don't get hurt often. Bullying does not occur and we all trust each other as we all leave our lockers open throughout the day. We always feel safe in school.", 'Overall, I enjoyed my time at High Tech. Of course, there were ups and downs, but I would come back again if I could do it all over. The best time of the year is Field Day as each class comes together in order to defeat the other classes. The amount of comradeship really shines through on Field Day. It also proves that High Tech students can be athletic and smart. The engineering projects were also enjoyable but I definitely wish that I would have done a few things different with them. The only thing that I hated about High Tech was that I got very little sleep due to the overwhelming amounts of work.', "We don't actually have a cafeteria. We order food from Brookdale Community College. We are allowed to eat in the MPR or outside. Brookdale does not have a super large variety of foods, but the food is good. There are many snacks sold at our school.", 'Overall, High Tech teachers are the best. They all are experts in their field and have received high levels of education. Some of our teachers genuinely care for us and interact with us on an equal level. If we ever need help, all we have to do is ask for help, and they will provide help. Our teacher uses a variety of teaching styles and assessments. Our teachers are very consistent with grading and do not play favorites while they are grading.', "Over the past 4 years, I've joined a variety of clubs. I've joined the Yearbook Club, TSA, Robotics Club, the French Club, the Ping Pong Club, they Key Club, and the CRY Club. These clubs are well organized and are lead by committed officers. Some clubs participate in competitions and others just allow students to unwind. Clubs give us a break from our rigorous studies. I believe that clubs play a large part of the High Tech community, and without them, it wouldn't be the same.", 'HTHS is extremely safe, and there are few places that I feel more comfortable.', 'Sophomores and upperclassmen can go to Brookdale for lunch, and they serve pretty good food.', 'Administrators are great and the policies are very lenient. The staff are extremely friendly and they handle things well.', "HTHS isn't big on athletics, but phys. ed. is fun and the activities are good.", "Teachers are great, and there's really no issue. Most teachers are highly, if not overly, qualified.", 'There are no official sports, but students can walk over to Brookdale and play on the courts after school. Students have tons of academic clubs to choose from.', 'we get our food shipped over from nearby Brookdale Community College Cafeteria. Also, Juniors and Seniors are able to walk over to the cafeteria and purchase their own food.', 'Great teachers for the most part. We even have some PhD holders as teachers.', "We actually don't have any sports stuff. We mooch off of Brookdale Community College for our Gym class and we have no teams. Student must participate at their sending district schools if they want to be involved in any sports programs.", "If you've heard of Model UN or TSA, COME TO THIS SCHOOL. We are the school that everyone else wishes wasn't there because we win everything.", 'While the school nurse is iffy, all other concerns for health and safety are merit-less. The school is exceedingly safe to the point where it is annoying.', 'The school is unique in that starting in freshman year and continuing onward students are required to take college level courses in Engineering (through Project lead the Way curriculum). Else wise, everything is honors/AP level and  there is a high workload, but it is manageable at the expense of some of the students social life.', 'Second best facility in the state. The school itself is only a decade old, so most everything is nice and pretty and new.']

column2: ['The teachers are phenomenal. They will work hard to help you, along with fellow students who recognize the competition but support each other nonetheless.', 'Although academics and the culture at Magnet can be overwhelming at times, it is still a great school. I feel like the competitive culture helped me become a better student and person. Even though the school is very STEM orientated, there are still activities where students are able to express their creativity (board decorating, creativity corner) and there are many fun events throughout the school year. The teachers are great, and even though classes are hard they are very enjoyable. Overall, I am very happy I went to Magnet and think it is a great school.', 'No sports.  Need to go to your local high school for sports. By the time you get home from Magnet you have missed practice.Magnet does not offer AP Computer Science only in AITMagnet does not offer foreign languages other than Spanish.Magnet takes 2 years to get through BC calculus.  Local HS only one year.Some teachers are great, some are down right terrible.  They get fired and re hired regularly because of their contracts.Facilities are pretty poor.  Bad furniture etc.Students are strong - teachers not so much.', 'Magnet High School is a great place to attend, especially when planning on entering a STEM field. However, the competitiveness of the school makes it difficult to stand out as individual, especially to colleges.', 'I am SO looking forward to going to College! Our alumni all say that they feel college was much easier compared to our 4 years here. So I am fearless, excited and I truly feel well prepared. It was beyond rigorous but so worth every second for the preparations I received.', 'I would like to see more clubs and more afterschool activities. Otherwise, this is an excellent school that is preparing my son very well for college.', 'Union County Magnet High School is an excellent school! The student community feels like family and the teachers are available to their students often. It’s a very safe environment both physically and emotionally. There are no sports through Magnet, but students can participate in the programs of their “sending districts”, which is nice. It would be great if they fixed the sinks in the bathrooms, but other than that there isn’t much to complain about.', "Union County Magnet High School is a great school if you want to be prepared for the college experience. It's rigorous and lots of graduates have felt college is a breeze in comparison. Teachers are great and the courses are always challenging students and readily available.", 'The faculty at Magnet High School are some of the most interesting, comical, intelligent, and kindest people I have ever met. If you are having a difficult time in class, are going through personal problems, have any questions, or need a tutor, they are glad to lend a helping hand. They also prepare you well for the AP exams.Magnet is full of laughter and warmth, having such a welcoming environment regardless of who you are and where you come from.  The advantage of having a class of seventy people is that everyone knows one another and we become very close with each other throughout the four years. Many people think that Magnet students are always stressed. We have events such as Magnetpalooza where students to participate in activities such as karaoke and cooking to destress for half of the day to fix that. Some people hate high school. I, on the other hand, would love to do it all over again.', 'I like the fact that Union County Magnet High School is very focused S.T.E.M.  The school could use some more non-S.T.E.M. courses, however.', 'What I enjoyed the most about Union County Magnet High School is the loving community.  There are no fights, little drama, and the best part is that the quality of the education that I have received is nothing that I would have received from my hometown high school.', "As a freshman at Magnet, it is clear that this is a challenging and innovative school. I absolutely love the rigorous courses that Magnet has to offer, in addition to the variety of clubs UCVTS holds. The only thing I think Magnet could improve upon is a more concrete sense of community. At Magnet, students are surrounded by intelligent peers and teachers; however, I don't always feel like we're one big family, which was one of my expectations.", 'The curriculum challenges the students intellectually. Although it is an academically challenging environment, all faculty and fellow students are supportive making it a community and allowing each student to work to his or her maximum potential.', "Union County Magnet High School is a diverse but tight-knit community of brilliant faculty and students. Class sizes are small, and you really get to know everyone you meet - you'll quickly see that the students are friendly, motivated, and enthusiastic. The clubs and activities they lead, especially the STEM-related ones like Robotics and Science Olympiad, are a lot of fun - and of course great learning experiences! The school offers so much support for students, whether through funding, resources (like the brand new makerspace and on-campus fitness centers), or fantastic guidance counselors.", 'Magnet is fitting for students who looks forward to challenge. The classes are based on interest of the student. I personally felt that I have made huge progress in my pursuit in an engineering career from their hands on curriculum.', "Honestly, I am so glad that I chose to go to Magnet. The community is really supportive and close-knit, since there are only like 70-80 students per grade. We often help each other with our schoolwork. During midterms and finals, the entire grade worked together to make comprehensive study guides for a lot of the classes. It's really diverse as well. I don't know who wrote the review about there being only a few lgbt+ people, but that's not really true. I have a grand total of 1 straight friend on the entire campus (not that i have many friends at all lol.)", 'It is safe, secure, and provides a warm environment for any high school student. It challenges the student intellectually and encourages growth and diversity.', 'I feel that magnet prepared me fully for college. Not only did it prepare me academically, but also socially in the sense that I began high school with a completely new group of people, the same that I will be doing next year in college.', 'Union County Magnet High School is one of the most prestigious high school across the nation. With its diversity and family-knit student population, each student is driven to succeed and change the world. Our world-renowned staff advocates success in each person and expresses a passion for teaching. We challenge ourselves in rigorous courses in order to have a strong foundation for our education career.', "Culturally speaking, Magnet is a fairly competitive school: students tend to expect to get high grades and are distraught with low ones.Though there are no sports at school, students can participate in sports at their home high school districts if they so choose, and the amount of extracurriculars on campus--from the successful FIRST Robotics team to the always-active Drama Club--are enough to keep everyone engaged. Magnet, an engineering school, has classes specific to STEM majors that are not particularly useful outside of engineering disciplines; the likelihood of one using AutoCAD--computer software used for CAD--outside of an architectural occupation is unlikely, after all. For people interesting in engineering, it's a wonderful experience: the new Makerspace facilities opened up recently (a high-tech shop) and are open to all , and the new  electives now available, such as Aerospace and Electrical, allow one to customize the experience to one's interests."]

column6: ['Currently a high school senior. Many classes are taught by students who have already taught in the field. Although the courses are challenging, there is an excellent support system among classmates. Since admissions is test-based, the students are all highly-motivated and will push you to be your best. We are ranked #4 in Newsweek (2016) and the high school definitely prepares you for life beyond high school. The renovation of the multimedia center into a Makerspace, with 3-D printers, a laser cutter, a CNC mill, and a CNC lathe, is extremely exciting and will breathe new life into the school.', "The academics are pretty good.  We have core curriculum requirements but they aren't the worst, especially if you're interested in engineering.  We could have a few more options for classes, because most classes tend to be focused on math, science, or technology.", "This school is ridiculously accepting.  There are, of course, a few racist, mean people here and there, but for the most part, everyone is very accepting.  We have multicultural and GSA clubs, for the most part we are very open-minded, and bullying happens very very rarely.  We are diverse not only in ethnicity, but also in where we are from within the county.  The only problem I have is with the competitiveness; everyone wants to get straight A's and get into Ivy League schools, and it can be a little disheartening when you get a 60% on a test and you hear someone complaining about their 97%.", "The teachers are pretty good, some don't try very hard to teach, and they just lecture you every single day.  On the other hand, some come up with really engaging projects and discussions.  It's a hit or miss.", "My overall experience in this school has been really great, to be honest.  Like with any high school, there are a few problem areas, but IMO, the pros outweigh the cons.  My school is very liberal and open-minded.  It is able to bring together students from all over the county, which results in a lot of different views during class discussions.  There are certain teachers that don't really try to teach well, but for the most part, the teachers are unique and great.  Classes are small and more project-based, and most alumni from this school say that the school has prepared them for college more than people they know from other schools.  What I really like about this school is that everyone who is here wants to be here.  In order to get into this school, students were required to show good grades in middle school and take an entrance exam.  So everyone is here by choice.  In my hometown's high school, many students do not want to be at the school.  As a result, they are rude, difficult, and do not try in class.  But here, the students are supposed to be the smartest in the county.  They try very hard in their classes, and sometimes unfortunately are very competitive, but you never feel like your learning experience is disrupted by people who don't want to be there.  In addition, the campus is ridiculously safe.  There's a police academy on the campus, and in my whole time being here, I've never seen a fight, and bullying is kept to a minimum.  All in all, I love this school, and although it can be ridiculously hard at times, I'm glad I'm here.", "Health programs are good, we only have one school nurse in the entire campus which isn't the best, safety is pretty good considering we're right next to a police academy, bullying does not happen often at all.", "There are quite a few clubs available, most of which have a STEM or business focus.  The clubs are good and are run well, but membership is iffy depending on the club.  Also, since the school is quite far for most students, after school clubs don't always have the most attendees.", "The whole campus is incredibly supportive to their students. Whatever difficulty you have they will accommodate like not being able to pay for your prom ticket, missing school for an international sports competition, or lack of technology available at home. While students might not like each other, there is no issue of bullying on campus because each class size is so small that we all knew it wasn't worth it to start drama and make the atmosphere awkward for yourself. The only downside would be the lack of interaction between all the schools, but honestly that's really a self effort that you should make yourself if you're eager to socialise.", "You will meet some of the best teachers of your life here. Others will lead classes in which the students are basically teaching themselves. However the type of education you receive from all styles of teachers actually proves to be very beneficial. Some teachers will actually teach you way more valuable life skills than they will their own respective academic subject areas. Even the rudest and grouchiest teachers will always be considerate of anything you have going in your life if your academic performance starts to be affected. You can email any staff member and most of the time they will respond within 2 days. Grading isn't always fair, to be honest you will have teachers that have deliberate favourites and have very biased ways of grading, but its a good way of easing in the harsh reality that most everywhere in life people are biased. Overall as a community, everyone supports each other. If you dislike your own teacher, you can always approach past teachers of the same subject or go seek out someone that has never personally taught you, teachers are most always ready to help you.", 'many clubs and resources available', 'This is an amazing school, it prepares the students to go above and beyond. It provides them with all the resources they need. The teachers are very dedicated and prepared.', 'There are virtually no "cliques" or selective groups in the school.  With a grade of only 70-80 people, you have learn to learn to like everybody at least a little!  There\'s no peer pressure to do drugs or anything at all; the only peer pressure experienced is peer pressure to "advance a math level" over the summer.  \r There are a few LGBT people and the school is accepting, though there are a few people from conservative backgrounds.  It\'s a mostly hetero school though.  \r It\'s very diverse here and people are accepting of all races and backgrounds.  Much more diverse than my hometown; never met a Filipino in school before Magnet surprisingly.', 'The school offers many great extracurriculars that have high participation rates and enhance the lives of all students. Some clubs require serious time commitments, while you can drop in and out of others. There is a wide variety of clubs, including Robotics, Drama Club, SMAC, GSA, and Student Government.', 'My experience at this school has been amazing. The academics at this school are excellent, and I have had the opportunity to meet new people through a variety of extracurriculars and electives.', 'The academics at this school are nationally recognized, and for good reason. There is a good mix of electives to balance out the strong STEM courses that are a required part of the curriculum. The scheduling process is easy; however, it takes place in late January, so you may not know enough about your performance in certain classes to decide whether to move to the next level. The workload is excessive at times, but overall, it is manageable.', "Bullying is very rare at this school, though it does have a state-required HIB officer. School security is tight; the front entrance is manned by an unarmed security guard, and all visitors must check in and present a driver's license. Health resources are not advertised; however, the health department can offer programs and resources to students needing them. There is no nurse in the building; the school shares two nurses with the other four schools on campus.", "It's the top priority here.  The teachers are all preparing you for the future in some way, some form.  For example, my math class is a college level class and students who take higher level calculus in college struggle much less than others.  \r The workload gets tough at times and is easy at other times.\r It is easy to schedule (at least for underclassmen) but there aren't that many choices for underclassmen.  I didn't get to choose ANY classes for Freshman or Sophomore year.  There's 1-2 choices later on, but compared to other high schools you get pushed onto a certain path.  But they tell you that you're going to a specialized school, so don't come if you aren't interested at all in STEM and like art.  \r Popular classes? All of them because everyone takes the same ones!  Unpopular ones include non-competitive electives such as Humanities, Film, Cartoon, and non-AP classes.", "There is a decent array, from humanities ones such as newspaper or art to STEM clubs such as Physics, Science Olympiad, Math, Maker Space...but it takes super long for new clubs to get approved and there are very few community service clubs.  There are specialty ones such as HOSA, horticulture, SkillUSA, teachers group...so if you're into vocational education, it can be multifaceted.  But if you're in Magnet you can't join those besides Skills USA.", "Most of the teachers are great; very open to helping, enjoy what they do.  There are a few that have poor teaching methods (lecturing, powerpoints, minimal interaction), but they are in the minority.  Some of them are slower graders, but they have to teach multiple classes at multiple levels.  Some say the communication is poor, but that's just because the workload here is more challenging and students often can get overwhelmed.  Teachers in STEM fields especially know a lot about their subject and some of them are literally geniuses.", "Bullying is rare; there's a security guard; there's only 2 possible doors that's locked a few minutes after the bell.  \r Only bad thing is the nurse is in another building so access to her is more difficult.  But school nurses in larger high schools are also far away from many students; they could be in another wing, another building as well..."]
column8: ['Currently a high school senior. Many classes are taught by students who have already taught in the field. Although the courses are challenging, there is an excellent support system among classmates. Since admissions is test-based, the students are all highly-motivated and will push you to be your best. We are ranked #4 in Newsweek (2016) and the high school definitely prepares you for life beyond high school. The renovation of the multimedia center into a Makerspace, with 3-D printers, a laser cutter, a CNC mill, and a CNC lathe, is extremely exciting and will breathe new life into the school.', "The academics are pretty good.  We have core curriculum requirements but they aren't the worst, especially if you're interested in engineering.  We could have a few more options for classes, because most classes tend to be focused on math, science, or technology.", "This school is ridiculously accepting.  There are, of course, a few racist, mean people here and there, but for the most part, everyone is very accepting.  We have multicultural and GSA clubs, for the most part we are very open-minded, and bullying happens very very rarely.  We are diverse not only in ethnicity, but also in where we are from within the county.  The only problem I have is with the competitiveness; everyone wants to get straight A's and get into Ivy League schools, and it can be a little disheartening when you get a 60% on a test and you hear someone complaining about their 97%.", "The teachers are pretty good, some don't try very hard to teach, and they just lecture you every single day.  On the other hand, some come up with really engaging projects and discussions.  It's a hit or miss.", "My overall experience in this school has been really great, to be honest.  Like with any high school, there are a few problem areas, but IMO, the pros outweigh the cons.  My school is very liberal and open-minded.  It is able to bring together students from all over the county, which results in a lot of different views during class discussions.  There are certain teachers that don't really try to teach well, but for the most part, the teachers are unique and great.  Classes are small and more project-based, and most alumni from this school say that the school has prepared them for college more than people they know from other schools.  What I really like about this school is that everyone who is here wants to be here.  In order to get into this school, students were required to show good grades in middle school and take an entrance exam.  So everyone is here by choice.  In my hometown's high school, many students do not want to be at the school.  As a result, they are rude, difficult, and do not try in class.  But here, the students are supposed to be the smartest in the county.  They try very hard in their classes, and sometimes unfortunately are very competitive, but you never feel like your learning experience is disrupted by people who don't want to be there.  In addition, the campus is ridiculously safe.  There's a police academy on the campus, and in my whole time being here, I've never seen a fight, and bullying is kept to a minimum.  All in all, I love this school, and although it can be ridiculously hard at times, I'm glad I'm here.", "Health programs are good, we only have one school nurse in the entire campus which isn't the best, safety is pretty good considering we're right next to a police academy, bullying does not happen often at all.", "There are quite a few clubs available, most of which have a STEM or business focus. The only downside would be the lack of interaction between all the schools, but honestly that's really a self effort that you should make yourself if you're eager to socialise.", "You will meet some of the best teachers of your life here. column2: ["I met some amazing people, both students and teachers while here. It isn't as bad as I thought it would be.", 'Good school environment with a multitude of bright students. Classes offered are ALL advanced on a national basis. Staten Island Tech really makes me feel at home, but don’t eat their broccoli salad or you’ll regret it!', "I am a senior at this school and I can honestly say that I whole heartedly love this school. These past 4 years have all been incredible and I am excited yet sad to be moving on to college. Staten Island Tech usually gets a bad rep for being full of losers and nerds, but I assure you it's not. It's full of fun, regular kids who simply care about their grades. While yeah there are some kids who stick to themselves and focus only on their studies, and others who care nothing for their grades, it is easy to find a right group of friends who will make your high school experience something to remember.", 'It was an alright experience, but I experienced a terrible culture and several issues with the administration. It was NOT all it was cracked up to be.', 'I liked the variety of Science classes they offered ranging from Forensic Science to Biotechnology to AP Psychology.  I also loved the variety of fun activities that went on practically every month, like SING!, our annual student-produced musical performance that has a different theme each year, or Spirit Week.', 'The past four years I spent Staten Island Technical High School truly was the  experience that shaped me in to the adult I am today. I met a huge variety of people, all of which were extremely kind. School challenged me but also allowed me to flourish. I strive to better myself in topics I did the worst in and the materials provided by the teachers really made me use my head and understand the topics better. I discovered my new interests and pursued them. The school has such a large number of extracurricular activities, it gives everyone a place.', 'smart and brilliant kids - this is what makes this school. Unfortunately many mediocre teachers that should not even be there', 'I absolutely love all the extracurricular activities, especially SING! The teachers there are amazing and very helpful. Some of the courses are challenging but all teachers ensure that you will be successful and they do everything they can in order to help you.', 'Staten Island Technical Highschool is a great place to be. With endless amounts of effort by the teachers and the sheer intelligence of the students, the school is an extraordinary place to receive a high school education. Little to no misbehavior occurs on the premises due to the school’s prioritization of safety. The teachers, some of which are alumni, are absolutely spectacular. They understand the amount of stress and work students undergo and tend to keep it easy. Personally, the soccer varsity team and multiple clubs keep me occupied throughout the entire year. The school has plenty to offer to all kinds of students. Being a top school not only in the forth most populated state in the US, but also in the country, Staten Island Tech definitely deserves the title of a prestigious school. I couldn’t be more proud of my home. My specialized high school home, Staten Island Technical High School.', "The education you receive at this school is at best slightly above what you would receive at any other high school. The school's high rankings are determined by the filter the entrance exam proves to be, though there are many wonderful teachers at this school. Administration is weak.", 'Staten Island Technical High School provides students with many opportunities through rigorous courses and clubs celebrating diversity. Students take Russian for three years (four, if they choose to). This gives students something rare to put on their resumés. However, there aren’t as many sports for females as there are for males. This gives males more chances to succeed athletically. On the other hand, the school is full of encouraging staff members. The school even has a therapy dog for students who need to relieve stress! We are also taught about substance addiction prevention. The teacher helps us open up about problems and questions we have. The school enforces a strict policy against academic dishonesty, and always reminds students to be honest about their work. For instance, the guidance counselor advises students who do not have enough time for an assignment to ask the teacher for an extension instead of cheating.', 'Great school. Many students perform well in various academic competitions, such as AMC (AIME Qualifiers), and the Tech SciOly Team consistently outperforms many other specialized HS in regionals. The research program produces many NYSCEF Finalists, ISEF finalists, and STS finalists. Many students get 1550+ SAT scores and matriculate to the Ivy League Schools.', 'I like the teachers and Administration. They are focused on teaching kids to the best of their ability. The Principal and assistant Principals are very much involve in each student  academic and clubs activities', "The guidance counselors at this school don't really do their jobs. The only opportunities they present to us are ones that aren't even applicable. I had to find out about decent opportunities relating to my future field of study from an email forwarded from another school. In addition, they don't offer us as many classes as I would like to take because our school is small. In my opinion, th classes are too easy and not challenging enough. Compared to Brooklyn Technical High School and Stuyvesant High School, we have nothing. We don't have enough funds (or the funds are going elsewhere) for things that other schools can afford such as nice marching band uniforms.", 'This is a great school - great teachers, great students, great environment. I think the resources at Tech were the primary reasons I was instantly able to transition to college and succeed at a high level at one of the most prestigious institutions in the country.', "What I liked about Staten Island Technical High School was how welcoming the people and faculty are. They make you feel very welcomed and it's very easy to be involved in the extracurriculars. It's easy to approach teachers for help in classes and it's not easy to fall behind in class because everyone there is able to help. The hygiene or how clean in my opinon of the school is not that great. During spring/summer time I would see a lot of bugs around in the school and the food is mediocre, but the cooks and kitchen people are extremely nice", 'What I enjoyed about my school was its college readiness and opportunity in educational growth. From college classes, to academic counseling the school always gave ways and methods towards a better high school education, and to prepare us for our next step in life. These methods varied from a library embedded with countless books for the SAT, Ap exams, and more. Also tutoring was provided, as well as review sessions given by teachers. While these were huge factors to the school being one of the nation’s top high schools, I believe The culture of the school was what was most like able. The school was able to make you feel accepted by everyone, and to accept everyone. This was done through clubs, events, and through assemblies that helped students understand one another. For me, that was what was best about the school, their ways of preparing me for college on a social scale, as well as for my future interactions with people.', 'This is a very good school. There are classes for people who are interested in technology, architecture, robotics, film, language studies, business, etc.', 'It is a very elite school. I feel like I have learned a lot in a lot subjects; more than I would have at any other school. Colleges look favorably on graduates of the school, which helps us even more.', "its pretty good I guess. I'm learning. one of the worst parts is the mandatory Russian class. the school is what you make it. im just doing this for a scholarship here. its a $1000 survey to review your high school and im reaching the character minimum. here's the longest word i know: Hippopotomonstrosesquipedaliophobic."]

column6: ['Staten Island Tech is a great school with a small but close knitted community. Students are high achieving and friendly and there are plenty of school activities to participate in. Teachers can be hit or miss, but academics are always held as a priority and other students are willing to help if you have trouble with anything.', 'Tech has definitely aided in my growth as a student and an individual. I’ve been fortunate to be able to take any classes I wished for though some of my peers were not able to due to the competitiveness and limited seats in such classes. Overall, there’s been a great balance between a rigorous course load and time for extracurricular activities.', 'First of all the school structure is a U-shaped building the size of a middle school. There is no swimming pool and there are only four floors. The locker rooms, cafeteria, hallways and auditorium are very small and crowded which leads to a bunch of other problems like tardiness which can lead to detentions. Another problem would be the commute to get to school. Half the school takes the public bus s79 to school and there is always a constant problem of pushing and shoving and complaints. On the bright side, you can get a really good education. All the teachers are top-notch and somewhat reasonable. Fights and drugs are unlikely and there are a bunch of  extracurricular activities. However, the students are highly competitive which means you have to work very hard to keep up.', "Staten Island Tech truly is a great school with a great environment. As a senior, I've gotten a good understanding of how the school works, and I appreciate how much the staff cares about the students. The school does have it's flaws, mainly in sanitation, but although the building isn't the prettiest, the people inside more than compensate for it.", 'Staten Island Tech lives up to its description- college preparatory school. While the curriculum is rigorous and helps prepare one for college, there is way too much pressure and emphasis put on academics to have an enjoyable high school experience. Rather than tackling the real problems, they merely  distract from them with flashy new initiatives like the emotional support dogs.', "This is by far the best high school in Staten Island (and maybe NYC). The amount of homework is tremendous, but it builds knowledge, work ethic and college preparedness. Not a school for goof-offs, and the social scene is restricted (40% students don't live in SI). There's lots of clubs, friendly but serious classmates, and opportunities for internships and athletics (if you have the time). Russian language requirement and AP classes present more challenges. Go SITHS.", 'Great School. So many opportunities. Helped prepare me for college admissions and life.  We have academic and professional classes to help students become better in the job field.', 'Staten Island Technical High School is one of five specialized high schools and unlike the others offers more opportunities in the Arts. With a professional TV Studio unlike any other in a High School and various programs, it offers a liberal arts style education with a focus on math and science.', 'The staff here are really supportive. When applying for colleges the  counselors are always there to answer questions and clarify. I really enjoyed my 4 years at this school, and look to visit once I graduate. Since I am a senior right now, the classes offered really help to harness my interests and teachers always make sure that students know their material and offer help if the student is confused', 'Staten Island Technical High School is one of the best public high schools in NYC, and it really makes their students prepared for college.', 'I like that Staten Island Tech has a small student population so that every class is catered to you, and makes you feel comfortable. Although the school is based around STEM, there are arts programs avalible, such as SING!, Spring Musical and band/marching band. Each teacher strives to help you achieve your academic goals. I would like to see change the number of languages offered, as the only one available is Russian.', "SITHS is a small school, but I love it here. It is a tough school, and the workload can be overbearing at times, but at the end of the year, it all benefited us students by preparing us immensely. Most teachers are very supportive of the students and will do anything they can to help their students succeed. The environment at SITHS is very friendly and I have made friends here for life. Staten Island Tech has been a great experience so far and has prepared me greatly for the future- I'm excited to see what's in store for me after I graduate.", 'The teachers and environment are great overall. However, the school population lacks diversity. It is a very safe environment as well, where many opportunities are offered. I definitely recommend Staten Island Technical High School.', "It's academically an excellent school, but it lacks certain opportunities available at larger schools (i.e.: law classes, art classes, etc.). As expected, it focuses primarily on STEM related fields. If this is your intent, the school will be an excellent fit. However, if not despite how renowned the school is, I wouldn't recommend it. For most students, I believe the main factor that might make worsen their school experiences is the stress and pressure, though this is typical of a competitive school.", 'Staten Island Tech provided a rigorous curriculum with easily the best college preparation, however, lacked empathy towards students in terms of their future goals.', 'I loved how this school was close knit and made everyone feel welcome. The academics at this school are outstading and really push you to do your best. This school made highschool unforgettable.', 'Staten Island Technical High School allowed me to explore multiple academic and extracurricular paths during the four years. There were teachers always willing to dedicate time to help their students further understand and explore numerous subjects.', 'I liked the community at Staten Island Technical High School. Many people there are really helpful and thoughtful. The staff also helps you through many challenging problems and questions that you have regarding the work that they give.', 'Two of my children attended Tech . It is a great learning environment with plenty of hands on resources .They are very helpful for college admissions ! Love the school Would not want to see any changes!!!!', 'The school is excellent in terms of academics. The students here are so bright and so engaged with their classmates. Most teachers are supportive for students. However, there is a lot of favoritism and much of the funding is biased.']
column8: ['Staten Island Tech is a great school with a small but close knitted community. Students are high achieving and friendly and there are plenty of school activities to participate in. Teachers can be hit or miss, but academics are always held as a priority and other students are willing to help if you have trouble with anything.', 'Tech has definitely aided in my growth as a student and an individual. I’ve been fortunate to be able to take any classes I wished for though some of my peers were not able to due to the competitiveness and limited seats in such classes. Overall, there’s been a great balance between a rigorous course load and time for extracurricular activities.', 'First of all the school structure is a U-shaped building the size of a middle school. There is no swimming pool and there are only four floors. The locker rooms, cafeteria, hallways and auditorium are very small and crowded which leads to a bunch of other problems like tardiness which can lead to detentions. Another problem would be the commute to get to school. Half the school takes the public bus s79 to school and there is always a constant problem of pushing and shoving and complaints. On the bright side, you can get a really good education. All the teachers are top-notch and somewhat reasonable. Fights and drugs are unlikely and there are a bunch of  extracurricular activities. However, the students are highly competitive which means you have to work very hard to keep up.', "Staten Island Tech truly is a great school with a great environment. As a senior, I've gotten a good understanding of how the school works, and I appreciate how much the staff cares about the students. The school does have it's flaws, mainly in sanitation, but although the building isn't the prettiest, the people inside more than compensate for it.", 'Staten Island Tech lives up to its description- college preparatory school. While the curriculum is rigorous and helps prepare one for college, there is way too much pressure and emphasis put on academics to have an enjoyable high school experience. Rather than tackling the real problems, they merely  distract from them with flashy new initiatives like the emotional support dogs.', "This is by far the best high school in Staten Island (and maybe NYC). The amount of homework is tremendous, but it builds knowledge, work ethic and college preparedness. Not a school for goof-offs, and the social scene is restricted (40% students don't live in SI). There's lots of clubs, friendly but serious classmates, and opportunities for internships and athletics (if you have the time). Russian language requirement and AP classes present more challenges. Go SITHS.", 'Great School. So many opportunities. Helped prepare me for college admissions and life.  We have academic and professional classes to help students become better in the job field.', 'Staten Island Technical High School is one of five specialized high schools and unlike the others offers more opportunities in the Arts. column2: ["The three months that I have attended this school for have caused me to have a positive impression on it. Freshman year of high school comprises a myriad of difficulties and with the assistance I am currently receiving from all the staff, I haven't experienced any of the hardships I expected yet. The school's welcoming nature allows students to adjust rapidly and call it their second home in no time. One of my favorite things about this school is how much they care for the students, for there is a testing schedule to prevent stress and to help us manage the rigorous course. Despite all the phenomenal aspects of this high school, much of the student body, including me, wish the physical education class wasn't this intense, as we are mandated to run unpleasant miles frequently. Aside from that, Townsend Harris High School is an overall outstanding school and I am looking forward to gaining an amazing high school experience throughout all the years to come!", "Townsend Harris provided me with a wholesome high school experience that I I don't believe I would've gotten elsewhere. The school's vast resources and the teachers who provided me with an education truly helped shape me and allowed me to carry what I learned into college.", "Townsend Harris is a competitive school that gets students college ready. There are many cultural and diverse activities that students can look forward to during the school year. Everyone in this school is tightly knit together and no one is afraid to speak up. The seminar styled classes also help to enhance everyone's speaking skills and give them a better sense of what they are learning in class.", "Townsend Harris High School, recently ranked #1 in New York, goes above and beyond. Though advertised as a humanities school, it is equally strong in both the humanities and the sciences. You're enrolled in AP World History in your freshman and sophomore year, allowing enough preparation for the AP with amazing history teachers. In freshman year, we are also required to take a course called Writing Process to prepare us for future classical language classes like Latin or Ancient Greek. Without it, I wouldn't have known the difference between a direct and indirect object. The science department is full of fun, intelligent teachers. I've had a teacher who sacrificed a gummy bear in the name of a chemistry demonstration and a teacher who performed a handstand to demonstrate the workings of 3' and 5' RNA strands to form DNA in AP Biology.", 'Its such an amazing school I am genuinely so happy with my decision to go here. Its a great school and the workload is completely manageable and there is plenty of time for other activities that you want to do. This school is perfect!!', 'My four years at Townsend taught me many things and I had a great overall experience. Most of the teachers taught really well (I think the Math and Language Departments stood out in particular) and the education I received here really prepared me for life at a top university. I do wish there were more AP classes offered but because the school is a small one, I understand why there are less APs offered than other schools. Physical education is taken very seriously at Townsend which is different from other schools and I think this is very good because it teaches students about healthy living. The I use the things I learned in weight lifting class in college now. Overall, a really good high school.', "I love the close-knit atmosphere of Townsend Harris. The students aren't cutthroat or competitive, even though everyone is smart. Everyone is always willing to help each other out, share information and be there for you. Our school is small, so it feels like a big family. However, if you don't participate in extracurriculars, you may not feel this way. If I didn't join the activities that I did, I would not be as happy as I am here. Students are always stressed about something, and we never get enough sleep because of our activities and intense workload.If I were to improve anything, it would be the communication between the administration, students and parents. The administration at times makes decisions without informing the students or the school community, and the situations clear up very late. Overall, I love my school, and I know I'll be sad to leave it behind.", 'I like how all the teachers are very involved, however, it would be better if the gym classes have less mile runs.', 'The teachers in this school is excellent. They devote most of the their times to help their students, willing to give up their lunch or stay after school to help students. This school is challenging but everyone is willing to help each other. I love this school because it has a group for everyone.', 'Attending Townsend Harris High School for four years really helped me feel at home. The school has a welcoming environment and allows students such as myself to study, but still have fun. There are many clubs and activities that allow students to build new friendships and new experiences. The environment of the school motivates each student to try their best. Through many experiences, there are many lessons I learned while attending Townsend Harris that other schools would not have provided me.', "Townsend has allowed me to grow as a student and as a person by challenging me and pushing me outside of my comfort zone. There are so many resources available to you that there is no way you can't succeed, you just need to be able to set your mind on whatever it is that you're passionate about.", 'most of the teachers are amazing and unique. Townsend Harris always allows for a calm and interesting learning environment. You meet so many cool people and will form so many great relationships.', 'Townsend Harris is a highly competitive school with a welcoming community of students who genuinely support and care for another. The environment is very academic and safe, and violence is almost nonexistent. While the school does offer a plethora of different classes, a number of teachers often seem to fall short (although there are some who are amazing and beloved by students). Students at Townsend Harris are also overworked and overwhelmed, brought to unbearable levels of stress by pressure and requirements. There are a lot of issues with the way the school is run and some of its policies upset both staff and students, as well. However, the school does try to take students and their opinions into account by way of emailed surveys. And, despite its lack of organization and the way students are crippled by work and tests, this school is one of the best places to push young minds as far as they can go (for better or worse), to explore their interests, and become part of a community.', 'Overall Townsend Harris is a good high school.  I am more of a STEM person but Townsend is a humanity school so to me, I don’t really like the classes I am taking. We are required to take either Latin or Greek in addition to modern language. The humanity teachers are also really bad but all students are really smart so we just self study. The school should have more AP classes.', 'Townsend Harris has great elective and AP options, as well as many clubs and sports. The vast majority of students are involved in at least one of these clubs or sports. The students are very driven and smart as well. The school is safe and the environment is not alarming in a bad way. Basically, all the students go to a four-year college program right after graduation. The students can be a little too uptight about grades, as some think that perfectly fine grades (like an 85 on a regent) low although it is fine in other schools. In addition, some teachers are inadequate and the students have a hard time learning from them.', "Amazing school with very motivated students. Although it's known as a humanities school, Townsend Harris has clubs and teams for math and science. Most teachers are knowledgeable and can teach.", 'I am going into my senior year of high school, and there was a lot to adapt into during the 3 years at Townsend, but Townsend does prepare you for college in many ways and there are many resources and trustful adults you can go to if you feel overwhelmed or stressed out in your studies and the workload, social life, time management  is gonna be a lot to take in but that whats will prepare you in real life.', 'It is a great school. The programs and teachers are great! The people are nice. The school is rigorous but not too stressful. People help each other!', 'Townsend was a great place to go to high school. Not only did they help me develop academically but also socially and professionally. It was a safe, fun, inviting place to be and I met amazing people who I still talk to 4 years later. There were many opportunities to be involved, such as clubs and sports. Teachers always cared and were there for us.', 'Townsend was a great experience. You will meet some amazing people and faculty. You will feel pushed here not only academically but in all fields.']

column8: ['What interested me about Townsend Harris was its offered extra curricular activities, specifically the competition between two teams of different grades, known as SING! which included singing, dancing, and acting. Another activity which interested me was the cultural dance showcase, Festival of Nations, in which various cultures performed different dances exhibiting specific aspects of each culture.', 'I had a great time at Townsend Harris High School because of the diversity, and the opportunities it gave me. Townsend Harris has an overwhelmingly welcoming environment which changed me as a person.', 'Townsend Harris has been ranked #1 in New York High Schools and #11 in the national rankings. Townsend gives you the opportunity to take AP classes from freshman year. All the classes are honors, however it’s not weighted. It is expected that students here have homework every day and at least one test per week. Sometimes there may be three tests in a week. There is an array of after school activities including sports, clubs, FON, SING, academic teams, etc. You will definitely find something to do after school. Regarding the student body, everyone is friendly and really makes sure not to leave any comrades behind.', 'We have a very connected community and we all get along with each other (students and teachers). There is a sense a school spirit, and diversity within the school. Students are also comfortable enough to talk to teacher with any situation and teachers are very willing to help out.', 'Townsend Harris High School built in a sense of leadership within myself as well as providing me the support that I need for my future endeavors.', 'Great school, but tough. The college bridge program is awesome and the teachers are passionate. They care for their studies and push the students to do their best. Most teachers will hold student sessions and even help you if you need extra help. The student body is well put and if you have an issue it is easy to phone a friend. Though the work can be quite challenging , its worth it in the end. It prepares you for college very well.', "Townsend Harris High School has one of the friendliest environments of any school. Students here are respectful toward each other and it is only normal that they help each other out. Being a small school, Townsend Harris students regularly support each other and by the end of one's time in this school, he or she will have found an amazing family. Teachers and faculty are also supportive, and always find time to tutor students when they need help. This school stresses the importance of mental health because it wants its students to be happy and comfortable, but also gives students multiple challenging courses to prepare them for college. I love this school so much and have met so many amazing people here. This school is not ranked #7 in New York for no reason.", 'Great school environment, loved most of the teachers and students there; you genuinely feel safe there and it’s not the kind of place where people are out to get you. But if you’re looking for a party school though, this isn’t the place for you.', 'I absolutely loved the challenge at Townsend Harris. It made me realize the full potential I had and that the sky is the limit! Even though life was extremely stressful, the relationships I created there were extremely valuable. If I had to change one thing, it would be the testing schedule.', "I loved my 4 years at Townsend Harris.  While they were difficult, I felt that the school challenged me and I was able to really learn.  THHS greatly prepared me for college and I don't ever regret my decision to go there.  I made some of my best friends because of this school and I often miss it.  My advice to all current and prospective students is to enjoy your time there because once it is over you will wish it wasn't.", 'Townsend Harris offers an academically challenging high school experience while also providing a lively school environment. There is always a number of events to look forward to and a number of clubs to join. The Student Wellness Council has greatly helped to ease the stress of many students. The guidance counselors are amazing and greatly helpful.', 'Townsend Harris is an amazing experience in order to succeed in the future. It prepares you very well and is a safe environment and welcoming ambiance.', 'I like that the teachers are all very supportive of the students and their future endeavors. They are willing and eager to give extra help and push the students to excel in all their classes and all aspects of life.', "The teachers and faculty at Townsend are very supportive and want to see each student succeed. There are also productions and many after school clubs which allow each student's passions to grow throughout their high school experience.", 'The most welcoming and inclusive New York public high school in the city with rigorous academia and top-of-the-line staff!', "Townsend Harris has the world's most supportive staff and faculty, their goal is to motivate students to succeed in not only academics but in life in general. The atmosphere is competitive and students take it into their own hands to hustle for good grades. There are plenty of extracurriculars ranging from sports to clubs to events like SING, FON, and the school plays.", 'I love the variety of clubs and activities offered at this high school. Faculty and teachers are highly involved in school events. However, classes can be highly rigorous and managing your time is crucial at this school. Some of the teachers work at a faster pace than others and you should reach out for help when needed. There is a multitude of activity available but again time management is key.', 'Townsend Harris is an academically rigorous school that prepares students for college. The school is very highly competitive and filled with students who are eager to achieve and go far,', "I graduated from Townsend Harris High School in 2012, I'm sure a great deal has changed since then. I met a lot of incredibly smart and talented people there who have gone on to do wonderful things. The teachers that I had at THHS were all experts in their fields and really cared about the students. Although the workload was occasionally extremely stressful , I managed to take away a lot from my time at the school. In particular, I began my journey into weight training, physical fitness, and general health thanks to Mr. Hanson.", 'Townsend Harris High School is a very good top choice for middle schoolers. With no entrance exam, the school picks students of various backgrounds and diverse ethnicities.']

column2: ['Despite a rough freshman year, I grew very close to lots of other students due to all of our unique personalities.', "This school is really good if you work yourself out into success. There is no straight easy path about the school being the path itself to success, but rather, this school helps to nurture, or at least tries to, the ideal mindset in preparation for college. The teachers (overall as a whole) are amazing and really knowledge in their respective fields of study, with minor exceptions to some (which is more so in a critique of their teaching style). What I would recommend in this school is the more involvement of the administration and the students themselves to create a better ambience, even though in my opinion, it's not bad.", 'This was a very challenging and rigorous school but one that kept me constantly growing and learning about myself. I found that teachers were personally interested in my well being and academic growth and always were there to help me.', "Bronx Science has provided me with the experience that I could never receive anywhere else. I've made friends that have impacted me in countless ways and met mentors who have readied me for the future. While the academics can be insanely tough, it's all manageable. The teachers are understanding and excel at what they do, teaching passionately and connecting with students to help them whenever needed.", 'Looking back as third-year undergraduate student at Cornell University, I greatly appreciate the immense guidance I received from the school. The four years at Bronx Science were very structured and filled with endless resources and opportunities.', 'My high school is a very inviting and overall very thoughtful experience. Every few weeks, the student organization thinks of fun and exciting ways to help unite the school. My school helps me get ready for college as well, although I’m “only a freshman”.  It is where I am able to be myself without being worried of being judged!', 'Academics and college readiness are outstanding, however, there is an obvious lack of diversity. As part of a minority at this school, although I have never felt outright discriminated, there is a lack of people of color present in the school. It is hard to find people that share the same culture and struggles as you, and it is hard to feel identified in the community.', 'Bronx Science was a surprisingly great experience. I say surprising because I thought everything would have been way above my head, academically, but I was able to juggle my busy sports schedule (cross-country, track) and my homework. I think much of this was due to the excellent in-class teaching and the staff.  Like at all schools,  I had talented teachers, and not so brilliant teachers, but for the most part they were enthusiastic and knowledgeable. The student body is serious and diverse, both culturally and economically, which was a unique experience for me. My classmates were serious yet knew how to have a life outside of the rigors of Bronx Science. Overall 5 stars!', 'The faculty and staff here all care very much about the students and the students themselves create a nice community. The resources that are provided to the students provide them a great advantage and help them in their preparation for college and beyond.', "The Bronx High School of Science has given me incredible experiences, and has prepared me greatly for the future. It's easy to get wrapped up in the fast paced academics and become stressed, but the school is really providing chances to adapt and change yourself for the better. During my years at Bronx Science, I've become more organized and efficient. Many teachers will provide more than just amazing academic support, acting as another benfical force by encouraging students to always stive to better themselves. The student body is also an amazing community. It's diverse, with students that have a variety of hobbies and interests. One thing held constant, however, is the sharp mindset held throughout the school. All suggestions I have it changing the school are all small nit-picks. I really treasure my time at Bronx Science.", 'Bronx Science is overall a very good school that prepares you well for college. The amount of stress this school gives you will help you feel more prepared for stress in uni/college. The large school population (~3000 kids) prepares you for a social life at a university or college with much more people, and the academics are very vigorous when you’re being taught by a good teacher. For a school specializing in STEM, there are many  STEM teachers who are there just for the money, and many unfortunate students end up having to self-study for APs and SAT2 tests. Despite this, there are many opportunities for students to expand their interest in STEM at this school, including research, robotics, and the IDEA Initiative. For a student who comes from a middle school that didn’t prepare us much for vigorous high school learning, I am currently struggling going to this school, but it’s been a good learning experience going to this school. I can’t wait to graduate.', "I'm not used to the sad commute; and I think it was hard to adjust sometimes when I was a freshman. But although I have a chemistry teacher that makes me not want to school EVERYDAY, this doesn't compare to the amount of great teachers I have. Also some kids -.- not if chief #Classof2022", 'Great teachers who were always there for me when I needed extra help. Open learning environment, with teachers who encouraged me to be the best student that I could be.', 'I am a freshman of Bronx science and this school is the absolute worst. The building is old/cramped, The sports teams are mostly female oriented, and the teachers are too strict with lateness.', 'I’m a new freshman at Bronx Science and so far the transition has been pretty good. I came from a relatively big middle school (around 300 kids per grade) and I don’t feel very different here. However, they say that the prioritize all subjects equally, which is untrue. If you get into Honors Science, you have a double period of Science every day while all other periods are only once a day. If that does not sound appealing to you and you are a definite honors student, I do not recommend coming here.', 'Bronx Science is a very good school that fits most criteria. The school is a great place for academics and clubs.', 'I love my school. I found friends here that make my high school experience absolutely wonderful. Speech and Debate is amazing, the Drama Department is full of people you love, and you make a family within the people you find.', 'Bronx High School of Science is an excellent school that prepares students to go to college. All of the classes are challenging and rigorous. Teachers aim for students to think creatively in all aspects. However, there can be some improvements such as the cleanliness of the school and to keep the school a safe zone as a whole.', 'I came to Bronx Science as a doe-eyed freshman looking to better myself and reach my fullest potential. The freshman guidance program at Sci is great and definitley helped me with my transition into high school. A social downside to attending this school is probably the drug culture as many students pop pills and smoke juuls in the school bathrooms. However, that’s only a minority of the students here. I love Sci because I’ve found so many friends who uplift me and share their positive energies.', 'This is a prestigious school that gets you to prestigious universities. For ex, naviance has that  uchicago admits 25% of our applicants( there were 88) compared to a nationwide rate of around 8%. Other elite schools like Harvard, Yale, and Cornell also admits significantly more students from Bronx Science when compared to other high schools of the nation. From personal experience, this is a highly competitive school with tons of gifted students. Highly recommend research lit with Dr.Gensert & global with Mr.Huth. Currently enrolled in the school.']

column6: ['The Bronx High School of Science was exactly where I needed to be. It did not matter that I lived in Rockaway Beach because going to school there was absolutely fantastic. Sometimes, I learned more from the students than the teachers because thats how smart the students were! The AP courses were challenging, and I would love to send my children there when I have some!', 'Bronx Science has an amazing community of ambitious people. Everyone has a goal in life and it is inspiring to learn and grow beside these people.', 'The teachers here are absolutely excellent. The workload may be too much sometimes but all of the work helps you gain a better understanding of the course. There are also guidance counselors who will help you out with any little problem you have. The students are all very nice and the teachers and staff will always make sure that there is respect for all.', "As with everyone, high school is what you make of it, and oftentimes kids that took advantage of the funds, research program, robotics/sports/debate/STEM teams available, and the many positions in clubs / student government while having fun and being passionate about something (even in the casual sense) were rewarded with stellar colleges. What I can't defend is the utter lack of diversity, which while better than most of NYC, reflect primarily only asian and caucasian demographics. For academics, I've experienced many classes with unconventional styles of teaching and many students relied on their own resourcefulness to study for APs and tests, which run on an EXCELLENT system (each day of the week is reserved for tests of specific subjects). Most adults are overwhelmingly supportive, empowering many of my peers to start creative and impactful projects in the world. BxSci being an hour away from other boroughs is often the first sacrifice most admit is worth it to attend BxSci.", "Some teachers genuinely care and are easy to connect with but there are a good amount of teachers who fail to teach and don't make an effort for students. Atmosphere in school gets extremely competitive, but bronx science does offer a lot of opportunities for students to succeed, especially for college.", 'I was able to experience a rigorous community which has pushed me to become a more driven student. However, it has been very difficult for me to get used to the environment in my school and because of the large quantity of students who attend the school, I got little to none information on college readiness. It has made me much less confident in my work and I feel that I could have prepared to do much more during the very few years. Although this school allows to bring the best out of every student, it can become very overwhelming for kids who are not used to a competitive environment.', 'It was my dream to get accepted into BxSci due to its prestige and reputation. Upon starting my enrollment, it was quite obvious that there were groups for everybody. I saw many people with different hobbies, talents, and interests. My only complaint is the crowded hallways and and local area.', 'So far, I have had a good experience at the Bronx High School of Science! I am learning to challenge myself here, and to try new things.', 'I loved the teachers and the welcoming environment. Despite being an extremely competitive school, everyone is extremely friendly and willing to help others on their path to college. I would only ask for some more rule enforcement.', "Very competitive. It is very easy to get lost in the crowd. Please don't pressure your kids to get into ivies.", 'Our nonprofit, ChangingThePresent.org, has had fantastic interns from Bronx Science--recent graduates and current students, alike.', 'One of the best experiences of my life, great faculty and great environment to be a part of. It will be an unforgettable four years.', 'Bronx Science gives more options to explore your interests within school than any other school I know of: there will be a variety of classes, clubs and sports teams that will interest the students. There are many teachers (particularly those in the research program) which will encourage you to explore your interest. The only problem is that there are some truly terrible teachers, but they are far outnumbered by the average or great ones.', 'I love the environment of Bronx Science. It’s very diverse and welcoming and there’s a place for everyone here. There’s a lot of cultural representation and respect amongst students and teachers. There’s also a lot of opportunity to do well in classes and seek help from teachers through sgi, after school study sessions, and in class assistance from teachers who are always willing to help and motivate their students to do better. There is also a wide range of after school activities and extracurriculars which provides a lot of options for those who enjoy investing their time in non academic activities like sports and volunteering and events that cater to their interests. Some things I would like to see improve about this school is the condition of the building itself. It could use a lot of renovations and pest control to provide a healthy environment for students to learn. I would also like to see more mental health awareness and activities to de stress.', 'Bronx Science is a very open minded school and has an open campus rule, making students feel free and happy around the school. Teachers are usually very nice and try to help you every step of them way, though sometimes when multiple students complain or report a teacher for being biased and unfair, the faculty don’t do much besides send in a viewer from the office that says and watches the class for a period, then leaves.  Bronx Science does spend a lot of their donations on the students currently in Bronx Science, and have multiple mental health weeks. A social worker is recently been put in place and snacks are given out on homeroom one in a blue moon as a quick student pick-me-up. Bronx Science’s policies are very transparent, any rule put in place has a clear explanation. Bronx Science provides students with many opportunities. Unfortunately, Bronx Science’s work load is much larger than many other high schools.', 'I am very glad to be a student at the Bronx High School of Science. At times I regret coming to this school, but over the years with the classes and took and the friends I meet, I can honestly say that pushing through this school is one of the best decisions I ever made.', "Bronx Science can be difficult but as far as high school goes, I have had a good time here. Most of my teachers were very good, knew a lot about their subject, and genuinely cared about their students. They had a great variety of clubs, sports, and other extracurriculars. I made a bunch of friends that I really care about and love who I will definitely stay in contact with even when we go to seperate colleges. The bathrooms are a wreck sometimes though, but I guess you can't have everything.", "The Bronx High School of Science is a specialized high school in New York City. It ranks nationally and is known for its multiple Nobel Prize laureates. I'm a graduating senior and I will say that what you get out of Bronx Science is what you put into it. It is a rigorous environment with a punishing workload but there is an endless array of extracurricular and course opportunities for the self-motivated. The culture is a little stressful and workaholic type so it is important to be a grounded person capable of handling stress. The guidance department has many resources to help you out though. Overall, it is an excellent high school and has more than prepared me for college while giving me an impressive resume anywhere I go.", 'Bronx Science prepared students for college very well, but everything revolves around the college process. Besides academics, the school doesn’t really have any good aspects.', 'Current junior here. There’s a stereotype that schools like Bronx Science and Stuyvesant are insanely stressful but that’s completely false. Bronx science helps you develop good work ethic, and teaches you to manage your time. If you do it well, homework does not take very long.']
