A social downside to attending this school is probably the drug culture as many students pop pills and smoke juuls in the school bathrooms. However, that’s only a minority of the students here. I love Sci because I’ve found so many friends who uplift me and share their positive energies.', 'This is a prestigious school that gets you to prestigious universities. For ex, naviance has that  uchicago admits 25% of our applicants( there were 88) compared to a nationwide rate of around 8%. Other elite schools like Harvard, Yale, and Cornell also admits significantly more students from Bronx Science when compared to other high schools of the nation. From personal experience, this is a highly competitive school with tons of gifted students. Highly recommend research lit with Dr.Gensert & global with Mr.Huth. Currently enrolled in the school.']

column2: ['Biotech is an incredible experience if you love STEM classes.  Even if you don\'t like science, this allows you to get a better understanding of what you want to do in the future.  The labs are incredible, and I know alumni who say that they were almost "overprepared" for college.  So, if you\'re willing to get a true scientific experience, apply here freshman year.', 'Mostly great teachers. Environment of biology, science, and research. The building is beautiful and has several science labs and lots of lab equipment. Many of the teachers are great mentors and supportive with college and career advice.', 'Teachers and fellow students are very nice and understanding.  Students are very trustworthy, no one ever needs to lock their locker or be worried about thievery.  There is a great community created with fellow students.  You learn to support and lean on each other.The administration is constricting.  Little freedom is given to students.  It is said that students can create clubs and organization, but proposed clubs are neglected by the administration.  Most get closed down. Little to no art/music in the curriculum.  All art/music in life at BTHS is led by the students.  All there is is an Arts and Entertainment club.  Additionally, there is only ONE art related field trip.Also, food is not that great, but it could be worse.Upside, the bathrooms are REALLY nice', 'This is part of the Monmouth County Vocational School District. This is an IB high school.  You will get the best education & be ready for college. The students are all highly motivated & self driven.  The school has a small student population.  There only approx 325 students for all grades.', 'Teachers care, administration inhibits student progress, IB is unnecessary. Absolutely horrific time.', "Very good school, great people, sometimes problems but that'll be everywhere. happy I went. IB curriculum can be difficult but not much I can do about that.", 'It was a very challenging environment, this is good and bad. If you can handle a high pressure environment, they have all the resources to help you succeed in high school and the college application process. The school is very biology-research oriented. This school will prep you very well for any biology classes you take beyond high school. BTHS has a lot of resources that are usually only available in undergraduate level universities.', 'Biotech is a great high school that has an emphasis on the sciences. The labs are state of the art and everything is very new and modern. The harmony between the student body and the teachers are very prominent. There are a lot of fun activities both in and out of the school that is offered. While the grades may be small, everyone shows lots of spirit and working together to help each other out.', 'Great school! Great faculty, awesome lectures, cool science classes and labs, good counselors. I loved my time here. The cafeteria food was AMAZING. I learned so much from the IB classes. The busy work was so fun! I just love EEs and IAs!', 'I had a very good experience at Biotech. The academics definitely pushed my limits while at the same time teaching me about stress and time management the hard way. This is also when the IB (International Baccalaureate) program is formally introduced. The IB program is the only bad part of attending this school. In my opinion it is not explained well enough when first applying to the school, and by the time you realize that the IB program not very valuable and incredibly stress inducing, it is too late. The classes themselves are taught well by great instructors, however I have found assignments like CAS to either be limited in value, not explained well enough by guidance staff, or tedious to the point where most value it has is killed off. I was able to use 0 IB credits when registering for classes in university. I maintain that, even with IB, the incredible environment, challenging coursework, like minded classmates, and enthusiastic teachers made going to Biotech well worth it.', 'Biotech is a great school for students who know they want to go into science. It is also a great place for kids to grow and learn about themselves.', "I have highs and lows when it comes to Biotechnology HS. Although it is a STEM school, the administrators try to foster a school culture that allows students to express their abilities and talents. However, this fails in the eyes of other high schools that actually put time, attention, and effort in letting extracurriculars flourish. Additionally, Biotech states that the workload is manageable, however, it honestly isn't. While teachers are amazingly qualified and caring, many don't recognize the sheer amount of work they place on students. Students have volunteering, sports, extracurriculars, jobs, family and social lives to attend to, and many have to sacrifice to do school assignments. It's even worse for upperclassmen who have extra IB required assessments to attend to. After a while, the lackluster of Biotech fades and students realize that while they are in an academic-heavy environment, they are essentially in a sheltered community that isn't very reminiscent of reality.", 'Great education. Completely prepares students for college. But there is WAY too much homework/busy work. Very hard for kids to have a balanced life.', "I love Biotech because it's such a small school and it allowed me to become who I really am. I'm generally a shy person, and having experience with just 80 kids in my class allowed me to bloom. Most of the teachers are excellent, with a few exceptions. The main drawbacks of Biotech are the food, which is your standard school cafeteria food and a lack of sports teams due to our small size.", 'I like the environment of more like-minded, education-focused peers. Everyone was hardworking and put in some kind of effort in classes. However, I did not appreciate how this led to competitiveness among classmates, especially with such a small class size.', 'The faculty and administration at this school try very hard to make it like a "normal" high school, but there are certain fundamental issues with this that people need to know about before they consider coming. First, being that this is a STEM-oriented school, the courses electives offer little variety. While many students pursue artistic endeavors on their own time, coming here certainly doesn\'t help. You have basically no control over your schedule besides choosing between Chem and Physics as an upperclassman. There is also a strong status quo in terms of clubs. You will be told at the info session that you can start up your own club to suit your interests; this is simply not true. The school does not have enough teachers to advise any additional clubs like other schools would, and the unofficial "Student Interest Groups" are limited in their abilities to conduct activities.', 'Rather than simply criticizing this school, I am making a request. I want Biotechnology High School to improve itself. There are a few factors that Biotech must consider: the administration & faculty, the coursework, and the culture of the school. You know what is wrong, so go fix it.', 'Great professors that really care that you learn. You work hard and you learn a lot, but be prepared to spend hours of homework every night. It will definitely prepare you for the college work load. Even if one does not end up sticking with the biological sciences after graduating the critical thinking skills, work ethic, and quality education make this school worth it. Especially since it is a public school yet you get a private school quality education.', 'One of the main things about Biotechnology HS is its IB Program. The downside of it is that you rarely get any college credit for the work you put into the program (which is a lot, especially since there are uncommon requirements like Theory of Knowledge and the Extended Essay). However, the skills you learn that teach you how to learn and apply knowledge.', "I can appreciate the academic push from biotech but the good teachers are gradually leaving and the incoming teachers are honestly sub-par. No new clubs are being created and most club funding is being held up so no progress is being made anywhere. We don't have sports, food sucks beyond belief, and the administration sucks even more because they seem incapable of functioning properly. Most students ended up relying on each other and outside sources because this school's administration was so unreliable. One guidance councilor forgot to send paperwork to some student's colleges! The community that comes here is what makes it a good school, nothing else."]

column6: ["Biotechnology High School is a great environment for the scientifically driven and those desiring a career in research. However, it does not offer students as many opportunities to explore other areas, and it's unnecessary usage of IB makes it harder for students to be academically interested.", 'Although on a daily basis you may hear me say "Ugh I wish I didn\'t go to Biotech," as a whole I couldn\'t picture myself anywhere else.  The coursework is difficult and I don\'t get a lot of sleep, but it is 100% worth it, in my opinion.  The opportunities one can get at Biotech are worth the extra work and the stress.  The community is amazing too.  Never before have I been surrounded by so many bright and enthusiastic young people.', "Such a fantastic community. Lower grades don't seem to be as into it so we'll see how it changes in the coming years.", 'People are the most accepting of race, religion, sexual orientation, etc. that they could possibly be because the population is so diverse. There is no peer pressure and a very familial atmosphere.', "The safety is great - I've never felt unsafe. However, the school nurse is pesky and annoying, and doesn't really know that much. She's kinda creepy and definitely makes me feel uncomfortable sometimes.", "I've been very involved in extracurriculars, and I know that all of my friend who are have barely had negative experiences. I've been mainly involved with the Arts & Entertainment Club (co-president for two years), which is the largest club in the school. We put on coffeehouses and a spring musical. It's so amazing because in a community of intellectuals and scientists, the level and diversity of talent is baffling. \r Along with that, there are a large variety of clubs, from Academic Team, JSA, TSA, Science Competition Club, etc. There's a club for everyone here, and if you can't find yours, you can make it yourself.", "The academics are excellent. The students are really a unique population that is accepting of everything except for outward ignorance and bullying (there has been one student that has been a huge problem with racism and sexism, but they ended up leaving and facing consequences). The one problem would be the amount of work and pressure on the students at this school; after four years it's exhausting. While I wouldn't change my experience at all, I'm definitely relieved it's over.", "Most teachers are a 4/5 for teaching ability and passion. They all care about their students, but some are better at it than others. I can list quite a few teachers that always go above and beyond in many aspects, including student care, teaching styles, and passion for teaching. However, there are several weak links, including the chemistry department and some of the English department. Despite a few shortcomings, I've thoroughly enjoyed my time at BTHS and forged many connections with my teachers.", 'For the size of the school, the amount of choice is fantastic.', 'Most parents are fine, but some are overbearing, leading to some very stressed students.', 'The teachers are all knowledgeable and effective at teaching their subject.', 'I would not choose this school again if I could do it all over. The competition between the students is ridiculous. The students are not always treated fairly. At a school of this caliber, they should really have guidance counselors who know what to do and when to get it done for their students. They could and should be doing much more. The new principal needs to get with the program.', 'The biology department is the best thing the school has going for it.', 'The extracurriculars are run during lunch. The clubs that do well are the ones with the most student involvement.', 'Some teachers here are well qualified, whereas others are not.', 'They are just fine with safety, but they need more qualified counselors. Especially when it comes to dealing with high school seniors expecting to get into Ivy League schools. There is quite a bit of disappointment come college acceptance time.', "Bullying isn't a problem here at  BTHS. Even if there was bullying, the guidance counselors are always available to help the students and even the teachers are free to help. \r We also don't experience any threats to our safety. We do practice lock-downs every so often in school to be prepared (as well as evacuations and fire drills). There's also a police academy next to our school, so we never feel threatened. \r Overall, Biotech has a safe and healthy environment.", 'There are many clubs available to students - both official and nonofficial. The clubs and organizations range from Academic Team to Science Competition Club, from Arts & Entertainment Club to Film Club, from National Honor Society to Spanish Honor Society, and from Cooking Club to Asian Club. Each person could find a club he/she is interested in.', "Although Biotech is very demanding and competitive, I enjoyed my time there. I will be graduating soon, and I can honestly say that I'd readily experience these four years again. The faculty and staff there are a great help, and the students there are all kind and understanding. \r I definitely enjoyed the Battle of the Classes, which is a series of games taken place the last couple days of school before winter break. Representatives from each class would partake in various activities - such as a Lip Sync Battle, an Impromptu Speech Battle, a relay race, and finish with the class dance. During these few days, the class and school spirit really skyrockets! \r I would choose this school again because of all the fun encounters I had with others, the rigorous schoolwork, and all the opportunities that were offered to students to allow us to shine.", 'All the teachers are knowledgeable in the subject he/she teaches. They engage us in various activities - both individual and group - and offer open office hours during lunch during which we can visit and ask questions. They also grade us fairly and make sure we know the material correctly before testing us. Overall, the teachers here in Biotech are some of the best we could ask for!']

column2: ['Jericho High School exemplifies a great environment for adolescent development. The faculty and staff are welcoming and encouraging for the students to pursue what they are genuinely interested in. The school is able to allow flourishing through the resources and spaces available for the community.', 'Just no.jsdfngh;oijaerhsgo;uisa chdgfo;mjk sahfdgm;iousaxHDGIPMUXSehggxilmusHEF;IOMUSAehfo;misEHGO;SAuicdhfgsck;ajedg hbzkldudfjcg hvbsk>IUg dbksz.UDgh kluWFZghaiLEWUFHXDFHXFSADLIU', 'Jericho High School is a very college-focused school. This results in proper preparation for college academics withing AP Classes. This also results in high stress among students.Furthermore, there is always a club or activity for any kind of student. This also results in great resources to help you prepare for choosing your major in college.  I would love to see more programs within the school that open up the student body population to diverse experiences and perspectives.', "I like the school and the community. It is very high pressure and competitive. The academics are great and we have good facilities. I just wish we were better at sports and weren't so focused on test scores.", 'I enjoyed going to school here wouldn’t t have chosen any other place they have excellent teachers who really go above and beyond and they really do care. The college preparation is great, and so are the academics.', "Jericho is a great school! Teachers and students are all kind. Jericho offers many different clubs and sports so there's something for everyone.", 'Jericho is a very good school, though it can be very competitive at times. Teachers here work hard to make sure that everyone understands the curriculum and truly care about their students. Students are all nice to each other, but they can be very competitive with peers.', "As a student in the JHS system my whole life, I don't have much to compare my education to. But my time spent there was time spent making friends, making memories, constantly learning, and growing up. I made some of my closest friends and the best memories through clubs I joined. I had a chance to understand what it meant to be in a leadership position and other chances to understand what it meant to be a listener, not a follower. I struggled under the academic rigor and competition, but it was all in preparation for my future college plans. Jericho made me grow up into someone I am proud to be.", 'While the atmosphere at Jericho High School can be very competitive and stressful at times, I do realize how fortunate I am to be attending a school with such great academics, resources, and recognition. I have many more opportunities to learn and grow here, but I do wish the general school culture would change a lot.', 'One of the best public high schools in the country for decades at this point. The teachers I had made a huge impression on me and helped me become the adult I am today.', '-Very supportive district. Really truly wants the best for the students and district. -Relatively small graduating class sizes. Small school. Teacher to student ratio definitely higher than other high schools. -Nicely diverse. Equal opportunities for all. Clubs, activities, etc.-On-campus grounds is very smart. -APs and scores do prepare for undergraduate. Education great for public school.-9 am - 3:30 pm schedule super convenient, better for high school kids, more productive and efficient', 'Great academics, fabulous teachers, and extensive resources make Jericho a great place to get an education.', 'There is so much to do at Jericho High School. Clubs are in the morning and sports are in the afternoon so student can do both instead of pick and choose. There are many different electives and everyone can study at their level.', 'Very focused on education. Sports and other extracurriculars are still important, but they take the back-seat. Work-wise, the school is pretty stressful and competitive.', 'the environment is competitive which makes me work harder. the teachers are super nice and helpful. this school has been ranked one of the top schools in the state and the nation. the students and the parents are all driven to succeed.', 'I will graduate from Jericho High School in 2019. JHS is a very nice place, but it’s extremely competitive. The students are good friends, but they all have a competitive nature somewhere in them. This may make it hard for certain students to do as well as they expect or be proud of themselves. Overall, it has been a great experience. However, I feel that had I been in a school with a lower rating, I would’ve been better off for college. Also, students should only come here while in middle school, not after high school starts.', 'Jericho High school is a top 100 high school in the nation, and it shows through the intensely competitive nature that each student has towards their education and grades. Academically, Jericho is fantastic, but I wish that it was more traditional in the athletic and school spirit sense.', 'Overall, Jericho High School is a good school: great academics, plenty of opportunities, and caring staff. Although, everyone\'s experience at Jericho varies depending on their own personal goals. There are a lot of high-achieving students, but there are also a lot of average students. Competitiveness ranges from the people you surround yourself with and how you deal with stress. The majority of teachers are supportive and put in a lot of effort in their job. Downsides of this school include lack of school spirit and lack of diversity. I wouldn\'t describe it as "cliquey" because there isn\'t a hierarchy, but friend groups are pretty solidly established here, and people tend stay in bubbles.', 'Most teachers at this school will help you find your passion. They care about each of their students, almost never forgetting anyone.', "The teachers and students at JHS know how to make you feel part of something great whether its through sports or clubs or their many activities after school. We come together like a family when there's a charity to support.  I know that if anything, I can always approach a member of the faculty or a parent.  The only thing that would probably need improvement is the cafeteria food."]
column4: ['Jericho High School exemplifies a great environment for adolescent development. The faculty and staff are welcoming and encouraging for the students to pursue what they are genuinely interested in. The school is able to allow flourishing through the resources and spaces available for the community.', 'Just no.jsdfngh;oijaerhsgo;uisa chdgfo;mjk sahfdgm;iousaxHDGIPMUXSehggxilmusHEF;IOMUSAehfo;misEHGO;SAuicdhfgsck;ajedg hbzkldudfjcg hvbsk>IUg dbksz.UDgh kluWFZghaiLEWUFHXDFHXFSADLIU', 'Jericho High School is a very college-focused school. This results in proper preparation for college academics withing AP Classes. This also results in high stress among students.Furthermore, there is always a club or activity for any kind of student. This also results in great resources to help you prepare for choosing your major in college.  I would love to see more programs within the school that open up the student body population to diverse experiences and perspectives.', "I like the school and the community. It is very high pressure and competitive. The academics are great and we have good facilities. I just wish we were better at sports and weren't so focused on test scores.", 'I enjoyed going to school here wouldn’t t have chosen any other place they have excellent teachers who really go above and beyond and they really do care. The college preparation is great, and so are the academics.', "Jericho is a great school! Teachers and students are all kind. Jericho offers many different clubs and sports so there's something for everyone.", 'Jericho is a very good school, though it can be very competitive at times. Teachers here work hard to make sure that everyone understands the curriculum and truly care about their students. Students are all nice to each other, but they can be very competitive with peers.', "As a student in the JHS system my whole life, I don't have much to compare my education to. But my time spent there was time spent making friends, making memories, constantly learning, and growing up. I made some of my closest friends and the best memories through clubs I joined. I had a chance to understand what it meant to be in a leadership position and other chances to understand what it meant to be a listener, not a follower. I struggled under the academic rigor and competition, but it was all in preparation for my future college plans. Jericho made me grow up into someone I am proud to be.", 'While the atmosphere at Jericho High School can be very competitive and stressful at times, I do realize how fortunate I am to be attending a school with such great academics, resources, and recognition. I have many more opportunities to learn and grow here, but I do wish the general school culture would change a lot.', 'One of the best public high schools in the country for decades at this point. The teachers I had made a huge impression on me and helped me become the adult I am today.', '-Very supportive district. Really truly wants the best for the students and district. -Relatively small graduating class sizes. Small school. Teacher to student ratio definitely higher than other high schools. -Nicely diverse. Equal opportunities for all. Clubs, activities, etc.-On-campus grounds is very smart. -APs and scores do prepare for undergraduate. Education great for public school.-9 am - 3:30 pm schedule super convenient, better for high school kids, more productive and efficient', 'Great academics, fabulous teachers, and extensive resources make Jericho a great place to get an education.', 'There is so much to do at Jericho High School. Clubs are in the morning and sports are in the afternoon so student can do both instead of pick and choose. There are many different electives and everyone can study at their level.', 'Very focused on education. Sports and other extracurriculars are still important, but they take the back-seat. Work-wise, the school is pretty stressful and competitive.', 'the environment is competitive which makes me work harder. the teachers are super nice and helpful. this school has been ranked one of the top schools in the state and the nation. the students and the parents are all driven to succeed.', 'I will graduate from Jericho High School in 2019. JHS is a very nice place, but it’s extremely competitive. The students are good friends, but they all have a competitive nature somewhere in them. This may make it hard for certain students to do as well as they expect or be proud of themselves. Overall, it has been a great experience. However, I feel that had I been in a school with a lower rating, I would’ve been better off for college. Also, students should only come here while in middle school, not after high school starts.', 'Jericho High school is a top 100 high school in the nation, and it shows through the intensely competitive nature that each student has towards their education and grades. Academically, Jericho is fantastic, but I wish that it was more traditional in the athletic and school spirit sense.', 'Overall, Jericho High School is a good school: great academics, plenty of opportunities, and caring staff. Although, everyone\'s experience at Jericho varies depending on their own personal goals. There are a lot of high-achieving students, but there are also a lot of average students. Competitiveness ranges from the people you surround yourself with and how you deal with stress. The majority of teachers are supportive and put in a lot of effort in their job. Downsides of this school include lack of school spirit and lack of diversity. I wouldn\'t describe it as "cliquey" because there isn\'t a hierarchy, but friend groups are pretty solidly established here, and people tend stay in bubbles.', 'Most teachers at this school will help you find your passion. They care about each of their students, almost never forgetting anyone.', "The teachers and students at JHS know how to make you feel part of something great whether its through sports or clubs or their many activities after school. We come together like a family when there's a charity to support.  I know that if anything, I can always approach a member of the faculty or a parent.  The only thing that would probably need improvement is the cafeteria food."]
column6: ['I liked that it was very diverse and the teachers always wanted the students to do their best. However, I would have loved the staff to get more involved in social issues like bullying or racism.', 'I like the Jericho high school because as a new student in this school teachers are really polite and helpful. All type of facilities is provided to the students and good quality of education. Many advance placement courses are available for the students who want to take it. Awesome teachers and good school.', 'Very competitive environment, but everyone strives to do well. Education is very important and for the most part teachers care about students.', "I love school. However, some teachers make me hate it. They've been trying to get more strict when it comes to using phones in class, but no one listens.", 'Jericho Senior High School in Jericho, New York is a top-tier institution for learning. Learning from teachers of the highest caliber, Jericho students are exposed to various viewpoints, mindsets, and value sets when discussing any given topic. With such a diverse student body, Jericho students develop multi-cultural and multi-dimensional minds.', "It's a great school academically... it lacks in areas such as attitude and spirit. Everyone acts snobby and entitled.", 'Jericho is very competitive, which stresses students out, but it pushes students at the same time. Teachers vary from very influential to really uninformative. Almost all of the students go on to pursue a college career after high school!', 'Jericho gave me many opportunities to pursue classes that interested me and has amazing teachers. Everyone at Jericho is passionate and hard working but it was hard to make friends because of my hectic schedule.', 'Coming from a different middle school, Jericho High School is certainly NOT like any other high school. The atmosphere is completely different, one where the competition and expectations are extremely high; however, this competition motivates me to strive harder and motivates me to work smarter. It is the ideal school for someone with goals high in the sky.', "I enjoyed the friendships I made there and the classes that were offered. This year, as an elective, I took a Forensics class, in which I've learned a lot of interesting things regarding criminal investigation. I also took a sociology class, which supplanted an economics class, because it intrigued me. The class was wonderful and insightful, and it prepared me for college in many ways. The teachers at Jericho are great and enthusiastic about spreading their knowledge", 'Many clubs and organizations made available, lacked diversity, created a culture of college-prepping although not nearly as difficult to prep students for college courses', 'The school did a great job of improving my knowledge and depth in coursework and providing adequate challenges. The teachers really care that you learn the material and everyone really helps to  sure their students are on a path to success.', "The experience at Jericho is mostly shaped by who you are and what social group you choose to belong to. For the academically-inclined (mostly Asian), taking all the AP's possible, getting 4.0 GPA's, and winning science research awards are the main goals. For everybody else, keeping up with these kids while maintaining a social life is the objective. There is a lot of fear of peer competition and college affirmative action, so the former group is a formidable academic powerhouse that only gets stronger every year, which causes a lot of stress among students but improves Jericho's state and national rankings.", "Jericho provides students with many opportunities for academics but I found the environment very competitive, a little too competitive at times. If you want to excel, you have to take many APs, play sports, and have extracurricular activities. There are many cliques also. It is hard to join a friend group. The teachers and administrators are very bias to white people. They don't treat all students the same way. Some teachers are very bad, they just stand there and read a powerpoint. Teachers don't try to hide their feelings but show who their favorite students are. They don't try to understand the student but merely disregards whatever they have to say.", 'Love this school so much great times teachers and activities. The sports programs are great with amny options to choose from. I feel like the is truelly something that every student will enjoy. From the great music program with a chorus band and ochrastra to the theater departmant which puts on plays and musicals. The acidemic competitiveness  of the school makes everyone want to wotk hard and try there best to get the best grades.', 'Jericho offers small classes and lots of chances to excel.  Staff is caring.  We have lots of clubs and activities.  Jericho has a diverse population that is growing.  Jericho thinks about our future and prepares us for it. ', "Our school doesn't have too many problems with bullying. There isn't much intermingling between social groups.", "There are a lot of clubs/activities to choose from; however, many of them occur at the same time. A lot of the clubs also don't do anything and most people join to look good on their transcripts.", "I think every year had it's ups and downs. It also depends on how sociable you are. You can see some kids are having a great time but, others are excluded. Our school is like every other school on long island.", "With every school there are bound to be great teachers and not so great teachers. The great teachers are helpful, intelligent, inviting, and engaging. But, there are a couple of teachers that do not care about their students and don't teach very well. Overall, teachers are okay."]

column2: ['i did this in robotics class from corrigqns class because i bored loloalloloppp;pllolololoolololololololo lo lo lolo lo lo lo lo oolololololololoololololololo', "I graduated from Great Neck South High School in 2019. This high school has allowed me to acknowledge my potential and pushed me to work hard academically. With the wide range of AP classes available and subject-specific courses, one is able to learn a lot about what they want to do in the future. Besides the wonderful classes, it provides, Great Neck South High School's music and sports programs are also spectacular. Their music program nurtures beginner musicians into masters of their instruments by senior year. A selected amount of sports teams in this school is also recognized on a state level. Many athletes from this school tend to get recruited to prestigious colleges.", 'Great Neck South High was a great high school in my opinion. I developed relationships with my friends, educators, faculty, and other students. There are lots of resources that you can take advantage of in order to succeed in the future and especially during college. I wish I had the opportunity to figure out my future plans while in high school and adjust my class schedule. School environment was very competitive so it was a mixed environment to learn in.', 'Excellent education , very safe with little to no crime, everyone is very welcoming and friendly and teachers are very nice', "I attended Great Neck South High for my Junior and Senior year, it was great! I love the atmosphere here, and I had a lot of fun! Of course high school is stressful, but I got a lot of help when I could not do well in my classes. There's a study center tutors are available to all students, and teachers of most subjects offer extra help. A lot of clubs and activities are going on every single day! I had a really nice experience with school musicals and operas, and my talented classmates and teachers did a musical Mama Mia! within 3 months! There are performances by students almost every month as well. GNSHS also offers A LOT OF AP courses like art history and music theory while other schools don't. 10-ish teachers are doctors of different fields and they guide students to science competitions and DECA. Teachers, counselors, and administration officers are so nice and friendly! My math teacher and I became lifelong friends, which I am so happy about. The school is overall great!", "Great Neck South has a lot of opportunities given to students, just like any other high school. But, what makes them different is the environment. Our teachers are all very nice, open to students wants and needs, etc. One thing I hear my friends complain about is a lot of their teachers. Some don't teach well, while others have homework everyday and tests every week. It is stressful. Especially when us(students) have SAT tutoring, sports, and outside sports. We don't need that extra stress of being afraid to ask a teacher a question.", 'People are rude.... teachers are rude food is horrible i don’t recommend this school only good for education but it depends on your teachers i had a bad experience with ton of others', 'it is good and it is a supportive school. The academics can be very hard but the teachers are supportive.  The school is not very diverse with cultures. The school has many security guards and it is very safe. The cafeteria food is very gross and disgusting.', 'A very competitive culture keeps students motivated and always excelling. While it can be negative at times, it has pushed me to try harder. The teachers are very helpful, although the administration could be more open to change that the students want. Very diverse school with students who are welcoming to people of any race or ethnicity.', 'I liked the number of resources that were offered at the school. In terms of support, extra help, databases, etc.', "If you want a great education it's here. Good/great teachers and friends. I took advantage of the photography clubs and the band. Those are 2 of my favorite activities.I also learned about a great teen program outside of school. Its called BBYO. They are teen leadership, volunteer, organize and have lots of fun with great friends organization.I am very involved with this organization.Thank you", 'Its a very nice place that offers many diverse classes both regulars, honors, and AP. Most of the teachers here are very helpful and teach their topics well. The food in the cafe is mediocre though, and the only entry-level language class for anyone who moves here for high school is Spanish, while they have 3 other advanced language classes.', 'Great Neck South High has been an amazing school academically and incorporates very advanced material into teaching.', 'Great Neck South High School provides resources for students to use, such as extra help. GNSHS prepares students for college. Very prestigious public school in NY.', 'Top teachers in mathematics, music and Sports. Not so with the English teachers who are too interested in retirement than doing their job helping you understand material and usage in real world.  Also, I found a lot of the Guidance C. really were not aware of what was happening to students. It was almost like they were living in another universe, mine in particular never figured out I had some type of serious delay in my studies due to a series of health complications. I mean, why become a guidance counsellor if you are not able to see  or use good judgement that each student you are dealing with can as having aptitudes but still struggling for reasons they could have looked into.', "I've just recently transfered to this institution and it is unlike any average high school that I've been to. The staff as well as the students are welcoming and the resources that is accessable allows the working capacity of the over all school to be efficient. The athletic department is the school is also good as their are sports team available for every season.", 'Great Neck South is a great highschool. It has a great campus, with lots of parking for both students and teachers. As a graduate, it was a great experience.', 'I like how Great Neck South provides its students with countless opportunities through its numerous clubs and programs. Especially impressive are the math and science departments. Improvements could be made through introducing the idea of college to students during their freshmen year, as many students feel anxiety from a general feeling of unpreparedness by their junior year.', 'It’s such a diverse school that’s dedicated to making sure students reach their academic potential. I had an amazing time because of the clubs that I decided to join. Clubs at Great Neck South High are like families; they are inclusive, quirky, fun and unique.One thing that I would like to see change is the AP policy that our school has. We shouldn’t be required to pay ninety something dollars for a test just because we are in the AP class. We should have the choice of opting out on such an expensive test while still in the AP class because we want to learn the topic and be challenged.', 'As a senior of Great Neck South High School, I loved the support and caring nature of the faculty for the past 4 years. Even though I am not sure of the future ahead,  I am sure I am equipped with the tools so that I am ready to face any challenges in my way. The studious environment around me pushed me to work harder and achieve more than I could have ever expected.']

column6: ['Overall, it is a top school with very strong academics and a diverse student body  that is accepting and welcoming. The teachers genuinely care for the students and push them to excel beyond what students believe they are capable of. Despite the tough, serious environment filled with over-achieving students, school spirit is very prevalent and the competition is not unhealthy or evident among students.', 'I thought everything was great. The teachers were always there for their students, the assignments were an appropriate level of challenging and preparatory for college, and the extracurriculars were thriving. Great school and faculty.', 'Great environment for learning! Can be competitive but depends on every individual. Teachers are all (usually) really qualified and knowledgable. Also a pretty diverse student body.', 'Many courses offered and teachers are amazing. Clubs are always welcoming and often hold meetings to include membership.', 'Great Neck South High School is a great place to learn. All of the teachers care a lot about the students and everyone is motivated to do their best. The students are a bit stressed, but the school helps them by teaching them how to cope with it and move on in their life.', 'I want there to be more school spirit. I have been involved with pep rally and homecoming mostly because of my involvement in sports but students who are not in sports generally do not dress up for things like spirit week.', 'GNS is a extremely competitive in the classroom. There is a large separation among students based on their race/ethnicity and economic worth. The teachers are fantastic for the most part but give a huge work load.', 'I hope the students would come together more. There seems to be no school spirit whatsoever. Moreso, there seems to be a lack of communication between parents, the administration, and the students. This results in a feeling of distrust, and can often create problems that rarely get their proper attention.', "It was an amazing school all around. Great neck is a great area and community with much diversity. The school has great teachers that help with every child's needs. Teachers at Great Neck  South High School want too see you succeed and do everything possible for you too do the best you can truly do. This type of guidance really prepares you for your future.", 'Awesome school, great people, supurb education. Ranked one of the top schools in the country. You get a one of a kind education at this school.', "Awesome Awesome Awesome. The only High school that actually does FULL operas. The teachers are very nice, but they are also very knowledgeable. To apply, you must have at least a master's degree- or else you are not to teach in GNPS. So yes, that means that every teacher in the whole district has at least a Master's degree.", "Great student to faculty ratio. The teachers and staff really make every attempt to make sure you understand the lessons, they offer after school tutoring, free-period lessons, and really to above and beyond to take care of their students. From athletics, extracurriculars, and the wide array of choices for electives; the choice is really on the students hand. GNS offers a wide selection of languages, Latin, Mandarin, Hebrew and ASL ( to name the more unique ones). You are Truro you given every opportunity to succeed and the alumni really show you that they've taken every step towards facilitating the success of their future.", 'Its a great school and you can be very successful from it. People in this school with a poor socio-economic background in this school might suffer in terms of fitting in with classmates and participating in clubs and activities due their cost. However, the competitiveness in this school is great and people have great morals making it a very safe environment. The selection of sports is great but our teams lack/ are decent in performance because of the major focus in academics. Teachers are usually in the norm of supportive and are 99% of the time understanding of legitimate problems a student might have.', "It wasn't until I had reached college until I realized how amazing Great Neck South was and how I was so lucky to have gone through it. There are students at the top of everything imaginable, from academic to theater to graphic design to fencing. Although teachers are not necessarily nurturing, their toughness helped me in college where I don't feel as challenged as my peers.", "Decent school, most of the kids here are friendly. However, I feel that most teachers here don't care enough about their students. It might just be me.", 'The extracurricular activities are extremely diverse: Art, science, politics, philanthropy, academic...anything a child can want is available.', 'The school has a very strong science Dept and multiple science clubs', 'The teaching staff are an extremely group brilliant and dedicated professionals. The intergrate the use of technology with school issues iPads, electronic text books and other multi- media resources to prepare my child for college.  Great Neck South has a beautiful campus where the children play every kind of sport, nothing is missing.  The HS puts on an opera and no other HS in the country puts on an opera.  There are numerous fun and important clubs for the children to learn in other areas besides pure academics.', 'Expertly knowledgeable.  Some teachers are also college professors.', "There was an instance of extreme hate, but it was a picture made by a student at another school, not people from this school. Our diversity is fair ethnicity-wise. There isn't any public hate about sexual orientation, and people with opposing beliefs tend to keep quiet to avoid offending others. It is very unlikely you can go through four years at this school without befriending people of different races and sexual orientations."]
column8: ['Overall, it is a top school with very strong academics and a diverse student body  that is accepting and welcoming. The teachers genuinely care for the students and push them to excel beyond what students believe they are capable of. Despite the tough, serious environment filled with over-achieving students, school spirit is very prevalent and the competition is not unhealthy or evident among students.', 'I thought everything was great. The teachers were always there for their students, the assignments were an appropriate level of challenging and preparatory for college, and the extracurriculars were thriving. Great school and faculty.', 'Great environment for learning! Can be competitive but depends on every individual. Teachers are all (usually) really qualified and knowledgable. Also a pretty diverse student body.', 'Many courses offered and teachers are amazing. Clubs are always welcoming and often hold meetings to include membership.', 'Great Neck South High School is a great place to learn. All of the teachers care a lot about the students and everyone is motivated to do their best. The students are a bit stressed, but the school helps them by teaching them how to cope with it and move on in their life.', 'I want there to be more school spirit. I have been involved with pep rally and homecoming mostly because of my involvement in sports but students who are not in sports generally do not dress up for things like spirit week.', 'GNS is a extremely competitive in the classroom. There is a large separation among students based on their race/ethnicity and economic worth. The teachers are fantastic for the most part but give a huge work load.', 'I hope the students would come together more. There seems to be no school spirit whatsoever. Moreso, there seems to be a lack of communication between parents, the administration, and the students. This results in a feeling of distrust, and can often create problems that rarely get their proper attention.', "It was an amazing school all around. Great neck is a great area and community with much diversity. The school has great teachers that help with every child's needs. Teachers at Great Neck  South High School want too see you succeed and do everything possible for you too do the best you can truly do. This type of guidance really prepares you for your future.", 'Awesome school, great people, supurb education. Ranked one of the top schools in the country. You get a one of a kind education at this school.', "Awesome Awesome Awesome. The only High school that actually does FULL operas. The teachers are very nice, but they are also very knowledgeable. To apply, you must have at least a master's degree- or else you are not to teach in GNPS. So yes, that means that every teacher in the whole district has at least a Master's degree.", "Great student to faculty ratio. The teachers and staff really make every attempt to make sure you understand the lessons, they offer after school tutoring, free-period lessons, and really to above and beyond to take care of their students. From athletics, extracurriculars, and the wide array of choices for electives; the choice is really on the students hand. GNS offers a wide selection of languages, Latin, Mandarin, Hebrew and ASL ( to name the more unique ones). You are Truro you given every opportunity to succeed and the alumni really show you that they've taken every step towards facilitating the success of their future.", 'Its a great school and you can be very successful from it. People in this school with a poor socio-economic background in this school might suffer in terms of fitting in with classmates and participating in clubs and activities due their cost. However, the competitiveness in this school is great and people have great morals making it a very safe environment. The selection of sports is great but our teams lack/ are decent in performance because of the major focus in academics. Teachers are usually in the norm of supportive and are 99% of the time understanding of legitimate problems a student might have.', "It wasn't until I had reached college until I realized how amazing Great Neck South was and how I was so lucky to have gone through it. There are students at the top of everything imaginable, from academic to theater to graphic design to fencing. Although teachers are not necessarily nurturing, their toughness helped me in college where I don't feel as challenged as my peers.", "Decent school, most of the kids here are friendly. However, I feel that most teachers here don't care enough about their students. It might just be me.", 'The extracurricular activities are extremely diverse: Art, science, politics, philanthropy, academic...anything a child can want is available.', 'The school has a very strong science Dept and multiple science clubs', 'The teaching staff are an extremely group brilliant and dedicated professionals. The intergrate the use of technology with school issues iPads, electronic text books and other multi- media resources to prepare my child for college.  Great Neck South has a beautiful campus where the children play every kind of sport, nothing is missing.  The HS puts on an opera and no other HS in the country puts on an opera.  There are numerous fun and important clubs for the children to learn in other areas besides pure academics.', 'Expertly knowledgeable.  Some teachers are also college professors.', "There was an instance of extreme hate, but it was a picture made by a student at another school, not people from this school. Our diversity is fair ethnicity-wise. There isn't any public hate about sexual orientation, and people with opposing beliefs tend to keep quiet to avoid offending others. It is very unlikely you can go through four years at this school without befriending people of different races and sexual orientations."]

column1: Bergen County Technical High School - Teterboro
column2: ['Although I have enjoyed my time at the Bergen County Technical High School, I have found difficulty in the simplest of tasks including starting a club, speaking to administration without feeling put down, and finding teachers that grade me fairly based on the class I am taking. In comparison to other schools including the Bergen County Academies, the administration is incredibly strict and rude to an extent that students despise and cower in fear from them. While some teachers and incredible, others are extremely harsh and do not teach at a high school level but instead at a college level. Specifically one of the business teachers has made the past couple of years for BT students a nightmare however, administration fails to remove her from her job despite the terror she has inflicted on the lives of business major students. On the other hand, Bergen Tech has challenged me and incentivized me to work diligently towards my goals.', 'Bergen Tech has made me very prepared for college, and has taught me how to manage a heavy and academically-challenging work load. Along with this, the teachers are great and teach you skills that you can apply to other classes opposed to just memorizing information.', 'My experience here has been a positivie one.  I feel prepared to go foward and follow my journey through college.  The faculty in this school is great I just hope to see a larger variety in class electives prior to senior year.', 'By being in an environment in which likeminded students were put together, my time at Bergen Tech was made better with the easy access to friends. The people at this school were often very kind and approachable, making the overall experience much more enjoyable. The teachers were available for help whenever necessary, and were also very kind. I had poor experiences with very few teachers, which in a way weakened my liking of the school as a whole. However, the school was a very welcoming place and I had a very pleasant high school experience.', "Could not fit my (abbreviated) review of BT in the 1000 character limit imposed by this website, so I have pasted it into a pastebin link which you can access here: https://pastebin.com/Nv6cmrnhSummary: BT sucks, don't go here if you don't want to cut your lifespan by a decade.", "Bergen Tech was really great in preparing me for college. There were many things I learned in my AP Biology class that I'm now learning more in depth about in my third year of college. The curriculum at Bergen Tech is a lot more accelerated than those of other public schools. I do remember there being quite a bit of drama surrounding sexual harassment and the administrative staff so that didn't make my experience the most enjoyable but other than that, I am grateful to have been able to get my high school education from Bergen Tech.", 'As a current Senior, Bergen Tech has been a great experience. While it was difficult to adjust to when I  was a freshman, I definitely grew as a person there. Everyone is friendly and it is a great environment. Workload is difficult, but it is worth it by the end of the day. Overall BT is great.', 'Teterboro offers a wide variety of Advanced Placement options, but the majors limit your flexibility in choosing classes. In addition, our field is very small and the lack of windows makes the place sometimes feel very encapsulating.', 'Overall, BT is a very academically challenging school. Students and the staff alike are very intelligent. Two major downsides to this school however. 1) It’s location is across the street from an airport, which means the air quality index is terrible and the noise from aircrafts landing and taking off can sometimes be overbearing. 2) You cannot change your major once you apply to BT. In my opinion, there should be a one week period where freshmen are allowed to try out each major, and then decide what program they are most interested in. Athletics program is well below average, with the exception of a few sports.', 'Bergen Tech is a very academically rigorous high school with very smart students and staff. The teachers are extremely helpful and there is a wide variety of clubs and extracurriculars to select from. The only downside about Bergen Tech is its location.', 'It is a great school. The academic curriculum is rigorous and allows students to push themselves further. However, the sports department is not the strongest, and the arts department is not truly valued. The school is focused on academics and helps prepare students for college and university.', 'It’s a pretty good school, more academic rigor than most, but the selection you have over classes is subpar because of the Major you choose for the next four years. There’s no changing it like you would in college, which I hate because I regret mine. Horrible athletics other than a few sports', 'Excellent school extremely challenging. Teachers are always available to assist. The classes that are offered are all honors and above preparing students for next level education.', 'This is a very good place to learn more about a specific field that you may go on to study for in college. The teachers are helpful and very knowledgeable in their subjects, and even though it is stressful at times, it is a fulfilling experience.', 'Bergen Tech is an incredible school for those who wish to challenge themselves. The teachers and administration pride themselves in making sure students are ready for college within their four years as Knights.', 'Bergen County Technical High School in Teterboro has a great environment, filled with an encouraging and helpful community.', 'They really prepare you with the workload for college and the teachers are very helpful and supporting.  However, the work can become very overbearing at times and become too much for the students to handle, escpecially those who have after school commitments like sports and/or activities.', 'I have been going to Bergen Tech for the last four years. I will definitely say that for anyone looking to challenge themselves academically, this school is definitely worth applying to. There are AP classes for just about every subject being offered as early as freshman year. For the most part, the teachers are great and know the material well, as well as offer extra help if necessary nearly every day. The school is unique in that it has "majors", such as computer science, business, engineering, law, fashion, and others. These classes provide a basic look at what a major has to offer to help a student decide if this is something they might be interested in. There is a large amount of extracurricular activities and sports available as well. Overall, the school is definitely worth attending if you are willing to work harder than the average HS student to stay on top of your academics.', "I like my major that I'm in at Bergen Tech. I also think the music program is amazing and filled with talented musicians. There could maybe be more windows and less ants in the school.", 'Overall, the Bergen County Technical High School - Teterboro is not a bad school. The student body is diverse, there are many academic opportunities to pursue, and the classes prepare you well for AP tests. But the school lacks any sort of student life. Outside of its classes, there is almost nothing going for the school. The clubs are a joke, the music program is sad, and don\'t even get me started about the school\'s "field." And even the classes are sometimes unbearable. I\'m not gonna say which teachers, but some teachers are so old that they can\'t even turn their computer on, some teachers do absolutely nothing in Spanish class and pick favorites, and some teachers just want to give students bad grades.From my experience, the school only has such a good reputation because the students who come in are hard-workers. When hard-workers are put into an environment like this, they will still thrive, but will not be given the proper school life they deserve']

When hard-workers are put into an environment like this, they will still thrive, but will not be given the proper school life they deserve']
column6: ['I liked my experience at my high school because it helped me grow up and become prepared to go to college. I matured a lot and made good friends. I personally would like the school to have better lunches.', 'love it! its such a nice and welcoming school. everyone is also very smart. i hope to continue going to this school, and experience the next 3 year years :)', "My daughter attended BT, she excelled however she is a high achiever and would have excelled anywhere she attended. My son, also a high achiever is having a much better well rounded high school experience at our local high school. Quality of education is the same, material being covered is the same, as a matter of fact he often has to help his friends who attend the tech and academies schools. Also, as someone else stated in their review the administration seems to be accepting students with lower qualifications to improve the sports teams or as favors to people they know. My daughter attended  a great college due to very high SAT scores not solely BT reputation. She also didn't learn anything from her major at BT.  She did enjoy her time there, it's just not what you expect after all the hype. Try local public for a traditional experience it also positively impacts your community to stay local.", 'Bergen County Technical High School is an amazing place for a student to thrive because each kid is provided with ample opportunity to excel. There is a plethora of activities and an unbelievable amount of extracurriculars to pursue and teachers to learn from. It is designed to prepare every student for a college in a way that the regular high school cannot because it allows you to specialize in a specific field. However, every school has its flaws and at Bergen Tech, the biggest flaws are the sports and clubs. Bergen Tech sports teams are not the best and the clubs are very limited so that only two clubs can be joined by each student.', 'It is a very challenging school that actively pushes each of the students towards being the best they can be. While it can at times become overwhelming, the opportunities that are available and the overall college readiness make it all worth it.', "Not too bad. School can't be great. But this place wasn't awful. The teachers usually help you out if you need it. Guidance is great when it comes to college. Make sure you're nice to your guidance counselor.", "Way too much work and I'm not sure it was worth the stress, anxiety, and everything else in the end.", 'The school\'s surroundings are barren and very industrialized; it does not even have enough room for a football field, so the school borrows everything from Bergen Academies, which isn\'t much better in surroundings either. A large airport is parallel to the school as well which is bothersome and not very healthy considering the atmosphere is full of jet exhaust. As for the individuals who run the school, they are very sketchy. It seems they condone nepotism and "special favors" when accepting upcoming freshmen. The smartest people I know (A+ averages and 5\'s on PARCC exam) were not accepted to the high school, yet kids with B and C averages and no 5\'s on the PARCC exam got accepted because their parents were involved with Bergen Tech\'s staff. This disgusted me because when I had previously toured the school, they claimed that they "only accepted kids with A averages." This "acceptional" school does not live up to its hype.', "I loved my school. As a freshman at first I was hesitant because I was shy and didn't know if I would make friends. Now I don't want to leave.", 'This campus, although small, has a very familiar feel to it. It is very easy to get to know your peers and your teachers. Everything you want to know, whether it is about college or daily life in the school, will be adequately addressed by the amazing faculty members they have on campus. The school has a lot of good programs to offer as well. You can major in culinology, a newly patented program exclusive to the school, aerospace engineering and much more. The teachers are always open to talk about anything, whether it is personal or about assignments.', "I had a great time Bergen County Technical School as a student. Not only was there a diverse collection of students and teachers but everyone was so motivated and dedicated to their individuals' roles/jobs. I've received constructive criticism from teachers and peers that helped form me into a better student and this school helps prepare you for college and finding a major that best suits you. The school is very clean and the lunch stuff prepares healthier meals and a wide array of food that I've never seen in any other high school.", "- The teachers and guidance counselors are generally very nice and willing to listen to you. My gc doesn't really reply to emails, but luckily I've been able to just walk in and have a meeting sometimes, esp. senior year because they prioritize our concerns with apps. - Some teachers are great and truly care about student's growth, but some hate their job or don't know what they're doing. - I wish some resources (e.g. 3D printer) were more readily accessible / that I could take a class on how to 3D model and print. This might be a high expectation for a lot of schools, but considering that this is a technical school I think it's reasonable.- We don't have a wide variety of course options. I basically couldn't take any electives freshman or sophomore year. I also had to drop French senior year because it only ran during the same period as Calc.- If you major in computer science be prepared to do a lot of nothing. A lot of us feel like we haven't really learned anything practicable.", 'Great teachers, friendly students and interesting and challenging classes.  Counselors are very helpful with college process.', 'Made me very prepared for college even though it was a tough four years- my overall experience was great.', 'Bergen Technical High School is a very rigorously academic school. It is more accelerated than other high schools and it prepares you for college.', "Your experience is dependent upon the teachers you get, as well as the classes you take, as they help shape your high school life. Some teachers genuinely care about your personal development and your comprehension of the material, while others give you work without caring if you understand the work you're being given. The competitive environment can be detrimental but can actually motivate you to try to do better and aim for higher goals. The school also gives you easy access to AP and dual enrollment classes, which boosts the rigor of your course load. However, they still place an emphasis on personal development and try to decrease the stress felt by students. There are resources available for any issues you have.", 'Bergen County Technical High School - Teterboro is an excellent school for its academics. There is no place better. It has very diverse and intense major concentrations for students to choose from and every one is great. The culture and environment is very friendly yet hard working and you are pushed to your very best.', 'Bergen Tech is not a fun and enjoyable school but if you want alot of opportunities to challenge yourself and to be surrounded by like minded individuals who value school over almost everything then BT is definitely the place for you. The worst part about the school is the location by far. We have no football field, the parking lot constantly floods, the gym shakes every time a plane flys by (BT is next to an airport) and when it rains the ceiling leaks. Other than that it is a great school.', "As a former student of Bergen County Technical High School, I would say that the school definitely lives up to its name and high-ranking award ship. I was a part of the Law and Justice major from 2013-2017 and throughout this time I was definitely prepared for college. The workload is rigorous but professional staff and other resources are constantly available to talk and work with each individual student. The school is bound to a contract with Food Works and I must say the food was absolutely terrible. For a school who receives so much money, it was truly shocking that for years the administration ignored students' requests to allocate money to a better food provider. Ignoring that fact, the school is excellent and constantly progressing. I was thankful that I went to BCTHS and I give them credit for the success I continue to achieve in college.", 'This is a great school. It over prepared me for life outside high school and college. Great faculty.']
