I've received constructive criticism from teachers and peers that helped form me into a better student and this school helps prepare you for college and finding a major that best suits you. The school is very clean and the lunch stuff prepares healthier meals and a wide array of food that I've never seen in any other high school.", "- The teachers and guidance counselors are generally very nice and willing to listen to you. My gc doesn't really reply to emails, but luckily I've been able to just walk in and have a meeting sometimes, esp. senior year because they prioritize our concerns with apps. - Some teachers are great and truly care about student's growth, but some hate their job or don't know what they're doing. - I wish some resources (e.g. 3D printer) were more readily accessible / that I could take a class on how to 3D model and print. This might be a high expectation for a lot of schools, but considering that this is a technical school I think it's reasonable.- We don't have a wide variety of course options. I basically couldn't take any electives freshman or sophomore year. I also had to drop French senior year because it only ran during the same period as Calc.- If you major in computer science be prepared to do a lot of nothing. A lot of us feel like we haven't really learned anything practicable.", 'Great teachers, friendly students and interesting and challenging classes.  Counselors are very helpful with college process.', 'Made me very prepared for college even though it was a tough four years- my overall experience was great.', 'Bergen Technical High School is a very rigorously academic school. It is more accelerated than other high schools and it prepares you for college.', "Your experience is dependent upon the teachers you get, as well as the classes you take, as they help shape your high school life. Some teachers genuinely care about your personal development and your comprehension of the material, while others give you work without caring if you understand the work you're being given. The competitive environment can be detrimental but can actually motivate you to try to do better and aim for higher goals. The school also gives you easy access to AP and dual enrollment classes, which boosts the rigor of your course load. However, they still place an emphasis on personal development and try to decrease the stress felt by students. There are resources available for any issues you have.", 'Bergen County Technical High School - Teterboro is an excellent school for its academics. There is no place better. It has very diverse and intense major concentrations for students to choose from and every one is great. The culture and environment is very friendly yet hard working and you are pushed to your very best.', 'Bergen Tech is not a fun and enjoyable school but if you want alot of opportunities to challenge yourself and to be surrounded by like minded individuals who value school over almost everything then BT is definitely the place for you. The worst part about the school is the location by far. We have no football field, the parking lot constantly floods, the gym shakes every time a plane flys by (BT is next to an airport) and when it rains the ceiling leaks. Other than that it is a great school.', "As a former student of Bergen County Technical High School, I would say that the school definitely lives up to its name and high-ranking award ship. I was a part of the Law and Justice major from 2013-2017 and throughout this time I was definitely prepared for college. The workload is rigorous but professional staff and other resources are constantly available to talk and work with each individual student. The school is bound to a contract with Food Works and I must say the food was absolutely terrible. For a school who receives so much money, it was truly shocking that for years the administration ignored students' requests to allocate money to a better food provider. Ignoring that fact, the school is excellent and constantly progressing. I was thankful that I went to BCTHS and I give them credit for the success I continue to achieve in college.", 'This is a great school. It over prepared me for life outside high school and college. Great faculty.']

column1: The Academy for Mathematics, Science & Engineering
column2: ['It’s a great school for those wanting a STEM experience before reaching college, regardless of the fact that they may not want to pursue an engineering, or science field as their career. However, the classes are extremely rigorous, and if are not committed 101%, you should reconsider your choice to enroll. Regardless, the school is fruitful and wildly exciting because of all the like-minded students and faculty all ready to help!', 'AMSE is an amazing opportunity if your child is accepted into their rigorous program. It is a program that demands all their time and energy and is extremely competitive. My child found the social aspect the most difficult being that the students are not the easiest to become friends with, but was still driven to continue in spite of this because she loved the academic rigor. The Academy students are prepared well for selective colleges and will be challenged daily. In the future, I would like to see more diversity in choosing accepted students and a culture of acceptance among fellow Academy students.', 'I love the setting where everyone is encouraged to pursue whatever they are passionate about. There are tons of maker spaces where students can get their creative juices flowing. I would have more lounge-type spaces in the school where students can collaborate and share ideas during lunch. The cafeteria can get quite boring sometimes.', "The whole curriculum is well thought-out and does a great job setting up students for success in STEM-oriented fields. The students are all very intelligent and motivated to do well. While this can lead to competition between students, the small class size (although it has expanded since I graduated) and the joint camaraderie of going through this unique experience offsets this somewhat. Where the Academy continues to have issues is in teaching quality and diversity. While there are many teachers who care about the students and their teaching, there are many others who are more than happy to coast on the students' hard-working tendencies and do little in the way of real teaching. Furthermore, the demographic profile is extremely homogenous - the vast majority of students are high-income, and the class is roughly 60-70% Asian.All in all, while its self-driven nature and rigorous curriculum isn’t for everyone, if you're passionate about STEM this is a great place to learn and grow.", 'This school is pretty outstanding for a school that does not get a reputation it deserves. The course is rigorous and yes it challenges their students but is sometimes overbearing as it does not leave time for extra curriculum activities. Honestly, the teachers give pretty hard tests and the CAD classes are great and ahead of its time.  The only problem is the diversity. The majority of the school is Asian and it can be very different for students to adjust to. Also fitting in at Morris Hills can be difficult in the beginning but it is overall a school that is worth it.', "The Academy is an incredibly rigorous, cutthroat school. Most students are very hardworking and have high GPAs. Although it fosters an environment of academia, it does become too intense at points and could affect the students' mental health. Also, the downfall to this is that students are so focused on studies and are sheltered in this little group of 20 that it is rare for any to venture into the social sphere and try doing new things, hindering their social and emotional development.", 'So far in my career as a high school student attending the Academy For Mathematics, Science, and Engineering, I have had many pleasant experiences and many learning opportunities. This school maintains its academic reputation with challenging courses and a huge workload, but it also is unique in the regard of class size. In my 26 student class, we have made bonds that extend out of the classroom, and are beneficial in developing each of us as human beings. Some of the teachers, such as Mr. Schuenzel, also focus on teaching lessons about life instead of only reading the scripted lesson plan. However, this style of school is both a blessing and a curse, as it places immense amounts of stress on the students. Many of my friends are forced to ruin their sleep schedules and cancel social plans to study. In addition, the school administration assumes that students who join this program have already decided their career path in Engineering, and there is very little exposure to other fields.', 'Great overall school, has probably the best math department in the country with teachers like Mr. Bermel.', "There's a good variety of clubs that stretch over multiple subjects.  We have a good number of volunteer-work clubs (Key Club, HOPE Club, etc.)m science clubs (chemistry club, Science Olympiad, physics club), and language clubs (Spanish, French, and German). I feel like there are clubs that have very dedicated advisors and ones that have ones who couldn't care less.  There are also a lot of honor societies students can apply for (science, social studies, english, math, national, art, language, business, and music)", 'My best experiences are outside this program like Morris Hills sports and events.', "The teachers are mainly fine. There are, however, only a few who are passionate about what they teach.  It's not necessarily a bad thing if a teacher isn't super enthusiastic, though.", 'There are a plethora of activities.  Furthermore, if students want to create a new club, the procedure to do so is relatively easy and supported by administration and district.  Numerous sports, arts clubs, foreign language clubs, computer programming, chess, you name it they have it.', 'I knew I wanted to attend this school for the 3 years before I applied and was accepted.  I was drawn to the small class size, the credentials of the faculty and the strong curriculum.  The sky is the limit for students.  IF they envision it, they can do it.  I would choose this school again.  It is family.', 'The faculty and staff at the school are dedicated, hardworking, and enthusiastic. They want to see their students succeed.  They engage students through skillful use of humor, information and teaching skill making students want to learn and be there.', "Luckily being the #3 best high school in the country (thanks Newsweek) almost makes up for any crappy things about the Academy. It is an extremely high work load and the classes are challenging. In addition certain teachers are incompetent but have been there long enough to slip under the radar. Some of the teachers are extremely well educated but poor at explaining information to previously unexposed students. I have been encountered both the experience of being a struggling student in certain subjects as well as a top performer watching others struggle without teacher assistance. In some classes you are just out of luck if you don't inherently make the connections or adapt perfectly to the prof's teaching style because they will not adjust to varying student strengths and learning styles. If you struggle to follow in Math Analysis 1 and 2 (required classes) you are basically screwed because the teacher will be of no assistance. Hire a tutor. That is the best advice I have found for any of the classes. No need to be embarrassed as you will soon overtake others in understanding and performance. On the plus side, the Academy has a tight knit social group and you will become fast friends with almost all of your peers. The interviews weed out most people with poor character, so most students are hard working, witty and eager to become friends. Luckily not all of the teachers are poop (most of them are quite good) and as an Academy student you will get to take some unique and challenging classes such as biotechnology, computer aided drafting and fundamental of engineering. To sum up, you will constantly be working and sleep deprived, will learn more in 4 years than you thought possible and will come out with a group of extremely close friends (who will end up being excellent  connections in the future). The college and ivy placement rate is through the roof", "The small class and directed curriculum is great and makes the students feel like they're being carefully selected; however, this does bloat egos and makes for unrealistic expectations for what they can or cannot do. Also, though the student aren't officially ranked, there is still a valedictorian at the end of the 4 years, and ranking lists are not kept confidential by the guidance office. Overall, the classes are fantastic though--the technical experience really starts making an impact in the junior year and senior year. The very best parts of the Academy was the senior-year internship experience where students could get real work experience, and biotechnology class where students were able to use lab techniques not normally available to high school students (and every quarter had a day where the students cooked breakfast-on-demand for the teachers).", 'Some teachers know what they are doing, others have strict and unnecessary grading policies that kill your GPA for no reason.', 'My bus driver comes from my own district and he is great! Have had him for years and he is super nice. Always on time too.', 'The Academy is known for its academics and high success on standardized tests', 'The Academy is not very diverse']

column2: ['Very good high school that prepares students for college as well as entry into the health career of their choice. Classes are very interactive, ranging from in-school EMT training/certification, real-life forensic scenarios, and other classes that help prepare students for the real world. A very engaging class to be a part of.', 'It’s a very good school. Welcoming and accepting. Sometimes it seems dull and bleak with tons of work, however push through it and it’s worth it.', 'The Academy for Allied Health Science was a very rigorous school with curriculum that prepares you for college.', 'Allied Health provides a rigorous academic environment, but has no sports teams. It is based on the health field and each year, one will take specialized classes and have a chance to skip out of core courses such as math. The people are really friendly, but there is a lot of stress.', 'Academy for Allied Health Sciences is the perfect high school for you to attend if you want to study in a medical field. Allied Health provides the perfect transition from middle school to high school. The school provides rigorous coursework to help prepare you for college. The teachers are exceptional and very welcoming. I would definitely give this school five stars.', "AAHS is very nice. If you are looking to go into the medical field, this high school is perfect. While most teachers are nice, there are a few bad apples. Plus, a few teachers teach things that they aren't qualified to teach. You also get certified in CPR and First Aid, which is beneficial for any job. The school itself is filled with nice people and is very strict when it comes to anti-bullying measures. It's also very, very safe. While it doesn't have sports besides intramurals, the funds not spent on sports is used towards other things, from keeping the building clean and safe to fun events, such as the big Relay for Life event we have once a year. There are people from a variety of backgrounds, which we and other schools on campus celebrate the cultures of on AHA day. They are very good at helping students prepare for college, from helping with college essays to having you take a Financial Literacy course. All in all, this is still a pretty great high school.", 'It is an overall amazing school that gave mean countless amounts of opportunities I would have never had other wise.', 'The school is excellent at preparing students for college and university. In addition there medical vocational classes are excellent and allows for students to become certified in basic life support, as well as becoming a possible EMT.', 'I enjoy the fact that the school provides a vast amount of opportunities to explore the medical field through classes, clubs, and even assemblies. It is a fantastic school for incoming high school students who see themselves pursuing a medical career.', 'I liked the environment in which everyone wanted to learn and further their education. You really feel pushed to do your best academically and they want you to strive to be your best. The administration is very understandable and easy to talk to even if one does have trouble handling the heavy workload and ensure each person is able to succeed. The main things I would change is the cafeteria food and possibly adding a sports team. it can sometimes be a struggle if you play sports since you must play for your home town and may miss class to do so. Apart from this, there is not too much to complain about if you are willing to work.', 'very hard to get in, very hard to stay in as it is extremely competitive. to say the least, one will be prepared for the best colleges when you graduate high school.Professional staff who find a good balance between intervention and letting you find the solutions on your own. Amazing campus. Intramural sporting activities. You have to go back to your local township high school for varsity level sports.', "The school had a very tough curriculum, and I would recommend it to anyone who is interested in the Health Sciences. Personally, I believe I had an OK experience. There's no GPA scale, however, and the school uses an unweighted average, which may hurt you when you apply to colleges.", 'Other than the students (they are awkward but nice), everything here is great! The academics are rigorous and challenging, and you can tell every student cares deeply about their grades. However, only come here if you have a strong interest in the medical field that you want to stick with; your time will be miserable if you are not interested.', 'I love being challenged everyday and learning about many aspects of the health profession. This school helped me decide to pursue the health sciences and I love it. The only thing I would like to see changed is for there to be more non-academic activities for students.', 'Choosing to attend AAHS is the best decision I have ever made.  As a senior, I have grown to be close friends with students from Rahway, Clark, Cranford, and Roselle Park, just to name a few.  These are superlative people who I otherwise would never have the opportunity to meet.  My experience at Allied Health has been wonderful thanks to my classmates and the extraordinary faculty and administration.  The principal, the guidance counselors, and the teachers are all passionate about seeing the students thrive here.  They are invested in our success.The Academy for Allied Health Sciences has offered me tremendous opportunities to explore the different avenues available in health care and understand the future of medicine.', "As a rising senior, I can say that these past three years at Allied have certainly been memorable. Vigorous and challenging, but manageable if you put in the time and effort to understand what is being taught. This school prepares all its students from freshman year and onward for the health care profession by providing a unique, in-depth foundation. The school does not lack in diversity, but is still predominantly white - if that is an issue for anyone. There aren't many areas for change except trivial matters such as the food. Overall, a fantastic school that should not harbor any feelings of regret for attending.", "My experience at the Academy for Allied Health Sciences has been rewarding and one that I know has prepared me for the next four years of my life beyond its doors. With top notch academics, rigorous courses and top of the line teachers and administration, it is no wonder why alumni return and express upon current students how prepared they were for the work load and rigor that college students face. In addition to academics, Allied Health and the rest of the schools on its campus are home to many active clubs and activities, specifically including the Student Movement Against Cancer and Multicultural Club, which displays our school's diversity and drive toward helping others, and also encourages a multitude of parent involvement. Back in the classroom, students have access to many resources and are never a step behind in innovations in technology. Besides our average cafeteria food, Allied Health is an extraordinary, safe, diverse and academically challenging place to go to school.", 'Best high school ever. It is filled with motivated students and helpful teachers. The school environment was great. I was part of the class of 2016 where we had less than 70 students. It is a small school vibe in a large UCVTS community. This school is very rigorous and you have to be motivated.', "There is no peer pressure. People will become friends with you, and will accept you. I have never seen anyone isolated. There's not too much racial diversity, but everyone gets along just fine. People with different sexual orientations are accepted just the same. We have a very liberal campus. Not too many people bully, it happens on occasion, and its never anything serious, usually the people who do it, learn from it and feel horrible afterwards. Everyone here is accepting of one another.", 'You can take graduate level math here (not undergraduate...graduate!). It goes from combined algebra, to geometry/trigonometry, precalculus, AP Calculus I A/B, AP Calculus II B/C, Multivariable Caclulus, Linear Algebra, Linear Programming, and it even goes beyond that to some statistical type of math. They also offer AP Biology, AP Chemistry, AP Statistics, AP Macro/Micro Economics, AP Physics Mechanics, AP Physics Electricity and Magnetism, AP Literature. They also have an immense amount of options for non AP courses.']

Back in the classroom, students have access to many resources and are never a step behind in innovations in technology. Besides our average cafeteria food, Allied Health is an extraordinary, safe, diverse and academically challenging place to go to school.", 'Best high school ever. It is filled with motivated students and helpful teachers. The school environment was great. I was part of the class of 2016 where we had less than 70 students. It is a small school vibe in a large UCVTS community. This school is very rigorous and you have to be motivated.', "There is no peer pressure. People will become friends with you, and will accept you. I have never seen anyone isolated. There's not too much racial diversity, but everyone gets along just fine. People with different sexual orientations are accepted just the same. We have a very liberal campus. Not too many people bully, it happens on occasion, and its never anything serious, usually the people who do it, learn from it and feel horrible afterwards. Everyone here is accepting of one another.", 'You can take graduate level math here (not undergraduate...graduate!). It goes from combined algebra, to geometry/trigonometry, precalculus, AP Calculus I A/B, AP Calculus II B/C, Multivariable Caclulus, Linear Algebra, Linear Programming, and it even goes beyond that to some statistical type of math. They also offer AP Biology, AP Chemistry, AP Statistics, AP Macro/Micro Economics, AP Physics Mechanics, AP Physics Electricity and Magnetism, AP Literature. They also have an immense amount of options for non AP courses.']
column6: ["The nurse here is really nice. We also have an EMT program, if anything were to happen, it seems like the right place to be. If the EMTs are not here, all of the gym teachers are CPR and First Aid Certified as well as many other teachers (one of the fitness teachers here also volunteers as an EKG specialist). They have training sessions for all of the teachers to sit in on lectures for CPR and everything. The safety here is incredible. There have been heart attack incidents, a student was once run-over, and everything was coordinated perfectly, from the student's cooperation in lock downs to the calling 911 (by the way, there is a building right next to ours where they train police officers), to the cpr certified gym teachers running with AED's toward the injured student. It really is the safest school to choose.", 'Because this is a school specific to the allied health sciences, HOSA (health occupations students of america) is huge here as well as SMAC(student movement against cancer)/relay for life. However, there are still other options unrelated to the health field. There is math league (which participates in several competitions). There is science olympiad, intramurals, National Honor Society, National Spanish Honor Society, chess club (participates in various competitions), robotics, etc, there are so many options.', 'Mostly everyone at this school is kind, intelligent, and interesting. Everyone has their own talents and strengths. Even though many people are great and want to achieve many things, it does not create a competitive environment like many would expect. The quality that stands out the most about this school is that EVERYONE helps each other, even if they are not close friends. Its almost as if the difficulty of the high school has brought people close together. Everyone learns how to work together and organize the most fun school events and fundraisers. I would go to this school and do it all over, just for the fun of it. The people here are great and I remember great times when I think about the school. \r The amount of work you are given, on the other hand, makes one want to lock himself in a room and study all day long, everyday. After freshman year, mostly everyone gets the hang of the workload and learns how to study efficiently with actual free time on their hands.', "The teachers are really great at explaining things. On rare occasions, if a student feels that he is not learning, it is most likely because the student does not ask any questions or for any help. However, the teachers here are excellent and are always willing to take a step back and clarify anything a student might be having trouble with. Also, many teachers are involved with extracurricular activities and encourage students to participate as they help with the learning experience.\r Many of the teachers here care about the students a lot. For the most part, fair exams are given and it is usually never the teacher's fault if a student falls behind (the courses here are pretty difficult). They also speak to the students and give great advice on how to study. The teachers really get to know the students here. They learn everyone's name, and know who everyone is, as well as what they do and what they aspire to be.", 'Plenty of opportunities to choose from!', 'The teachers are devoted to making students succeed.', 'Probably the safest and cleanest', 'I wish there was more.. Since commuting can be difficult, staying after school is limited for many people', 'Could be very stressful and depressing at times BUT other times, its one of the best places to be', 'The school offers many oppurtunities.', 'Our schools technological advances make it possible for us to be well updated and have some of the best resources. Each year something new is introduced and i as a student am thankful for the constant updates we receive.', "For the number of years i have attended this school i have always questioned my reason of being here. I still do. But, i know there is a driving force which keeps me from leaving. The friends i have made and the events that people come up with to better the spirits of the students are some of the few reasons as to why i believe i never could leave. I understand this school is still building on compared to school which have stood over 100 years. At the end i realize how lucky i am to be part of such a remarkable part of the Union County history. The unique aura of genuine kindness and the passion for learning is what makes it so great and i cherish all the memories i have made while attending this school. If i were to choose whether to go to this school again... i think i would, the experience is once in a lifetime and i believe its made me a bit confused but that's okay because it means i am being exposed to the different fields of life and it shows me that there is so much more out there than what i had first thought before being accepted into the school.", 'Since there are no sports a lot of students feel deprived, like me but it was not something we did not expect so it was okay. Although it would be nice to have them because i believe our school would do great not only academically but in such areas as this as well.', 'The teachers of this school i would say are some of the best. They never fail to push us to understand the topics at hand and make sure to engage each and every student as much as they can. Some are easier to talk to then others but that is okay. They make sure we are at the top of our game and as much as we rely on them they do as well, asking us questions on how to improve the course and make it better to understand. In cases where a student may not get a particular topic the teacher would respond by giving a well developed answer that reaches far beyond what the student had imagined would be a simple response. Overall they push us to know more than just what is said in a text book and never fail to give real life examples for better understanding.', 'Our school is becoming more and more diverse each passing year and the community we share is very welcoming with no discrimination towards anyone whether it be their race, religion, sexuality and others. We learn to function as a family more so than a student teacher body and so each year our school is able to welcome new members with the same embrace previous years were given.', "There are a lot of different clubs and activities in our school such as multicultural club, dance club, drama club, chess club, HOSA, SMACC, and many more. Each of which have very committed members. Since i am not necessarily involved in any of these directly i'm not sure how they run but i do know that teachers put in their time to help run these clubs whether they be after school or during free periods.", 'My school is very safe. In fact there is a police academy on campus that appoints officers in training to each school. During health emergencies, everyone on campus is sent to the nurse for checkups and we have an established bullying policy "HIB" which the administration takes seriously, making sure students are being treated equally and are able to learn in a bully free environment. In case of health emergencies such as sudden collapses or related events we have a team of teachers who have approved CPR licenses. So overall my school environment is very safe.', 'Amazing food and a wide span of options', 'Curriculum is one of the best in the state and country', 'Guidance, teachers, staff all want and work remarkably hard for students to succeed and follow their own paths.  The school, Baxel Hall, is beautiful inside and out, with brand-new, clean facilities.  College prep is additionally incredibly helpful, starting freshman year.']

column2: ['Great school if you are interested in Computer Technologies. Lots of opportunies and great student community', 'The Academy for Information Technology in Scotch Plains, New Jersey is an excellent school. At this school you will be challenged to do your best.', 'I like the ability to take business classes as well as IT classes. I would like there to be a wider variety of world language classes, rather than having just Spanish available.', 'I really liked how AIT made a smaller group of high-achieving kids who wanted to do well. We all supported each other and we wanted to lift each other up rather than push each other down. The teachers were very supportive despite their issues with administration. Administration did weigh down on students a bit which impacted some aspects of the student life. But fellow peers and the teachers made up for it, through school events, club meetings and events, and social hangouts.', 'AIT is home to dedicated teachers and motivated students. Students help and support each other. The student population is diverse.', 'AIT has the resources necessary to succeed for the two vocational paths offered there: Business & Information Technology. Introductory courses are provided such as Computer Applications in Business which combine IT and Business by getting the student certified in Microsoft Office and IC3. Sophomore year gives you the opportunity to experience an AP course (Computer Science Fundamentals) and a business course (Principles of Business & Finance). Computer Science helps in the logic behind programming and allows students to learn languages such as Javascript. Sophomore year is the year when the path you are pursuing is finalized by the end of the school year. business classes are still available to me Junior year as electives through the IT path. However, students planning to go the business path do not have the opportunity to go into some of the IT courses provided at AIT. The focus on these courses as well as the honors classes provided at the school make the school worthwhile.', 'The Academy for Information Technology is a stressful environment that continues to cause students extreme stress. Because it is a vocational school, teachers do not always have to be certified. The staff and students are not all qualified to do what they are supposed to do. I will give the school the benefit of the doubt and say that it has taught me a lot, but only after extreme stress and lots of self-studying. All students at this school would agree.', "AIT has definitely done a great job at preparing me for a college experience. The curriculum is very rigorous and is backed up with some of the best teachers I'll ever have. The only thing I didn't like was the lack of spirit, mainly due to the fact that we have no sports teams, no homecoming, no pep rallies, etc.", "Throughout my years at AIT, there are many things that I found unique to this high school experience. I loved having the opportunity to meet people from different towns and cultures who had similar academic interests as me. There were also many career specific classes that were offered here that I wouldn't have been able to take at my town high school. The schedule is also really convenient. Since there is an A/B day schedule,  you have the opportunity to visit a teacher twice before the next lecture. This is helpful because the classes are very rigorous. The school itself is also student friendly: it’s clean, easy to get around, and it provides lots of places where students could do work or study. One thing that I did not like at first was that AIT did not have varsity sports, but as time progressed I started to find it pretty cool that your friends from school could be your rivals on the field (you have the opportunity to compete for your town’s team).", 'This school was a great wat to get prepared for a career in any computer science or business related field. They have great teachers and facilities that really help students learn and grow.', "I am very glad that I went to AIT because it prepared me for college in ways that I didn't think were possible. The curriculum is top-notch and the culture/environment is amazing and it can sometimes feel like a college campus. There are some drawbacks, like no sports teams, but you get accustomed to it after the first year or so. The faculty is a mix-bag because while there are some teachers and faculty members I still enjoy talking to; there is a fair amount that I would be glad if I never see again. But you can easily ask upperclassman and they will tell you who to avoid.", "I love the opportunities provided by the school. The staff is friendly and welcoming, and above all else has the students's interests at heart.", 'AIT is an amazing school. The teachers at AIT all seem to care about the success of the students. While some of the teachers are not the best, the majority of the teachers at AIT are great teachers. The environment of AIT is generally supportive, with teachers always willing to work with struggling students, and said students easily able to get help with topics they struggle in. There are many clubs on the UCVTS campus, with most allowing for all schools, including AIT, to join. One of the most popular clubs for AIT is FBLA. In general, I feel prepared for the future of college.', 'It is a great school with great kind and memorable people. It definitely challenges you and prepares you for college courses.', 'The Academy for Information Technology is a highly ranked vocational high school that focuses on Information Technology and Business. From the very beginning, my course work was very vocational focused. In addition, there are many opportunities for earning certifications which are incredibly useful for me not only for my college applications but future work opportunities. Due to the focused classes “fun” electives are usually not offered. AIT does not have sports which is a wasted opportunity due to the many athletes that go here. This also leads to a lack of school spirit. What the school lacks in sports it makes up for club; the most notable being our successful chapter of the Future Business Leaders of America. AIT is not for everyone, the rigorous and focused coursework requires a lot of work and dedication and makes many feel like they are missing out on the “normal” high school experience however, AIT can promise a unique experience that leaves you ready for the future.', 'Great school with great teaching facilities for anyone interested in Computer Science, Information Technology, and Business.', 'This school is part of a five school campus. AIT focuses on Business and Information Tech exclusively. The environment is super friendly and most teachers are understanding. All classes are honors level or higher which make it more challenging than your average school. Even though everyone is from a different town, the school system makes it possible for you to have time to work on group projects during school hours, participate in clubs, and participate in sports in your home town. The school does an amazing job in academics, I just wish we had more options for electives outside of AIT.', "I'm having a wonderful experience at the Academy for Information Technology. The school acquires the best and the brightest students from around Union County. There's even an performance test just to enter even though it's a public school. The school provides a diversified environment for the ideal student and has excellent academic standards. All classes there are considered to be honors courses and has a ton of AP courses for college readiness. With a specialty in information technology and business, the students get a real sense of the real world experience. From the beginning of freshman year, students are given opportunities to obtain certifications in softwares such a Microsoft and Oracle. By the end of their four years, students will be more than ready for College.", 'It has a great atmosphere, but sometimes good grades are prioritized over learning.', 'All teachers are very knowledgable. Many teachers go above and beyond to make sure that their students succeed, but a few need to work harder to make students feel that they are capable of being successful.']

column6: ["Personally, I would say the extracurriculars aren't that great. I know that this is an education-based school, but I really think it would be a great decision to somehow incorporate sports. With sports in the picture, students will be much more active as school, both academically and socially. As for clubs and organizations, I think the school has some really cool things! I would have never learned about Relay for Life if I hadn't attended AIT. I also like FBLA since it incorporates one of the studies at AIT. The students are also very dedicated to their clubs.", "Overall, the experience that I've had at AIT has been amazing. I have learned so much, academically and emotionally. I was pushed to become a better student and a better student. Some of my favorite experiences were participating in Relay for Life, attending Project Hope and meeting new people. There are many things that make this school unique. For starters, the school is very diverse. There are students from all over Union County that have many different backgrounds. Another unique quality of my school is the ability to get certified in many different computer applications, such as Microsoft, Oracle Sequence and CompTIA. If I could do it all over again, I would most likely choose to attend AIT. Although I may have missed out on certain sporting events or typical high school experiences, I am now able to see the world from a different perspective. I have so many different views on different cultures and opinions. I have also received a spectacular education.", "Overall, the quality of the teachers in my high school is good. Some of the teachers are better than others, but most of them are great. Certain teachers have the perfect teaching style that keep the students engaged and also effectively get the message across. I would say the teachers are rather intelligent. Not all of the teachers have the same amount of knowledge that other teachers have, which is a disadvantage to those particular students in that particular teachers' class. Overall, the communication skills are satisfactory, but could be much better. Most teachers keep up-to-date with their grading while others wait until the very last minute to grade a test or quiz. Because of this, there is a lack of communication between students and teachers and cause stress within the classroom.", 'This school is healthy and safe and has adequate measures for students who feel unsafe in any way.', 'Clubs are comprehensive and active. Commitment is not required, but heavily encouraged, and participation is moderate to high.', 'This school provides top quality services to people of all backgrounds, which most public schools cannot comprehensively accomplish. This is the only campus that is academically and economically sensible in the county.', 'The teachers really teach what they know, which is a lot more than I know. Many teachers have a vested interest in students, good communication skills, and consistent grading practices.', 'Since people come from different towns within the county, you end up with a diverse group of people in your class. The school itself, including faculty and students, creates a friendly environment that welcomes each and every new students. I had a wonderful time attending this school and I would recommend it to anyone.', "To someone who never was challenged by middle school and thus never applied myself and developed good habits, coming to AIT was a rude awakening. Not even my freshmen year as much as my sophomore and definitely junior year. It's not extremely difficult; the hard part is being disciplined enough to study, do homework, be attentive in class, seek extra help for things you don't grasp. The classes though are much harder than regular high school classes. My favorite experience at this school was relay for life, where you could stay overnight in a room with your friends and hang out all night. If I could, I'd do it all again; this school I think will really help me acclimate to college academics, and made me a better person.", 'The Academy for Information Technology is an amazing 4-year high school where students learn skills beyond the normal classroom.\r Socially, this school brings people of different towns, friend groups, ethnic backgrounds, and general cultures together. As a student, you learn a lot about different people and everyone in your county. Everyone at this school is extremely accepting whether you are Caucasian, Hispanic, African, Gay, Straight, Trans, Rich, Poor, etc. Nobody really cares and it gives you the freedom to be yourself without feeling judged or bullied. Bullying is literally non-existent which makes the experience of high school just that much easier to digest.\r Scholastically, this school exceeds all expectations and "high school norms". I need not to mention education because facts are much more persuasive than a students review and niche.com has the facts. One thing I must say is that this schools teachers are much more dedicated to the students than in a normal classroom, this makes classes more challenging but also more beneficial and rewarding.', 'This school  has taught me to push myself', 'I had a great time attending this school. I met a lot of great people.', 'The school is amazing and state of the art. The environment is very cut-throat and competitive, but AIT gets students to where they want to go. I enjoy the people and the extra-curriculars. I have built amazing relationships and memories over the past 3 years.', 'The teachers (for the most part) are dedicated to their students and will help each and every kid achieve their goals.', 'The school is barely a decade old. Everything is state of the art. My favorite part about AIT is the ability to be in the bathroom alone due to the amount of students that attend the school.', "The Health & Safety at AIT couldn't be better. There are police guards at every building. The school tracks your location through an ID swipe system. The students are very rarely involved with alcohol and drugs. Bullying is rare at the school. Of course, conflict arises, but that is inevitable.", "The principal is truly dedicated to her job. She has increased AIT's ratings and prestige over the past year. The guidance counselors are determined to help you achieve your goals. The teachers (for the most part) are dedicated and passionate about their students. Despite their salaries, the teachers work like they are employed at a private school.", 'The extracurriculars at AIT are superb. Since you are at a smaller school, each student is able to take full advantage of the clubs and organizations. Personally, I hold numerous leadership positions. The best clubs are definitely Future Business Leaders of America (FBLA), Relay for Life (RFL), and Student Government.', "I'm definitely happy that I came because I know I'm at a top high school, but sometimes I regret leaving my district. It's annoying that all of my other friends go to my home school and I can't see them all the time like before, but at the same time, have that distance has made us all closer. I sometimes wish that I had made more of an effort to be involved my freshman year because it definitely allows you to meet new people and be a part of something cool. I get a lot of schoolwork and we take a lot of tests, but I guess I'm generally happy.", 'Through my experience, I have seen the most amazing teachers, but also one or two not so great. Most are available for extra help if you need it, but lots are busy with running clubs.']
column8: ["Personally, I would say the extracurriculars aren't that great. I know that this is an education-based school, but I really think it would be a great decision to somehow incorporate sports. With sports in the picture, students will be much more active as school, both academically and socially. As for clubs and organizations, I think the school has some really cool things! I would have never learned about Relay for Life if I hadn't attended AIT. I also like FBLA since it incorporates one of the studies at AIT. The students are also very dedicated to their clubs.", "Overall, the experience that I've had at AIT has been amazing. I have learned so much, academically and emotionally. I was pushed to become a better student and a better student. Some of my favorite experiences were participating in Relay for Life, attending Project Hope and meeting new people. There are many things that make this school unique. For starters, the school is very diverse. There are students from all over Union County that have many different backgrounds. Another unique quality of my school is the ability to get certified in many different computer applications, such as Microsoft, Oracle Sequence and CompTIA. If I could do it all over again, I would most likely choose to attend AIT. Although I may have missed out on certain sporting events or typical high school experiences, I am now able to see the world from a different perspective. I have so many different views on different cultures and opinions. I have also received a spectacular education.", "Overall, the quality of the teachers in my high school is good. Some of the teachers are better than others, but most of them are great. Certain teachers have the perfect teaching style that keep the students engaged and also effectively get the message across. I would say the teachers are rather intelligent. Not all of the teachers have the same amount of knowledge that other teachers have, which is a disadvantage to those particular students in that particular teachers' class. Overall, the communication skills are satisfactory, but could be much better. Most teachers keep up-to-date with their grading while others wait until the very last minute to grade a test or quiz. Because of this, there is a lack of communication between students and teachers and cause stress within the classroom.", 'This school is healthy and safe and has adequate measures for students who feel unsafe in any way.', 'Clubs are comprehensive and active. Commitment is not required, but heavily encouraged, and participation is moderate to high.', 'This school provides top quality services to people of all backgrounds, which most public schools cannot comprehensively accomplish. This is the only campus that is academically and economically sensible in the county.', 'The teachers really teach what they know, which is a lot more than I know. Many teachers have a vested interest in students, good communication skills, and consistent grading practices.', 'Since people come from different towns within the county, you end up with a diverse group of people in your class. The school itself, including faculty and students, creates a friendly environment that welcomes each and every new students. I had a wonderful time attending this school and I would recommend it to anyone.', "To someone who never was challenged by middle school and thus never applied myself and developed good habits, coming to AIT was a rude awakening. Not even my freshmen year as much as my sophomore and definitely junior year. It's not extremely difficult; the hard part is being disciplined enough to study, do homework, be attentive in class, seek extra help for things you don't grasp. The classes though are much harder than regular high school classes. My favorite experience at this school was relay for life, where you could stay overnight in a room with your friends and hang out all night. If I could, I'd do it all again; this school I think will really help me acclimate to college academics, and made me a better person.", 'The Academy for Information Technology is an amazing 4-year high school where students learn skills beyond the normal classroom.\r Socially, this school brings people of different towns, friend groups, ethnic backgrounds, and general cultures together. As a student, you learn a lot about different people and everyone in your county. Everyone at this school is extremely accepting whether you are Caucasian, Hispanic, African, Gay, Straight, Trans, Rich, Poor, etc. Nobody really cares and it gives you the freedom to be yourself without feeling judged or bullied. Bullying is literally non-existent which makes the experience of high school just that much easier to digest.\r Scholastically, this school exceeds all expectations and "high school norms". I need not to mention education because facts are much more persuasive than a students review and niche.com has the facts. One thing I must say is that this schools teachers are much more dedicated to the students than in a normal classroom, this makes classes more challenging but also more beneficial and rewarding.', 'This school  has taught me to push myself', 'I had a great time attending this school. I met a lot of great people.', 'The school is amazing and state of the art. The environment is very cut-throat and competitive, but AIT gets students to where they want to go. I enjoy the people and the extra-curriculars. I have built amazing relationships and memories over the past 3 years.', 'The teachers (for the most part) are dedicated to their students and will help each and every kid achieve their goals.', 'The school is barely a decade old. Everything is state of the art. My favorite part about AIT is the ability to be in the bathroom alone due to the amount of students that attend the school.', "The Health & Safety at AIT couldn't be better. There are police guards at every building. The school tracks your location through an ID swipe system. The students are very rarely involved with alcohol and drugs. Bullying is rare at the school. Of course, conflict arises, but that is inevitable.", "The principal is truly dedicated to her job. She has increased AIT's ratings and prestige over the past year. The guidance counselors are determined to help you achieve your goals. The teachers (for the most part) are dedicated and passionate about their students. Despite their salaries, the teachers work like they are employed at a private school.", 'The extracurriculars at AIT are superb. Since you are at a smaller school, each student is able to take full advantage of the clubs and organizations. Personally, I hold numerous leadership positions. The best clubs are definitely Future Business Leaders of America (FBLA), Relay for Life (RFL), and Student Government.', "I'm definitely happy that I came because I know I'm at a top high school, but sometimes I regret leaving my district. It's annoying that all of my other friends go to my home school and I can't see them all the time like before, but at the same time, have that distance has made us all closer. I sometimes wish that I had made more of an effort to be involved my freshman year because it definitely allows you to meet new people and be a part of something cool. I get a lot of schoolwork and we take a lot of tests, but I guess I'm generally happy.", 'Through my experience, I have seen the most amazing teachers, but also one or two not so great. Most are available for extra help if you need it, but lots are busy with running clubs.']

column1: High School Math Science & Engineering at The City College of New York (CCNY)
column2: ['Great academics, sports and teachers. Lots of diversity. This school really prepared me for college.', 'I am currently a senior at this school. It is really easy to get to know the teachers in this school. All the teachers are overqualified to be at this school, as they were in the field that they are teaching.', 'The whole time I went here it was great. They really prepare you for college and the transition. The courses and class work resemble a lot of college assignments and papers. They expect a lot because they know you are capable of it, so do not give up.', "I'm a senior and my past 3 years here have had a lot of up and downs. The teachers for the most part are good at their job, but some are a lot less sensitive and understanding than others. There are several great students here, although again some don't keep their academic integrity. My group of friends is amazing, and I hope to be lifelong friends with them.", 'HSMSE is a great environment for students to grow their curiosity. Student s who find themselves overwhelmed or happen to be falling behind are always welcome to reach out to their teachers that will do anything they can to help them catch up.', 'This is a very competitive environment. Students usually have a strong background and most of the time your counselor will tell you to "work harder" based on that. Nevertheless, a very good college for people looking to major in CS, Engineering, and Math-related majors.', 'CCNY as a school is open to everyone and gives students easy access to the teachers. Allowing for students like me to to ask questions about my course. The are a great number of students on campus at all times, so I am able to see where my future in the college may be. Finally it is very flexible with both time and money so students from a low-income household has little to worry about, but is still a good idea to want change.', 'Although it was tough keeping up with the material, learning psychology at the City College of New York was interesting. I was able to challenge myself and take apart in a subject that intrigues me. There were a number of resources to reach out to so that I can understand the subject more clearly.', "HSMSE is a challenging high school with lots of support and guidance. It's a small school so teachers truly get to know the students. A lot of learning goes on inside the school, teachers and staff are on top of things, and it's a welcoming environment.", 'The school is a top academic school, which is expected as a specialized high school. It is extremely diverse, which plays into many events it holds celebrating different cultures. It has a solid German program which is hard to find elsewhere in the city. One problem with it is its size. The school has a lovely of intimacy sue to everyone knowing each other, but it fields few sports teams and clubs compared to other schools. As a result, one may not be able to pursue a sport or hobby that they want there.', "Being a senior I have gone through many phases at this school and realized it is what you make of it. Definitely not for everybody but if you try hard enough you will not only succeed, but gain lots of insight on how to be successful outside of school. Time management, positive thinking and clear communication with your peers and teachers will optimize your time here. We have amazing resources and opportunities given to us all the time, education is best of the best and everyone can find a friend. Students are usually very open and accepting, a tad childish but I could see it being a lot worse at other schools. By the end of freshman year, you're bound to have found some very beneficial connections and systems for group work.", 'It is a very good school academically but leaves a little to be desired with sports and clubs with almost everything being very stem oriented.', 'I think that this is a great environment for high schoolers that encourages and pushes students to learn.  It also has amazing teachers that truly love what they do and care about the students.  The small community allows for strong bonds to be formed between all students and teachers.  The diversity in this school is also amazing and present at HSMSE.  The students work hard and care about school as well as their life outside of school.  The school is located on the CCNY campus and shares its gym, allowing students to work out in a much larger gym than they would otherwise in a different school.  There are many sports and extracurriculars that are available for students which gives them a chance to make friends and give them an activity to do outside of school.  The coaches at HSMSE are committed to their team and help students develop skills to play.', 'I am part of the Mount Sinai track from HSMSE. It offers a very unique opportunity for students who have an interest in science and it is one of the three tracks offered at MSE.', "HSMSE made me well prepared for college with a lot of college credit courses and AP classes available for me to take. Furthermore, it's a relatively small school which made it easier to talk to people. Overall, it was helpful in providing a framework as to what college work would be. Also, the school has a wide array of classes offered and the track decision time was nice in separating students into what field they wished to pursue.", 'The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing The school is amazing', 'This school has such a tight knit community that it makeshift it much easier for every student to be accountable and successful. Connecting us with the college and their resources gives us so many advantages and allows us to experience things that our peers don’t get to experience until they go to college. Our teachers and admin care about each of us individually. I couldn’t have picked a better high school to go to.', 'Was a great and challenging school but was a weird experience. Great campus but some teachers just seemed to be focused more on the class average then the individual.', "I like that it was a small school and you were able to meet everyone and make bonds with everyone and it was more community based. But being in a small school meant you didn't have many resources, facilities and sports weren't really a big thing or represented enough.", 'I enjoy the school. I tend to gravitate towards the quieter areas. Such as the library and the gym. I like that the school provides students with plenty of academic support and encourage there students to participate in activities.']

column6: ['CCNY has very strong teachers and a sensible selection of food. Presently, CCNY is an immensely diverse school. Studying is a necessity at this college to keep up with all the work because a lot of the grade is based on tests. Homework is also important, but not as much studying for tests and understanding the material. If you time, CCNY clubs  can be an enjoyable social activity.', 'studied in the college next to the high school, everyone praised the high school there, I witnessed it too, i was very happy and satisfied with the high school there and the college too.', 'Small school with a tight-knit community.  All the students in the school practically know each other by name and the staff know almost all the students personally. The students in this school are literally some of the brightest and most hard working in the city. Because, the high school is located on a college campus, students have the advantage of using many college resources at a high school level. Since it is a small school, there is only a limited number of clubs and sports.', 'I am an architecture student and i love the school becuase the proffesors are very knowlegeble and motivate students to give the best of themself.', "After spending almost 4 years as a student in this school, I believe it was the best choice I've ever made. I originally applied to HSMSE because they had an anime club. But after I came to the school, and left the anime club only to pop in every now and then, I found so much more. The teachers are all certified in their concentrations, real engineers walk the hallways, and college professors lecture about Hemingway in front of my desk. Since it's a small school, I'm familiar with almost every person in the school, often forgetting who is in what grade. Being on a college campus also has its perks. We have access to the college libraries for reports, lab facilities, and a quad to enjoy lunch with friends. The guidance counselors know us by name and can recommend various colleges based on our interests and career aspirations. I mean, we aren't rated third best in New York City for nothing!", 'I liked my experience as well as being ready for college with all of the preparations given in school. The teachers and staff were very helpful during this process.', 'Awesome teachers who really care about you. Very rigorous classes. I really liked how the teachers pushed you and offered help and really wanted you to suceecd.', "HSMSE is a great school. Overall the teachers are enthusiastic and very knowledgable and the track system allows for students to pursue individual areas they enjoy. It's difficult but manageable.", "I think the classes really did prepare me for college and the resources that the school has were very useful, they have such a wide variety that it's hard to take advantage of all of them. The teachers could be better, some of them couldn't take control of their class, making it difficult for the rest of the class to learn anything, and the others did not care if the students did not, but if you put effort into learning and into your work, you will be prepared to graduate, maybe even with honors.", 'The school does a great job getting everybody ready for what ever college they are looking forward to. They also are aware of the stress that comes with going to this school so they have give student more than enough ways to destress in and outside of school', 'I went to this school my sophomore year, it was fine. meet some great teachers and friends. they really make you feel comfortable and provide a safe type of environment.', "I loved my time at this high school. The community is so nice and welcoming. It's true that it is a small school, but this just means that there is more individual attention for each and every student. The teachers are attentive and care for each one of the students. Overall, the environment is just great.", 'It is very nice institution. What makes it nice is the price for the quality its given. Though, there could be more funds to renovate the facility.', "HSMSE is a highly competitive school, preparing students well for college. The school offers many advanced and AP courses, along with a selection of unique classes for engineering that aren't offered at any other city school. The Mt Sinai Hospital track offered to juniors and seniors is one of the school's best things it has to offer. The small community makes good student-teacher relationships, which is very important in the college process. Additionally, HSMSE is on CCNY's college campus- this ensures safety for all students and also gives access the the college's gym and cafeteria facilities. As a senior, I've grown to love the school and its staff. The engineering classes I've taken have greatly impacted my choice of majors and career interests, and the guidance counselor does an amazing job at helping me find the right school for me.", 'The teachers in this school are very helpful. Everyone cares for you and treats you like family. I would refer this school to someone else', 'It is a small school that promotes individuality. Teachers are all very skilled and friendly to students.', 'Going to the HS for Math Science and Engineering at CCNY has been an interesting experience to say the least.  Being a specialized high school, the majority of students that go there are very intelligent, competitive, yet friendly and polite.  Though small, HSMSE brags Division A sports teams, a strong academic student body, and even room for arts in some cases.  Though it has had its issues with cheating as many high schools do, the administration works very hard to maintain the integrity and honor of the school.  HSMSE offers an excellent high school education and experience.', 'This school has amazing diversity in its student body.  The teachers are very kind and understanding.  Though sometimes the work load can get pretty hard to handle, the faculty is always there to help with homework questions or after school for tutoring.  Overall, the school is academically rigorous, competitive, and has a very sociable environment.  The school is small so it is not hard to get to know everyone in your grade. The teams at the school are also another part that makes this school so great, it feels like a second family.', 'This school was the best of my educational experiences. Most schools feature teachers who have learned or earned a degree in a classroom setting. The engineering teachers have practiced within their field, which was very important for me when I was applying. It is vital to learn from people who have done what they are teaching and can lay out a real path and be role models of their particular field. The guidance department is spectacular as well and always goes above and beyond. Hands down, the best specialized high school in NYC.', 'The diversity, academics, and sports are awesome. We just need more clubs and different type of sports. Our academics are college level courses and we get very prepared for college.']

HSMSE offers an excellent high school education and experience.', 'This school has amazing diversity in its student body.  The teachers are very kind and understanding.  Though sometimes the work load can get pretty hard to handle, the faculty is always there to help with homework questions or after school for tutoring.  Overall, the school is academically rigorous, competitive, and has a very sociable environment.  The school is small so it is not hard to get to know everyone in your grade. The teams at the school are also another part that makes this school so great, it feels like a second family.', 'This school was the best of my educational experiences. Most schools feature teachers who have learned or earned a degree in a classroom setting. The engineering teachers have practiced within their field, which was very important for me when I was applying. It is vital to learn from people who have done what they are teaching and can lay out a real path and be role models of their particular field. The guidance department is spectacular as well and always goes above and beyond. Hands down, the best specialized high school in NYC.', 'The diversity, academics, and sports are awesome. We just need more clubs and different type of sports. Our academics are college level courses and we get very prepared for college.']

column1: Dr. Ronald E. McNair Academic High School
column2: ['Dr.Ronald E. Mcnair Academic High School is a very beneficial institution for students who want to be prepared for college and the experiences ahead of them. The academics in Mcnair are very helpful due to the wide range of AP courses offered that can result in the qualification for college credit. Overall, Mcnair Academic High School offers a rigorous course load, but helps students in preparing for the future.', 'We are very diverse school as we are in Jersey City. The bathrooms need to be fixed as well as the locker rooms. As a senior, I have joined clubs and have seen many form. There is a club for everything. We may not be the best at sports, but we try our hardest.', 'It’s definitely what you make of it, but for me personally I’ve had a pretty good experience with all things considered. I am currently in my senior year, and there are quite a few positive changes happening so I very much look forward to this year. Even tho I only put three stars, three and a half would be more accurate (every bit counts).', 'You can tell that the faculty are actively trying to make a connection with students and a difference in the entire school. The students, albeit stubborn and a bit rebellious, can still engage in friendly interactions through clubs, sports, and events.', 'As a current student, I believe that McNair offers a lot of academic classes that provide students with what they need in order to be ready for college. The teachers are really nice and the diversity just brings the school together as a whole.', 'Mcnair Academic was a great school to go to because it helped prepare the students including myself for college and prepped us for the next step in our lifes.', 'Teachers care about our education 100% and do the most they can to ensure that we receive the highest level of education possible. However the District and higher powers when it comes to our school district do not care about the students at all and only care about money.', 'McNair High School is a mosaic of cultural diversity unmatched to any other institution where students embrace different ethnicities through clubs that bring awareness to minority groups. McNair was named the #1 high school in New Jersey and it truly lives up to its name. The curriculum is rigorous -- offering almost every AP course -- and prepares students well for college. This year, students were accepted to Yale, Princeton, Cornell, Columbia and MIT. The teachers at McNair are what make the experience. They are the most caring individuals who work incredibly hard to make sure all students are taught to the highest of standards. Teachers stay after school until 8pm (all without pay too) to help students with their research projects in preparation for the annual county science fair. They truly love their job and students. Despite our accomplishments, we are a poorly funded school in dire need of better facilities.', 'Dr. Ronald E. McNair Academic High School is one that is not for everyone. There are many opportunities but also many challenges. To get the most out of your time at the school, you really have to be dedicated and resilient. In this school, you really discover who you are: the people, academics and culture of the school help you understand your abilities, limits and shape your personality. There are many sleepless nights doing work, many stressful days full of exams and quizzes and many moments where it seems there is never enough time to do anything. However, I feel prepared to graduate high school and I do not regret enrolling in the school once I received my acceptance letter.', "Oh my god, it's a literal prison in there. The classrooms and hallways are so bland compared to my old school (MS#4). I would never recommend such a school to anyone EVER!", "McNair Academic High School has the reputation as an academically advanced school, where students are put into pressured filled learning environments.  In all honesty, that barely covers the ice berg of what this school truly is. McNair Academic is a school where you truly learn about the value of time, effort, stress, and emotional health. While this school truly tests your ability to handle the academic rigor it puts you through, you learn to realize you won't be able to achieve every little thing. Of course, it doesn't sound very fulfilling and almost not worth it, but it truly helps you learn to not give up. It's not a perfect system, nor am I a perfect student, but I truly think my experience in McNair Academic is a beneficial one that has taught me a lot about who I am and what I can and am capable of doing.", 'Enjoyable school but in order to be successful one should be determined to pass each class by putting in vigorous hours to study.', 'The academics at this school are excellent, and truly prepare you for the rigorous work that will come in college. The worst part about this school is the horrible funding from the district, resulting in minimal books, materials, class trips, and struggling sports.', "McNair Academic High School is an excellent place for smart students that come from a low-income family. This is because McNair Academic High School is a free public high school made for those that are smart. It has a 100% college acceptance rate so anybody there would get accepted to at least some college. The only setback is that the school doesn't receive a lot of funding which has cut short on sports, clubs, etc. Still, teachers in McNair are really good at using the best of what they have. Students going to McNair would still get the education that they deserve.", 'Mcnair Academic High School prides itself on the academics and morals of its students. It is hard work but well worth it. This school gives you an experience like no other and prepares you well for college.', 'The school is honestly very nice, but I would appreciate if it were a little less stressful and a bit more ~fun~.', 'The workload can be a bit stressful at time but overall the school has a great atmosphere in terms of students and diversity. Also, the school ensures preparedness for college which is a massive plus for a student attending high school. In accompany to academics, the school has clubs and other extracurriculars that can keep a student involved.', 'Dr. Ronald E. McNair Academic High School is a Magnet public high school located in Jersey City, in Hudson County, New Jersey, United States. The school is named in memory of Dr. Ronald E. McNair, the astronaut and scientist who died in the Space Shuttle Challenger disaster. It is an extremely diverse community that offers rigorous classes that prepare students for higher education.', "Overall, I love McNair. I met so many like-minded friends, had some really amazing and dedicated teachers, and received quality education. I also love the appreciation of all the different cultures this student body has to offer. However, the work-load can get very heavy at times and a lot of students struggle with this, so aspiring McNair-heads should anticipate that. However, the vigorous academic lifestyle does really pay off in the long run. Also, for being the #1 ranked school in New Jersey, the actual facility does not reflect that. Teachers are often struggling with SmartBoards and the bathrooms are not up-to-par (although this year I've noticed an improvement). Despite all the cons, I'm proud to be a student here and will fondly look back on these years.", 'Very academically challenging, but a good environment to be surrounded by motivated students. Puts you on a good path towards college. Facilities could be improved/very low budget.']
