column6: ["The environment that the school fosters is one of thoughtfulness in education. Students are encouraged to learn not just for grades but for knowledge. The teachers are open and mostly passionate about their work. Some teachers are more difficult to learn from than others. The school prepares you well for college, ensuring you meet any requirements your future colleges may ask for. Many AP courses are offered. There are many clubs and activities to get involved in. If you can't find a club you're interested in, you could start your own. The community is small and tight-knit. The diverse environment provides a truly unique high school experience that you can't find anywhere else. Everyone is proud of their heritage and students are encouraged to embrace their backgrounds and educate others regarding it.", "McNair does hold up to its reputation as being the #1 school in the state of New Jersey. There is Most of the courses offered at McNair are honors courses and there are numerous AP's to select from. There is a plethora of clubs and activities to participate in after school as well as before school. Located in one of the most diverse cities in the country, McNair itself is also a diverse school. All of the teachers and staff look out for you with your best interests in mind. You may even spend more time with them than you do with your parents. If there is anything that needs to be changed, then it is the fact that McNair does not receive a lot of funding. Most of the facilities are old and they can become a safety issue. Many athletic teams also do not have the money for uniforms. Nevertheless, the community at McNair is very welcoming and there are numerous events that promote school spirit.", 'This school really prepares you for college with the numerous amount of APs it offers. The sports teams are exceptional and are open to all regardless of experience, which is something I like. It is also very diverse, with multiple cultural clubs and celebrations/assemblies. Overall, it is a really good school and is number 1 in the state of New Jersey.', 'It was an good experience, but due to the lack of funding it did not reach its full potential. However I did enjoy my time in the school thus far.', "I love the diversity and unique culture you can find here at McNair! It's hard to find that type of experience elsewhere. However, we are severely underfunded. The bathroom facilities never work, the door handles break off and there are multiple classrooms where the paint job is unfinished or even peeling off but the district does nothing to help.", "I love the diversity at Dr. Ronald E. McNair Academic. It truly creates a melting pot of cultures in the middle of downtown Jersey City, directly across the Hudson River from New York. Attending this school is a great privilege. Being the number one school is the state is an advantage because we numerous academic resources. For instance, over 25 AP classes are offered. This allows students to challenge themselves. With that being said, since it is a public school, funding is not great. The athletics aren't too strong, but in the academic perspective, the school is magnificent. One thing I would change would be the college readiness. Despite being academically prepared (as alumni confirmed), the process isn't so clear until we are already seniors. This gives us less time to process information and pace ourselves. Information should be given before senior year, with more guidance counselors so students have the opportunity to maintain a relationship and receive proper help.", "McNair has been an amazing experience for me for the past 4 years - no other school is as diverse. It truly is representative of the Jersey City demographic, ethnically, religiously, racially, and economically. One of the highest ranks highschools in America, McNair offers many AP courses and honor courses. I love the people here and the teachers are not only incredibly smart, but easily accessible and friendly. We have a variety of clubs, many incepted by the students ourselves. There is always something going on after school, everyday, and it is very easy to find a club of your interest. Our school pride is outmatched, from our status academically to our track team's national recognition. The student body is incredibly, almost unbelievably friendly. Bullying is hardly ever heard of. Overall, I have grown attending McNair, and my mind has been opened in ways I could not fathom before.", 'Diverse student population. Caring and supportive faculty. Academically challenging with many AP courses offered.', "McNair is a great school in terms of academics, and it serves as a relatively safe and diverse environment in which we can interact with other students. For this reason, I believe that the school and it's faculty are for putting in their all towards making sure that we students succeed and that we are happy deserve more than the public school district has been offering. We make the best use of the resources already allocated to us, however, other schools within our district tend to get a bigger budget whereas our school has to deal with contaminated water fountains, subpar restrooms, a variety of other plumbing issues, lack of ventilation and air conditioners when nearing the summer, outdated textbooks, and etc.", 'McNair has an extremely rigorous curriculum which prepares students for the future colleges of their choice.  I myself believe that McNair is a pretty great High School with great diversity and courses offered. The work environment can be considered very stressful, but with the right mindset, can be easy to get through. Most of the teachers are pretty great, but some of them lack in the ability to discipline students or to control them. There is a large variety of clubs and sports that one can easily make their niche with, however the new administration is very unfair and unsupportive compared to the old one and is  hard to work with when you are managing a club. But for the most part McNair itself is an amazing school which allows you to grow to your full academic potential.', 'Great school, one of the best in the nation. Great for students trying to get a leg up on college and has so many AP course opportunities.', 'I love that McNair is very diverse. This highschool will push you to your limits academic wise which is very appealing to students who like to be challenged. I have a lot of cougar pride even if we are not the best in sports.', 'Overall I loved the diversity and culture I got to experience when I attended here, and there are some teachers that I\'ve had that literally change my life forever but I took one point off because of how strict the dress code was. Short skirts and crop tops are valid for the business casual dress code but exposed shoulders would be considered "inappropriate," I think they need to update with the times and be more lenient with certain things.', 'McNair is its own community. The students that go to McNair develop a sense of pride. Almost every student is concerned about their future and spends an immense amount of time worrying about the assignments they have. Every person is your competition. While this outlook may cause the individual to worry about their place in the school, it motivates the student to work harder. In McNair students reward each other for being successful. Its extremely diverse community allows students to learn cultures outside of their own. McNair is unique - it has helped me develop a strong work ethic and has made me comfortable in situations that are outside of my comfort zone.', 'The facilities need improvement and some doors cannot be opened with a key. The courses here are difficult and will help prepare students for college. Many members of the staff are new here and the rules of these school are changing ( for the worse for both teachers and students). Free AP courses are offered here along with free in-school SAT days (where students get a FREE SAT day during the school hours and can leave early that day).', 'Dr. Ronald E. McNair Academic High School was my home for the last four years of my life. From my studies to my extra-curricular activities, the culture of McNair has always encouraged me to strive to the best of my abilities. It is an extremely well-rounded environment that focuses on not only academics but also the growth of its students. It was here where I found my voice as a person and grew up into a young and confident leader. It was here where I found  opportunities to succeed in life. It was here where I was given the chance to demonstrate my knowledge in a welcoming setting. I will always appreciate everything that this school has done for me.', "It's a pleasure to attend such a diverse and academically rigorous environment, I'm glad to have ended up here out of all the schools in Jersey City!", 'McNair is a very diverse school where cultures blend for an education worth working for. It prepares students for the future and works on every students success.', "McNair is an excellent high school for college prep and really pushes you to do your best and succeed! While you may have a few late nights, the outcome of hard work and perseverance is truly evident by students' grades,  college acceptances, and involvement. The culture is also great.", "I love McNair. You make great friends and everyone here is really nice. The teachers are helpful and really prepare you for college. Our sports aren't the most talented, but are always fun to watch and participate in. Overall a great school and I would definitely recommend going here."]
column8: ['MAHS is an Academic High School that provides the best high school education in one of the most diverse and heartwarming environments. As a Senior of MAHS, I can say that it certainly is not easy to succeed in this school, but it is the people around you that help you succeed. The school is a community where teachers and students can casually talk to each other, and where the staff is very much involved with the student campus life. However, despite such a wonderful place, there are problems that pertain to the maintenance of the building as it is old, and also the computers and some other tech seem to be outdated. I hope to see more money poured into this school as it holds some rough diamonds.', 'No matter how difficult the work may get, McNair teachers are always willing to cooperate with you and give you every chance you may need to succeed. The diversity in McNair is overall the most amazing part of it. Meeting new people from different ethnic backgrounds cannot just start in college, and McNair makes sure of that.', 'I like the challenging aspects and environment of McNair. The classes can be difficult as they are all honors or advanced placement, but from the beginning McNair teaches students work ethic that is necessary for higher education. The environment is very diverse and welcoming. Because everyone wants to succeed and have good grades, there is no fear to be smart.', "Personally, McNair is too hyped about. It is a good school, and it's certainly the best in academics in the area. But in comparison to the best schools in the country or even the state, McNair falls short on most things, not including academics. The resources it can provide me are very limited. It's infrastructure sucks, the library, computer labs, and classrooms are old and not updated. It's sports teams are nothing special and while the students and coaches try, it's not as good as those from the surrounding schools. The teachers are pretty good, but many of them are very monotone in their forms of teaching and are too strict on matters like extensions or missing class for other school events.", 'There were a lot of courses offered, although not always taught well. There was good amount of diverse clubs and activities, but it was difficult to run events.', 'Better elective  and more teachers that care about the work they give us. Otherwise, the school is great for college readiness and really paves a great path for all students that attend.', 'Dr. Ronald E. McNair Academic High School is not just the second best high school in New Jersey--it is a place that nurtures academic excellence as well as well rounded individuals. Jersey City is among one of the most diverse cities in the country, and attending a school in this area has been an education within itself. They teach us skills that you could never learn in school and they encourage us to embrace our differences and join as one.  We also have unique school celebrations such as multicultural day, black history month celebrations, and asian american and pacific islander assembles. This instills their students with the importance of acceptance and open mindedness, unparalleled to what other experiences can give. The only thing that needs to be improved on is funding. Jersey City schools typically do not receive a lot of funding for technology and sports equipment. Overall, McNair allows us to get an education both in school and after school ends.', 'I loved the opportunities that McNair provided for me as a high school student there. The teachers and other staff members pushed me to the best of my abilities. The rigorous course material definitely challenged me and prepared me well for college. McNair can improve by making sure that the teachers and staff they hire are well equipped to provide a positive educational experience to all the students.', 'It has been a tough 4 years in McNair Academic, but I believe that McNair is truly one of the most outstanding schools in Hudson County, if not, the state of New Jersey. Compared the other schools in Hudson County, McNair has the most available AP classes, and most of the secular subjects are honors courses, so you\'re practically in college already! McNair is not just exceptional in the realm of academics, but there is a sense of community that you cannot find at any other school. And as a member of the LGBTQ community, the acceptance and love I received from my peers made high school worthwhile. However, the facilities available to the students are not entirely up to date, and not varied either. It\'s what you would expect out of any ordinary high school, but I feel as if there could be so much more for the "smartest kids in Jersey City". McNair also concentrates too much on academics and college, there should be an increase in focus in the arts, and also, school spirit.', 'This school definitely prepared you for college step by step,guidance counselors and teachers constantly work with you and check up on you to make sure you are fully prepared and are up to date with your assignments and applications for college. The majority of the staff are very approachable when it comes to not only school work but just advice in general. The diversity in this school is what brings the culture aspect to it,the main  things we were lacking were certain facilities like a larger gym because the majority of the money we received were used for testing which is understandable.', "High academic rigor that can at first seem intimidating. However, it quickly becomes apparent that both the student body and the faculty are there for your assistance. High variety in classes and teachers seem to know what they're doing. The overwhelming majority of the bad aspects of the school (lunch, required classes, dress code) are because of the district requiring them. The school itself and the factors it controls are above satisfactory.", 'In terms of student success and college readiness, McNair greatly exceeds the other high schools within the Jersey City Public Schools district.', 'I am a rising junior in college, and I have yet to be challenged in college as I was in high school. I cannot put into words of how grateful I am for my experiences at McNair. It was indubitably the best 4 years of high school a student could have asked for. After leaving high school, I felt ready for what life was going to offer. After 2 years, I can say I was pretty right.', 'McNair is one of the most schools in New Jersey with an almost 100% graduation rate. It prepares us for life in the real world and lessens the amnt of time we have to spend in college by forcing us to take at least one AP before we graduate. While the academics are very challenging, the teachers make learning fun! Also, we have enough extracurricular activities to keep us busy after the school day is over. Our school is also one of the most diverse schools.', 'The school focuses heavily on academics and provides 20+ AP courses for students to enroll it. All the AP tests are funded by the school, so students from disadvantaged financial backgrounds can pursue their academic career like everyone else. The school has a very diverse community but there are not as many big clubs as other typical high schools.', "This school is extremely different from other schools. It's not too big and not too small, and the people here are the most diverse group you will ever meet in all aspects. In the heart of downtown Jersey City, it is a loving school that offers an amazing education and fosters amazing relationships.", "Honestly, I received an unforgettable education here thanks to a select few teachers. The student community is extremely kind (well, most) and the events here aren't too bad. The JROTC program was phenomenal here as well (SGM Rivera, if you ever read this, thank you for everything).", 'A Very good school that prepares you academically for college and for the real-world with many responsibilities, classes, extracurriculars etc. Provide very good teachers that are very helpful and willing to stay after to help.', 'I love the safe, friendly, and welcoming environment that McNair provides. This is school prepares you for college and the real world, with the strict dress code and honors and advanced placement classes. Also, the diversity is incredible and there are numerous opportunities given to the students.', 'This school puts a lot of emphasis on academics which is why it is the #3 public school in the state of New Jersey. It is also one of the most diverse high schools in the nation with the students being very open-minded. There is no better public high school than McNair.']

column2: ['Very stressful.  They take away everything fun about school and replace it with math and science.  The classes are impossible, but you learn and alot and this school puts you on track to go to a great college.', 'Millburn High school is top notch. I am a parent who had both a special needs student and a high achieving student and both were individually catered to and encouraged and supported to succeed. I did not have the experience that they only care about the top performers. The guidance department is like no other. They are used to dealing with very anxious competitive kids and provide a supportive environment and really push kids to go to the best fit colleges. The music department was exceptional as was the debate team.', "Most of the teachers are very nice and helpful. Some will even stay with you past their work hours. Something that definitely needs a huge improvement and change is Senior Health. We do the same reflection questions every time and there's basically no point in them. Something missing is that we never really got to learn about personal finance unless we specifically chose to take that class.", "Millburn High School is a school where competitive people thrive. There is certainly a very intense academic pressure, lots of grade and club competition, especially in regard to college. Some teachers aren't great, and some are amazing, but it really is a school where attitude changes everything. If you can balance school, social life, and sleep, more power to you because this school definitely requires you to. Despite all this, I have met some of the most amazing people I know here and I know that not only have I come out of Millburn a better student, but I am more prepared for the college experience specifically because of how hard this school pushes you.", 'Do not send your children here! I repeat, DO NOT! Teachers do not care the slightest about you unless you are top of the class. Majority of the teachers are not the brightest resulting in teaching myself the impossible curriculum a numerous about of times due to my teachers not knowing it themselves. Not a single staff member in the school is there for you if you have any problems or need anything. 6+ years ago Millburn was at its peak where you probably heard "Millburn the best school in NJ" probably true then, but now, absolutely not.', 'Millburn High School has taught me how to work hard and push myself to have higher standards. I have learned how much hard work is necessary to become successful. The environment of the school and students have made me a higher academically achieving person.', 'Millburn High School was challenging, to say the least. However, in my opinion, the intense pressure and stress that it places on its students are necessary (albeit to a smaller degree) in order to prepare students for life beyond high school. Through hard work and willpower, it is possible for students to succeed here.', 'Millburn High School is unlike any other. It has an immense focus on academics, which depending on the person can be either an incredible generator of stress or very beneficial. It prepares you very well for college, and have enough clubs to fill any need, but is not great in terms of student support', 'I like that the teachers are all very smart and we have a great balance of extra-curricular activities. I think could improve the work-life balance.', "At Millburn High School, the classwork is very rigorous and the teachers have high expectations for the students. Although it is very challenging in high school, as a college student I believe that Millburn High School has sufficiently prepared me for the coursework in college. The majority of students are extremely competitive, and students must test into AP courses due to the high demand. Class sizes are small and teachers are usually happy to meet with students. The guidance department is very helpful and is always accessible to students. It is the student's responsibility to be proactive and make appointments. Lastly, I believe that Millburn High School offers a wide variety of different courses that students can take. For example, besides the basic sciences (physics, chemistry, biology), MHS offers forensic science, meteorology, genetics, astronomy, etc.", 'The rigorous curriculum at Millburn High School along with the highly qualified teaching staff prepared me for the challenges of college. The school community and all the scheduled extra curricular events provided a well rounded four year high school experience.', 'everything about it is nice. clean classrooms. many times the bathrooms and other stuff are in construction and take forever for them to get fixed. most of the teachers are nice, helpful, and willing to take their time to help you.', 'Millburn High School prepares the students very well for college or the "real world" after high school.  Although we feel prepared after the 4 years at Millburn, those 4 years are very stressful and exhausting on the students.  The work load and pressure to be at the top of your class creates a lot of pressure on the students.', 'Millburn is one of the most academically challenging public high schools in the United States. A lot of people see the students as rich, entitled, brats, but the large majority of us are unbelievably hardworking and diligent. I would say that we suffer from overwhelmingly high levels of stress and anxiety from our community and peers. Our academic environment is very competitive, but tends to prepare us for the best colleges. I have even heard stories about alumni who say that college was easier than some aspects of Millburn. As for diversity, most of the students are white, Chinese, or Indian. There are, however, less than twenty African American students in each grade. As one of the only transgender students in the school, I can say pretty confidently that there are not real problems with bullying.I don’t know much about drug usage( I’d never do that) but I think people vape.', "I like Millburn High School because I am pushed to achieve academic greatness while pursuing a sport. I am a current senior on the girl's cross country team and my teachers are flexible. They are understanding of my dedication to the sport and give me some leeway on assignments if I miss their class.", 'Overall, Millburn High School is really a terrific school. It does, in fact, have a strong reputation, and that certainly helps when it comes to college applications. I have been told by several counselors that college admissions boards know that Millburn\'s class levels ("College Prep A", "Accelerated", etc.) rank very differently in other schools (for instance, our "College Prep A" could be a different school\'s "Honors"). While I am not in the top percentile of my class, I still find every single person who works here to be a big help. From the administration all the way to the custodians, everyone is there for you. In addition, there is a club for everyone, and from the academic viewpoint, there are plenty of electives that will interest everyone.', "This school was amazing! I had such a good time here. There's a lot of diversity, so everyone can fit in. The teachers are amazing, but some of them teach better than others.", 'I attended the Millburn public school system from Kindergarten until 12th grade, and while prepared me well for college, it created long term problems in my academic confidence and formed my competitive nature. From the beginning, learning was seen as a cutthroat competition between students, and we were told that is what it would be like in the real world. While I managed to stay on the upper end of the curve and made it to an ivy league institution, my siblings are currently struggling to maintain confidence in themselves with teachers and an administration who does not value them as much as the more highly achieving students. That being said, because I got to take AP classes and had amazing teachers, my skills (particularly in the humanities) made it easy to adjust to Brown University. However, because I did not place into AP science classes, taking premed classes has been very difficult for me.', 'This was my best years in this school, I really enjoyed the journey through my 4 years learning in this school. I really loved it.', "Millburn Senior High School is an academically challenging and stressful school for many kids. There is too much emphasis placed on getting good test scores and not enough on understanding the material learned and the students' physical and mental well being."]
column4: ['Very stressful.  They take away everything fun about school and replace it with math and science.  The classes are impossible, but you learn and alot and this school puts you on track to go to a great college.', 'Millburn High school is top notch. I am a parent who had both a special needs student and a high achieving student and both were individually catered to and encouraged and supported to succeed. I did not have the experience that they only care about the top performers. The guidance department is like no other. They are used to dealing with very anxious competitive kids and provide a supportive environment and really push kids to go to the best fit colleges. The music department was exceptional as was the debate team.', "Most of the teachers are very nice and helpful. Some will even stay with you past their work hours. Something that definitely needs a huge improvement and change is Senior Health. We do the same reflection questions every time and there's basically no point in them. Something missing is that we never really got to learn about personal finance unless we specifically chose to take that class.", "Millburn High School is a school where competitive people thrive. There is certainly a very intense academic pressure, lots of grade and club competition, especially in regard to college. Some teachers aren't great, and some are amazing, but it really is a school where attitude changes everything. If you can balance school, social life, and sleep, more power to you because this school definitely requires you to. Despite all this, I have met some of the most amazing people I know here and I know that not only have I come out of Millburn a better student, but I am more prepared for the college experience specifically because of how hard this school pushes you.", 'Do not send your children here! I repeat, DO NOT! Teachers do not care the slightest about you unless you are top of the class. Majority of the teachers are not the brightest resulting in teaching myself the impossible curriculum a numerous about of times due to my teachers not knowing it themselves. Not a single staff member in the school is there for you if you have any problems or need anything. 6+ years ago Millburn was at its peak where you probably heard "Millburn the best school in NJ" probably true then, but now, absolutely not.', 'Millburn High School has taught me how to work hard and push myself to have higher standards. I have learned how much hard work is necessary to become successful. The environment of the school and students have made me a higher academically achieving person.', 'Millburn High School was challenging, to say the least. However, in my opinion, the intense pressure and stress that it places on its students are necessary (albeit to a smaller degree) in order to prepare students for life beyond high school. I really loved it.', "Millburn Senior High School is an academically challenging and stressful school for many kids. There is too much emphasis placed on getting good test scores and not enough on understanding the material learned and the students' physical and mental well being."]
column6: ['Academics are difficult and it will definitely prepare you for college. Teachers are generally nasty and like to work against you.', "I've always been grateful for the education I received at Millburn, graduating with the class of 1973. While I wasn't a great student or athlete, I've grown up feeling that I learned a lot more than kid's these days get out of high schools in other areas. College and life preparation, coupled with an excellent Industrial Arts class selection (at least when I was there). Kids who go there should consider themselves fortunate, even if they don't appreciate it at the time.", 'A lot of students resent Millburn because of the intense competition to be the best student, to go to an ivy league college and sign up for the best AP classes. Others love it for all these reasons. Personally, I have made a conscious effort to block out the pressure of my school and work on my own strengths. I have never felt supported by school when it comes to the arts though. The theater department is dominated by favoritism, the music department has no funding, and my student run a cappella group was almost disbanded by the school because we are a club instead of being affiliated with the music department. It is disheartening to see the robotics club flowing with money and two classrooms given to this club or the sports teams getting all new uniforms and equipment every few years while my a cappella group fights to use a math classroom for rehearsal and we have to fight just to use our cafeteria for concerts.', "Millburn is full of hard working individuals working together to reach their next level. Whether that may be a college they want to get to as a student or a job/promotion a teacher may want. However, the teachers are motivated to getting the student prepared for college and life. They not only care very much about the kids' academics but also their transformation as a person in life. An atmosphere like this really develops bright young adults.", 'Millburn Senior High School is a great school because of the level of education that it offers. It challenges students to do their absolute best. However, I would like to see more focus on school spirit rather than focusing on academics the entire time.', 'Millburn is a great school for any motivated student who wants to balance sports, extracurricular activities, and a social life with their academics. One downside to this school is that it often helps the top students more than it does those who are struggling in class. However, I think if a student takes advantage of the opportunities offered at MHS, they will have a positive high school experience, be happy with their college decisions, and be prepared for their future academic careers. The stress levels can be high, but anyone who manages their time well is normally free from extreme despair.', 'Overall, the school is exceptional. Most of the teachers actually care about your welling being and the level of success that you do not just achieve in school, but outside of it as well. This school really prepares for you college and gives you one of the greatest opportunities for success in the future.', "I think while the school is academically pretty tough, it's also pressure and competition amongst students that makes people dislike the school. Nonetheless, I've heard that the school prepares you really well for college and that you'll be grateful by the time you get there. I'd like to see an improvement in bathroom sanitation, however, especially considering how well-off the town is...", 'principle and guidance councilors for that matter are Lazy AF. Dr. Keenon &  Mrs. Seigel are the real bosses. Dr. Miron the principal is awkward and shirks any real responsibility or conflict', 'Great academic reputation, that comes with a cost. Student anxiety levels are through the roof and depression plague half of the student body.  We are known for our amazing faculty, but rarely do we  have actually good teachers. It has been  found that out of your core 5 classes one to two of your teachers actually understand how to teach and welcome you after school for more help if need be. Yes, we are “college ready,” but has anyone stopped to think that maybe we are to ready. When kids that go to uchicago come back and say “yeah college is super easy compared to Millburn,” perhaps that isn’t such a good thing.', "Incredible Teachers. Incredible Academics. Incredible Resources. Incredible School. By the end of your child's high school career, he or she will absolutely ready for College. I've even heard former Millburn High School students saying that College is easier than High School, since the work load is less and the stress is lower. While high school may feel like a never ending hell, it will all be worth it at the end.", 'Super competitive. Biased teachers. College obsessed. Crazy athletes. But an overall great environment, which is encouraging and expects the best out of every student. MHS is no different than the stereotypes put on it. Read Urban Dictionary for more information.', 'Millburn High School was a great experience for me. Millburn prepared me for college because they have a harder curriculum which made me more ready than others around me.', 'Millburn High School is a school that emphasizes learning and success. It pushes its students to be accepted to the best schools the nation has to offer.', 'It is a great education but very competitive. Tons of work, but it pays off when applying to college.', "This school is seriously stressful with way too much emphasis on grades and tests! how did this school got such a high ranking?? Niche, please rank it more accurately and maybe they will actually fix these problems!!!  Academics, althletics and extra-curricular are good overall BUT hours and hours of homework and way too many tests.  Also ridiculous AP qualifer process like you have to take advanced test in the AP subject to get into the class itself, what??  APs themselves have too much work, hello its not college people!! just an AP class!    Problems with cheating; well, I almost don't blame the students, it seems to be a question of survival.  Overall, this school appears to lack integrity; it needs to care less about its rankings and test scores and more about graduating well-balanced, intellectually curious, leaders of the future!!!", 'Millburn High school is definitely one of the better high schools in the nation. With top teachers who genuinely care about getting their students into the best colleges and great sports along guidance counsellors who are always available to help, MHS really prepared me for College and the world', 'Although very difficult, Millburn High School prepares its students very well for college and the real world. The faculty and administration at the Millburn High School is the very best and almost every teacher loves what he/she does and has passion for his/her subject. Alongside with the rigorous and demanding academic requirements, students have the ability to choose from over 50 extracurricular activities.', 'I am currently a junior at Millburn High School, and so far it has been a great experience. The curriculum is flexible, covering all the basic subjects while allowing students to customize their schedule according to their interests. There are so many after school clubs that it is impossible for one to not find something he is interested in. The teachers are all amazing, allowing the students to be responsible for themselves but providing help when needed. The school library is chock full of research resources; not only are there thousands of books, but the library also subscribes to many online scholarly websites and newspapers that help students with research. The school is a bully-free zone; all the students are very kind and willing to help one another.', 'Students are extremely involved in school sports and school clubs. Everybody enjoys participating in school held activities. There is no peer pressure, or at least none that is evident. Mostly everybody is accepted, the students are very open minded and accept people of all races and sexualities. Open-mindedness is definitely taught in school and students are taught to accept everybody despite of their differences.']
column8: ['Teachers are very knowledgable in their fields. Some teachers even hold P.h.Ds. The curriculum is very tough,especially for accelerated and AP classes however it is doable. Schedules are created by students with the help of their guidance counselors and it is a very easy process. The workload is a lot but with time management it is manageable and not too bad. The school does offer study skills for students who need a bit of extra help. The classes offered are varied and allow the students to explore many interests.', "I didn't realize it until becoming a senior and thinking what other schools must be like, but really Millburn is very safe. It's as safe as any reality tv school would be. There's aaalmost no bullies (i've never seen a bully that used physical violence), and drugs and alcohol only begins to become prominent (like on the charts) during senior or end of junior year.  There is very little security, only one cop parked across the street as the school gets out, and like one security guard. However just this year they started actually using the locks on their doors so i guess thats something. Security cameras all over the halls though.", 'Extracurricular are definitely an area that Millburn could improve on. Sports are common, but partly because students want to put something on their college applications. Clubs are kinda sad. Though the is an ok variety of clubs, none of them are ambitious or  exciting, as people only stay at their clubs for at max, 30 minutes once a week, then leave to do homework. Administration does nothing to really help clubs. I would definitely want people to have more club spirit/ indentity as this is something i felt millburn really lacked.', 'My experience at millburn high  has ultimately been a positive one, however if I were asked to do it again, im not sure if i would. Looking back I love the push of competition and focus that the students have. All the students are great people and nice, though in lower grades like soph-junior, maybe a little passive aggressive due to competitiveness. I also love the great teachers that have given me so much knowledge. Thank you Dr. Jooma, Mr. Raymond, Mr. Gargiulo. However I have a very strong distaste for the way the administration operates ( medium.com/@maxretik/filibustering-it-the-secret-weapon-of-the-millburn-public-school-district-205c836731c5#.7qtafqulb )\r , and the culture that comes from having 8 hours of Hw most nights. There is very little sense of school wide community or spirit as most people go directly home to relax before starting homework. Any attempts at a school rally fails miserably.', 'The teachers at Millburn are all very knowledgeable about their subjects. Almost all are engaging in their lessons and often have lead class discussions that focus on the individual. I do feel like the teachers care about students, but help given if students stay after school (which is hard sometimes for some), not if the teacher notices a student is struggling, which is honestly acceptable. The range of grading between teachers varies alot however. Some teachers grade very hard, others are more lenient, some give tests that are much easier than other teachers of the same subject, especially in the language and history department, but not limited to. Teachers do very much respect students, but clearly assign a very heavy work load.', "This school is very safe and holds our health in a high standard. There was a time when the school had a therapist available after a traumatic event. The school never permits bullying. The school nurse's office is always open in case she is needed and if you have any personal health issues than the school if very accommodating.", 'There are many things to do in this school. There is a large variety of sports teams to join as well as a huge amount of clubs. From speech & debate to art club to robotics, there is a club in this school for everyone. Some clubs require a high level of commitment while others are more relaxed.', 'The work load is hard and many teachers expect a lot from you but this will only help the students in college because they will be prepared for the work load they will receive. My school really cares for its students and only wants them to succeed and I truly appreciate that.', 'Majority of the teachers want you to succeed and will give you any additional help you seek. Of course there are a few teachers who are not that great but most of the teachers are great, intellectual, and helpful.', "Were literally all white, rich, jews. No lie, you can count all the black kids on one hand, it's ridiculous. Many Asians and Indians too.", "I dread going to each and everyone of my classes. All the classes I am genuinely interested in are too hard, and homework becomes overbearing quickly. If you want your child to slowly turn into a sleepless, depressed zombie, send them here and specifically have them try out for ten million AP classes (only can enter them through passing a test- like everything else at this school) only to have them be rejected from all of them on account of them not knowing the answers to a test they couldn't prepare for and have never learned the materials to.", 'Honestly, everyone feel safe here. Were a bunch of over- privileged know it alls who think nothing will ever happen. We drink and smoke only on the weekends and its all super safe and controlled. Health class is a joke, our security guards are a joke, and our only real form of security is when students come back from Senior Lunch, we have to ring the doorbell. Literally anyone can get in.', "Some parents refuse to give their child a break. Don't be one of these parents. The students at Millburn high school already have enough pressure (just academically) from peers and teachers. You're honestly weird if you don't try hard here. We all try hard, so it's important to keep kids happy at home.", "I've had many teachers I've loved and grew such a bond with over my four years. The majority of these bonds were not made in the classroom however. Because I went to see my teachers, and many teachers admin the clubs I lead, I grew to know my teachers as people, and not just teachers. However, I've had some HORRIBLE teachers. Tenure is given to those there the longest, not those who rightfully deserve it. I've seen teachers (mainly within the math and sciences departments) that are amazing at what they teach, and have devoted every ounce of their lives to it. HOWEVER, they somehow can't teach their subjects for their lives. Communication between students and teachers is a rarity unless sought after. And make sure you know which teacher you want your child to have before entering the school, because the gap in grading is very, very wide. One teacher within each department is known to give A's, while another gives F's. It happens every year. It's important to be challenged, but Millburn is a pressure-cooker enough already without one of these teachers.", 'Nobody I know of has ever had a major problem but any concern is dealt with pretty swiftly. People here are pretty sheltered so you might be surprised at what people consider to be unsafe or concerning.', 'Pretty much any activity you can think of is available in some capacity. Except Ultimate Frisbee which is still an unofficial club.', 'Supremely high quality education. While the environment is competitive, it produces students ready for the rigor of college courses.', 'For the most part, teachers are very qualified and are willing to help any struggling student so long as he is willing to ask for it.', 'This is an elite academic school at the national level.', 'mANY TO CHOOSE FROM.  yOU CAN START Additional clubs too']

column2: ["Very good quality of education. Teachers are very nice and helpful (for the most part). There are clubs and extracurricular activities for pretty much everyone's interests. There is a lot of Raiders pride (Go raiders!) and the teams are very good. The library is two floors (but is mostly computers...) the music department is one of the best they've ever seen, say many of the teachers. School is very diverse as well, with people from all over the country, and the world, coming here to be educated. There are many programs that help students get jobs and get ready for college. The school is run by a good administration and they run fire drills frequently to prepare the students for a fire (most likely in the chem labs). The food is okay...", "The bad news: It is so cliquy and stuck up both inside and outside the classroom it's pathetic. I was literally socially exiled from some (not all) groups because I wasn't white or I didn't love sports. The workload here makes you miserable... unless you crack under the pressure and decide to stop trying your best. And also, I've noticed that international students in particular will have a very hard time finding any friends here at all.The good news: The teachers are good (some are much better than others). There is generally no bullying from students and teachers (there are exceptions, of course). The food is decent (even if the lines are long). And the academics are amazing (especially if you're smart/tough enough to do well). The clubs/sports here are not great but not bad.Basically, it's good but it's horrible at the same time... and I bet it's not any worse than most high schools out there.", "Scarsdale has an inherent sense of competition, but it isn't a factor that crushes students. This competition motivates students to work their best, and teachers continue to reinforce this idea that you can always do better, even if it is just a little bit. The competition and stress, though harmful at times, does make you feel frequently connected to other students.", 'As a senior, I felt my expereince at SHS has prepared me and given me the maximum potential for college and life after that. I have been given the resources and education to allow myself to become a more mature and accelerated student.', "The academic environment is rigorous and certainly conducive to learning, but the lack of diversity among the student body and faculty mean that it's hard for minority students to find mentors within the school that share their experiences.", "Very good experience overall. The teachers are great and once you graduate, you are prepared no matter what college you choose to attend (not to mention, Scarsdale's reputation will take you very far in regards to the college process). However, there is a cut-throat attitude among students and a very competitive atmosphere", "Scarsdale High School is the perfect environment for a high achieving and highly motivated student. This school's could be much better and the school culture/spirit is lacking for the most part. However, Scarsdale High School still has many redeeming qualities. It is garunteed that if you graduate from this school you will be receiving one of the best high school educations available. There are enough students in this school for it to be possible for each student to find their crowd, even if they are not the steotypical Scarsdale student. There are many students who end up loving their SHS experience while others struggle to get through their four years, proving that this school is absolutely perfect for a specific kind of student. Oveall, a great school for college prep, and academic achievement.", "The quality of the academics are very high. Classes can be stressful but the new wellness initiative is addressing it. While it's not perfect, SHS provides students with one of the best academic experiences country.", 'Scarsdale High School is home to a very competitive student body. Unfortunately, the competition is framed in a way that isolates those who are on the regular or in-advanced tract and causes those students to be looked upon differently. The students are friendly and welcoming for the most part, but it is clear that there are some groups and cliques that have been formed from very early childhood. This can make it especially hard for a new incoming student to make friends and feel comfortable. All in all, it is a great school if you want your child to get a good education and have a chance at getting into a top school. My one advisory would be not to be surprised if he/she gets stressed out or overwhelmed at times.', 'Scarsdale is unmatched for teaching quality.  Teachers are capable and invested, and Scarsdale has the resources to support a wide range of programs.', 'I only studied in SHS for less than a year but the impact it had on me was phenomenal. Being new not only to the school but the States as well made me worry endlessly about how I would do in school. Turns out I had nothing to worry about -- everyone (my dean, teachers and classmates) were all so nice to me and such a great help. Even when I got lost in the building I could ask any student along the hallways to direct me to my next class and they would do so happily. It made me feel welcomed and more connected to the community here. I really enjoyed my few months there and am and would be forever grateful to the people I met there.', 'Very competitive school district but it prepared me well for college. The students were very competitive in the school district but I learned a lot.', 'The school environment is a very proficient place to study and work towards your dreams. The classes are comprehensive and the teachers are very intelligent and are very supportive. Class sizes are generally 20-25 people, and students are encouraged to seek extra help from their teachers or just to get to know them. However the amount of stress that students experience here are almost suffocating. The aura of competition for college and grades is quite overwhelming, and the workload that students receive continue for hours and hours. But other than that, there is a tight community that binds the school and the town together.', "Only three entrances at the school are open and are watched by an unarmed security guard. Nobody enters the school without a student ID or signing in at the desks and presenting their photo ID's. Additionally, because the school is located in a safe neighborhood, I feel very safe at the school at all times.", 'I am experienced in sports and one club. The sports are very well run and the Miracle League club is run very well. I cannot speak on the behalf of the other clubs and after school activities but the way students can start their own clubs makes for flexible after school programs.', 'While there is an enormous amount of pressure to be the best and go to the best colleges, nearly every student gets into college and nearly every student is prepared for their further education.', 'The different teachers employ different teaching styles to convey points and lessons to a variety of students that learn in different ways. Every student is accommodated and no student is left behind.', "it's great but very stressful", "The facilities are great, and the school puts a lot of work into the school's activities.", 'Some teachers are great, some are not.']
column4: ["Very good quality of education. Teachers are very nice and helpful (for the most part). There are clubs and extracurricular activities for pretty much everyone's interests. There is a lot of Raiders pride (Go raiders!) and the teams are very good. The library is two floors (but is mostly computers...) the music department is one of the best they've ever seen, say many of the teachers. School is very diverse as well, with people from all over the country, and the world, coming here to be educated. There are many programs that help students get jobs and get ready for college. The school is run by a good administration and they run fire drills frequently to prepare the students for a fire (most likely in the chem labs). The food is okay...", "The bad news: It is so cliquy and stuck up both inside and outside the classroom it's pathetic. I was literally socially exiled from some (not all) groups because I wasn't white or I didn't love sports. The workload here makes you miserable... unless you crack under the pressure and decide to stop trying your best. And also, I've noticed that international students in particular will have a very hard time finding any friends here at all.The good news: The teachers are good (some are much better than others). There is generally no bullying from students and teachers (there are exceptions, of course). The food is decent (even if the lines are long). And the academics are amazing (especially if you're smart/tough enough to do well). The clubs/sports here are not great but not bad.Basically, it's good but it's horrible at the same time... and I bet it's not any worse than most high schools out there.", "Scarsdale has an inherent sense of competition, but it isn't a factor that crushes students. This competition motivates students to work their best, and teachers continue to reinforce this idea that you can always do better, even if it is just a little bit. The competition and stress, though harmful at times, does make you feel frequently connected to other students.", 'As a senior, I felt my expereince at SHS has prepared me and given me the maximum potential for college and life after that. I have been given the resources and education to allow myself to become a more mature and accelerated student.', "The academic environment is rigorous and certainly conducive to learning, but the lack of diversity among the student body and faculty mean that it's hard for minority students to find mentors within the school that share their experiences.", "Very good experience overall. The teachers are great and once you graduate, you are prepared no matter what college you choose to attend (not to mention, Scarsdale's reputation will take you very far in regards to the college process). However, there is a cut-throat attitude among students and a very competitive atmosphere", "Scarsdale High School is the perfect environment for a high achieving and highly motivated student. This school's could be much better and the school culture/spirit is lacking for the most part. However, Scarsdale High School still has many redeeming qualities. It is garunteed that if you graduate from this school you will be receiving one of the best high school educations available. There are enough students in this school for it to be possible for each student to find their crowd, even if they are not the steotypical Scarsdale student. There are many students who end up loving their SHS experience while others struggle to get through their four years, proving that this school is absolutely perfect for a specific kind of student. Oveall, a great school for college prep, and academic achievement.", "The quality of the academics are very high. Classes can be stressful but the new wellness initiative is addressing it. While it's not perfect, SHS provides students with one of the best academic experiences country.", 'Scarsdale High School is home to a very competitive student body. Unfortunately, the competition is framed in a way that isolates those who are on the regular or in-advanced tract and causes those students to be looked upon differently. The students are friendly and welcoming for the most part, but it is clear that there are some groups and cliques that have been formed from very early childhood. This can make it especially hard for a new incoming student to make friends and feel comfortable. All in all, it is a great school if you want your child to get a good education and have a chance at getting into a top school. My one advisory would be not to be surprised if he/she gets stressed out or overwhelmed at times.', 'Scarsdale is unmatched for teaching quality.  Teachers are capable and invested, and Scarsdale has the resources to support a wide range of programs.', 'I only studied in SHS for less than a year but the impact it had on me was phenomenal. Being new not only to the school but the States as well made me worry endlessly about how I would do in school. Turns out I had nothing to worry about -- everyone (my dean, teachers and classmates) were all so nice to me and such a great help. Even when I got lost in the building I could ask any student along the hallways to direct me to my next class and they would do so happily. It made me feel welcomed and more connected to the community here. I really enjoyed my few months there and am and would be forever grateful to the people I met there.', 'Very competitive school district but it prepared me well for college. The students were very competitive in the school district but I learned a lot.', 'The school environment is a very proficient place to study and work towards your dreams. The classes are comprehensive and the teachers are very intelligent and are very supportive. Class sizes are generally 20-25 people, and students are encouraged to seek extra help from their teachers or just to get to know them. However the amount of stress that students experience here are almost suffocating. The aura of competition for college and grades is quite overwhelming, and the workload that students receive continue for hours and hours. But other than that, there is a tight community that binds the school and the town together.', "Only three entrances at the school are open and are watched by an unarmed security guard. Nobody enters the school without a student ID or signing in at the desks and presenting their photo ID's. Additionally, because the school is located in a safe neighborhood, I feel very safe at the school at all times.", 'I am experienced in sports and one club. The sports are very well run and the Miracle League club is run very well. I cannot speak on the behalf of the other clubs and after school activities but the way students can start their own clubs makes for flexible after school programs.', 'While there is an enormous amount of pressure to be the best and go to the best colleges, nearly every student gets into college and nearly every student is prepared for their further education.', 'The different teachers employ different teaching styles to convey points and lessons to a variety of students that learn in different ways. Every student is accommodated and no student is left behind.', "it's great but very stressful", "The facilities are great, and the school puts a lot of work into the school's activities.", 'Some teachers are great, some are not.']
column6: ['Academics are very strong, but this also means there is a lot of work, and can be stressful.', 'Scarsdale High School has alot of activities and a very high academic caliber. However, the environment can feel very stressful and confining at times.', 'Alot of the same food.', 'There are alot of resources here if you look for them.', 'There are alot of clubs that want you to join. There is always something to do if you look for it.', "There isn't much interaction from the administration, besides reprimanding you for parking issues, or cutting gym.", "Depends on the teacher. Most go above and beyond, but there are a few who don't know how to teach or are always absent.", 'could be better but this is scarsdale so...', 'The workload is tough for the kids but it also prepares them very well for the future and their continuing education when the move on to colleges and universities.', 'I believe the administration and the district as a whole realizes how lucky we are to live in such a special place with so many opportunities available to our children and we ALL work together and work hard to address any issues that come up for our students whether at the home level or within the school.', 'There is a lot of community, faculty and student support for our athletic programs and team sports and the kids are encouraged to become involved in the vast opportunities available to them.', 'Our school is nationally recognized for its excellence so we are able to attract the best and the brightest teachers to our faculty. They also tend to stay within the district because they are happy and well paid so we get consistency and continuity with our teachers and faculty.', 'The school has a security guard at the main entrance and comings and goings are strictly monitored.', 'There are clubs of SO many kinds for the kids to choose from including some of the best being those that benefit the community such as Habitat for Humanity and the Midnight Run charity.', 'i dont play sports but seems fine', "You will see different cultures but you are going to see birds of a feather flock together except for some groups. A lot of the people who are friends look the same and aren't that unique at first. once you get to know people you'll realize that we are intact diverse its just the majority of the students are white upper middle class.", "The school is clean. the bathrooms are sometimes nasty because, shockingly, some girls don't know how to flush or throw away feminine products. The teachers have comfortable unique offices and the library is amazing for a public school. The lunchroom is too small and the gyms need to be cleaned more often (but they are really big) th classrooms are big and carpeted with smart boards. Not a lot of air conditioning. We have tvs in the halls with the schedules, absent teachers and news pertaining to the school. It has old classic elements too. My favorite place is the auditorium.. a little small but it's beautiful.", 'You get a great education. Its a great school to prepare you for college work load. Kids around you care about their work and you will too. opinions are strong here and we take exams seriously.', "I always feel safe here. Scarsdale is a safe place and if it weren't my mom would make me bring pepper spray to school. Health? Well the nurse cares and you can sleep during the lunch periods .. or you can go home if you are a good actor/ress", 'Look this is an amazing school. No its not easy and by mid year your brain hurts and you get like 3 hours of sleep (junior year yay!) it gets harder and you need to be flexible. But all in all i like that this school lets you thrive. You can do so much if you apply yourself. You are rewarded if you work hard. be yourself and be confident.']

column2: ['SHS is an amazing school. All of the teachers are great and super approachable. They only give helpful work and not busy work to make you miserable.', 'I love the supportive teachers and environment that Syosset high school creatives for its students. The school strives to have an amazing variety of clubs, activities, and resources.', 'Syosset High School is a amazing High School that I would recommend to anyone. The teachers and the classes are  amazing and among the top in the nation.', 'Syosset High School is a place to learn and grow as a person and as a student. Teachers, and counselors are always there when you need them. This is a nurturing place that gives you every chance to succeed.', 'The faculty and the student body are very welcoming! When I first came to the school, there were many upperclassmen who offered to help me when I needed them. The teachers are also very nice, they try their best to help you and they make class very interesting!', 'Academics and extracurriculars were great. The only aspect I really did not like was the student life. Once you were outside of class, the school did nothing to establish relationships with the students.', 'I am forever grateful for the resources and the opportunities that were given to me from this high school. Coming into college I felt super prepared for the work that I was going to get while also being able to maintain my gpa.', 'Syosset High School is where I spent all four years of my high school experience. Considering that it is a blue ribbon school of excellence, classes are quite vigorous. To remain competitive with one another, it is not uncommon to see students weigh themselves down with as many AP classes as possible, as I myself am taking 6 AP classes in my senior year. The teachers that I have had in my four years have been better than average. The majority of teachers who I have had truly aim to educate their students, and create connections with their students to ensure that they understand the material that is being taught.  The school culture is below average. There is almost no school spirit, and 80% of the football game spectators are the students in the marching band who do not want to be there either. The school is also not very diverse. The majority of students are either Caucasian or of Asian descent, with less than 10 African American students in each grade.', 'Top notch school district. Offers students with many opportunities for growth and excels at college preparedness.', 'As a recent high school graduate, I can attest to how well Syosset High School prepared me for college. One thing that can be changed, however, is the competitive atmosphere. Most students at the high school are extremely obsessed about getting perfect SAT scores and perfect grades, and this atmosphere is very stressful. I think there needs to be an emphasis on more collaborative work and less perfection.', 'I liked all of the after school activities and the great academic experience.  The school also supports students in applying for college.  They have a number of great programs to help students with their college application and prepare their college essays.', 'Syosset High School is a great place to go to high school.  Due to its large size, there are so many opportunities to explore your various interests through extracurricular involvements and electives.  The teachers are all very helpful and want their students to succeed.  I am very happy to be a student here.', 'There are alot of clubs and sports to link you to the community. Getting involved beyond academics is easy here as there are over one hundred clubs. The teachers are approachable and want to see you succeed. They are available for extrahelp sessions. There are student tutors available through the honor society.', 'I wish we had more school spirit and that the ACT club got more funding. But there are so many fantastic opportunities for academics and vocational studies in the school!', 'The faculty embodies top-tier professionalism while caring for students in a personal way. The structure and resources make the education experience rich and wholesome. My experience was average because of the students in the school. Students come from well-privileged backgrounds so they are snarky and feel entitled. There was a lack of genuine character and relationships in my high school career.', 'Syosset is a great school. Sometimes it is a bit too competitive, but that is part of their goal to prepare us for college and the future that lies before us. The teachers really do care about students inside and outside the classroom. There is a strong sense of community in the high school and the district as well.', 'Excellent school district, very geared towards academics and higher education.  From elementary school, which offers a different foreign languauge from grades 1-5, middle school they begin gaining the attention and focus of children for college.', 'It is a school that prepares the students for college. There are many classes to choose from and there is a class for each level of education the student needs. There are also many great teachers that work there. Students are overall friendly but moat tend to stay within their friend group. Many clubs to choose from which is awesome because each student will find their interest.', 'Syosset Senior High School has great teachers and resources available for students. There is not much diversity.', 'Syosset High School was a safe, friendly environment with caring teachers who wanted the students to succeed and were dedicated to making sure everyone was understanding the required material.  The whole school felt like they just wanted you to do well there as well as in the college of your choice. SHS really prepared me for college in the best way by making me as a student more dedicated and driven to achieve my goals.   I learned a lot and will always hold the school dear to my heart for all that it has taught me.']

column6: ['Overall my experience at Syosset High School was good. I had some really great teachers, phenomenal compared to college professors, and the classes prepared me well for college. The only thing I would like to see change in would be the diversity.', 'SHS was a great place to attend high school. It allowed me to find what interested me most and to take advantage of the classes I needed to take.  There were so many opportunities between the various class offerings and vast student clubs.  I was very well prepared for college.', 'While at Syosset High School, I was provided with many opportunities that I am confident that other high schools would not have offered.  The atmosphere IS VERY COMPETITIVE and you will be in an environment with kids with great potential, but in the end, if you work your best, the results will come.', 'My time at Syosset High School flew before my eyes. Comparing when I walked into the school as an anxious and apprehensive 14 year old freshman to the mature, well-rounded and confident 18 year old I am today is truly mind-blowing. SHS has allowed to me truly find myself, connect with many peers, challenge myself in a strong academic environment and aid me to become the young adult that I am today. Although Syosset may not be perfect, I have been changed by SHS for the better and feel more than prepared for college and beyond.', "Pretty decent but in my opinion massively overrated. The learning environment is fine and everything, but the school taxes are so ridiculous to the point that I don't think it's really worth the cost.", "I love the environment at Syosset High School. Everyone is so welcoming and willing to help you if you need. The staff is very open and willing to be there for you academically and if you have anything going on. It's very easy to seek help if you need.", 'The school overall was wonderful,  really great teachers and resources.  But the students all come from rich families so I must admit,  very snotty peers', 'Definitely can’t wait to leave.  Academics are pretty good, though there is some cheating that goes on.  The bureaucracy though is very limiting to students; it’s very hard to get something done or speak to an admin when in need.', 'Syosset High School is a great inviting place, my experience with education and making friends have been excellent. There are a wide array of classes and clubs to join so everyone can pursue a topic that they are truly interested in.  The biggest flaw in the school are teachers that are universally disliked for their attitude and teaching abilities, (Mrs. Eager) yet they are still around', 'Syosset Senior High School is a great place of learning and making many friends. This school has helped me become well prepared for college and many other future endeavors.', 'This is a great school, but as a student somewhat difficult to manage the workload. A lot of it comes from the teachers, too, depending on who you have. Otherwise, it’s been a great experience!', "The best education I could've ever hoped for with some of the best teachers in the world.  Every type of class you could think of is offered and accessible.  The only downside about it is the absolutely cutthroat environment that some students force themselves into.", 'Wonderful school!  I have had a great three years at Syosset High School so far and I look forward to senior year!', "I am proud to be a student of Syosset High School and I express this through every tour I give. SHS is not only diverse in its students and faculty but also in its curriculum. Whether you're painting ceiling tiles in AP art classes or learning to save lives in Lifeguarding, there are endless opportunities for each and every student. SHS's teachers are truly special too. They are always willing to help students in need; extra help is available every week and its open to any students regardless of their teacher. For math classes, the school set up an assist program where students can attend an extra help session during their lunch periods. SHS makes sure to offer whatever necessary to enhance their students' intellect and passion. It is a special school, one that I'm fortunate to be in.", 'Syosset Senior High School is a rigorous school that offers a variety of classes. There is definitely an elective that exists that interests every kid - and even if your interest is not shown through a class, the interest is shown through clubs, groups and research opportunities. All the teachers prepare you well for exams and for college - and the information that is being taught is never brushed over. Additionally, there are many extra help dates and times for students to utilize if they need extra assistance.', 'This school has truly made my high school experience! Moving towns, I was uneasy and nervous but Syosset gave me a second home.', 'Good teachers and positive environment. The building is a bit old. I recommend attending the school.', 'Syosset is a great environment and you get a great education, but the competitive atmosphere is a bit of a downside.', "Syosset High School for a very long time promised to be one of the gems of the public schooling system on Long Island.  However, after a string of talented graduates, the administration has taken it upon itself to claim the prestige of these mainly student-brought accomplishments. Instead of diverting funds to proper facilities to nurture students, the school has been more concerned about the superficial display of greatness demonstrated through the useless purchase of Chromebooks and the thousands of dollars invested in technology for the robotics club while Syosset's far more prestigious Science Olympiad, research, and Forensics programs remain underfunded. Virtually every department is weak in its rigor and students by no means are prepared for the independence and hard work required of them in college. Spurred by the vastly inflated egos of the underqualified teachers who are paid more than university professors, the culture of Syosset reeks of entitlement.", 'A great high school. Teachers are kind and involved, students are friendly, safe place. Lots of clubs and sports to be involved with. Facilities get more advanced every year. Soon every student will have a ChromeBook.']
