SHS is not only diverse in its students and faculty but also in its curriculum. Whether you're painting ceiling tiles in AP art classes or learning to save lives in Lifeguarding, there are endless opportunities for each and every student. SHS's teachers are truly special too. They are always willing to help students in need; extra help is available every week and its open to any students regardless of their teacher. For math classes, the school set up an assist program where students can attend an extra help session during their lunch periods. SHS makes sure to offer whatever necessary to enhance their students' intellect and passion. It is a special school, one that I'm fortunate to be in.", 'Syosset Senior High School is a rigorous school that offers a variety of classes. There is definitely an elective that exists that interests every kid - and even if your interest is not shown through a class, the interest is shown through clubs, groups and research opportunities. All the teachers prepare you well for exams and for college - and the information that is being taught is never brushed over. Additionally, there are many extra help dates and times for students to utilize if they need extra assistance.', 'This school has truly made my high school experience! Moving towns, I was uneasy and nervous but Syosset gave me a second home.', 'Good teachers and positive environment. The building is a bit old. I recommend attending the school.', 'Syosset is a great environment and you get a great education, but the competitive atmosphere is a bit of a downside.', "Syosset High School for a very long time promised to be one of the gems of the public schooling system on Long Island.  However, after a string of talented graduates, the administration has taken it upon itself to claim the prestige of these mainly student-brought accomplishments. Instead of diverting funds to proper facilities to nurture students, the school has been more concerned about the superficial display of greatness demonstrated through the useless purchase of Chromebooks and the thousands of dollars invested in technology for the robotics club while Syosset's far more prestigious Science Olympiad, research, and Forensics programs remain underfunded. Virtually every department is weak in its rigor and students by no means are prepared for the independence and hard work required of them in college. Spurred by the vastly inflated egos of the underqualified teachers who are paid more than university professors, the culture of Syosset reeks of entitlement.", 'A great high school. Teachers are kind and involved, students are friendly, safe place. Lots of clubs and sports to be involved with. Facilities get more advanced every year. Soon every student will have a ChromeBook.']

column2: ['I think that Manhasset High School has very great atmosphere. The teachers that work there are also very helpful and skilled.', 'My time at manhasset was ordinary. I had an issue with another student and brought it to guidance but they never helped me in anyway and supported her instead. Got bullied here for several years by said student and nothing was ever done.', 'I believe that Manhasset High School is a great learning environment that provides students with the necessary support and resources needed to succeed. However, I have also seen that it is very easy to fall through the cracks and not get the most out of your time at Manhasset. Teachers will sometimes just give up and let you pass through without learning the necessary content that is required in other classes. There is a huge gap between students who really care about school and take all of the AP level classes and get really good grades and the students that simply pass through without getting the most out of their experience. When I got to college, I felt unprepared for the amount of work I was given that I had not experienced in high school. For example, I was never given proper instruction on how to write an academic essay.', 'manhasset high school is a great place for any student. There are so many opportunities for almost any interest at the school. We are extremely talented in sports and music with a variety of sports clubs and music groups. We even have theatre. The school is very good with being a learning friendly environment. It’s a place where everyone can feel accepted.', 'I moved to Manhasset in March 2017 as an 8th grader, and it has been an extraordinary school experience. Manhasset Secondary School offers various excellent academic courses, clubs and sports. People in this school are generally very kind, and it is so safe that sometimes it even feels boring because nothing "dangerous" or "unsafe" happened here since when I transferred here. The school has interesting events and traditions, though. They have great smartboards, desktops and laptops. The counselors are also very kind and they willingly hear any student\'s issues, even if it seems so small. The staffs are highly aware of bullying and any kind of violence in school. Most teachers are very eager and friendly. One thing that Manhasset lacks of is diversity. I would say about 80% of the people are white. There food is slightly better than average, but I think it is overpriced. I always bring my own food from home.', "Manhasset High School is a very competitive school as their SAT scores are around 1300s. Manhasset has a big emphasis on school sports as Manhasset's Lacrosse team is one of the best in the country. Many different AP courses are available to students. Recently, renovated the research department allowing for kids in research to get better experiments and results. Science research is one of the big points of Manhasset High School as Manhasset recently won prizes. Manhasset lacks diversity; however, this is getting better as more and more people of different races are moving into this predominately white neighborhood. Manhasset prepares its kids to go to college. Therefore, Manhasset High School is a great environment to learn and play sports, but Manhasset is lacking diversity other schools might have.", 'What I loved about my high school is that it was my home away from home. I was able to find things that I love and would continue as a college student. I loved the opportunities and experiences I had. I wouldn’t change anything about my high school.', "I don't like some of the teachers because they aren't qualified. Other than that, the school is pretty good.", 'Mostly meant for kids who love to play sports, have a good time, and love to show off there status. When I went there the school was ok, some things are good and other things were bad. I fee like the teachers were sometimes robots and would read straight from the book. They were very much common core oriented, The class of 2016 was the experimental year of trying different methods of teaching and testing. Not a fun a time. Overall, my sophomore and senior year were the only good years of high school for me. Everything else was ok.', 'I loved my time at Manhasset High School! I now attend a highly competitive college, and I felt adequately prepared graduating from Manhasset. The teachers were extremely helpful, welcoming of questions, approachable, and wanted to work with you to make sure that you preformed well. Some of my favorite teachers to this day as a college senior are from Manhasset High School.', "Manhasset is good educationally and socially it's a very accepting school. A lot of things can change, but some of the issues are just solved with age.", "As a native US citizen whose parents are immigrants that came from overseas, I would love to see some more diversity in the student and teacher population. This may naturally take place over time, however, in the meantime there could be substantial progress in the departments of the celebration of diverse backgrounds as well as the general school spirit. Students' attitudes, as they are at most schools, are extremely negative towards school. The fact that this is an issue in schools across the board is no excuse for its prescence, and the administration must take appropriate actions. It may be considered naive of me, but I truly believe that school can be an enjoyable experience for all under the right circumstances. Learning new knowledge can be highly rewarding when students' mentalities are properly catered to. On a lighter note, the food is comparably better in quality and nutrition than most schools.", 'Very good school overall. A lot of options when it come to academics and sports. Curriculum is challenging in any course.', 'great school, nice teachers, and classmates, but too many rules let students feel no freedom. this school provides many great ap classes for junior and senior. which I think it is very good for students to get one step forward for their college. The grade is assignment fairly and sports teams are really good, good property and courses for sports.', 'Manhasset is a cookie cutter school - Not at all welcoming to other religions other than Greek or catholic and now Asian.  The Kids are mean especially the girls very cliquey and will exclude you if you  are not a star athlete and fit the Manhasset look/financial status /attitude of "SNUB" Trust me, YOU LEARN QUICKLY HERE!  This goes for the boys as well. Teacher and administrators really don\'t care and close their eyes to bullying unless its so necessary that it is exposed they do not  stand with their students.  The more involved the parents are, the nastier the kids.  Really a horrible place to raise a family.', 'The Manhasset school district is one of the very best, they want their students to do their very best. They offer a multitude of many sports to choose from. They have so many clubs the students can get involved in, as well as many volunteer opportunities. There is something for everyone. The parents are fully involved in PTA meetings, their voices are heard, and many volunteer opportunities exist for them. A nice small town where everyone knows everyone, and their their children. We look out for one another, and our children. Their is so much opportunity here when you graduate. Top rated colleges and universities in N.Y.C.  and nearby. Many opportunities for employment and internships in N.Y.C.', "Manhasset High is a public school run like a private school. All the students end up at amazing schools after graduation. I don't have a bad thing to say about any of the teachers, students, classes, extracurriculars, etc.", 'Academics are very strong. They push the students to work at their very best. There is extra help before and after school if needed. There are homework sessions after school free of charge. There are teachers willing to tutor for free three days a week. You can be very creative here and work at your highest potential. There is all kinds of support classes if needed. The teachers stay on top of each student. And send emails to the parents updating them.', 'Ny overall experience has been great. The academics and teachers are excellent. They work collectively to achieve the best results for their students. You will get honest progress reports and daily e-mails to keep you updated on the work the students are learning. I would absolutely choose this school again.', "So many people get drunk on the weekends. It's just stupid."]

column6: ['The school has extra curricular activities ranging from theatre to sports to model UN and many others. The drama department at our school is amazing,  but kids who are in the plays do not have the opportunities to do sports or other activities.', "Parents at the school care more about sports than they do about education. Parents push their kids to be 3 season varsity players, and when their kid doesn't make varsity they complain until it happens.", 'My math teacher is amazing. He is always engaging and genuinely wants us to learn more. He makes the class fun, but we still learn so much.', "Clubs are not given much unlike the lion's share of the budget (around $2 million/yr) that goes to athletics. Besides almost all kids are in a team and don't have time for other clubs.", "It's a preppy school filled with preppy kids. Very exclusionary and cliquey. Not for anyone who can't fit in. Sports run the entire school from top to bottom. Thankfully academics are fantastic.", "Some teachers are saints but others can't teach at all.", 'Most teachers are very educated and were top of their own class in college. Everyone uses technology in their lesson plans: smart board, google classroom, etc. Manhasset is a blue ribbon school district in New York State so teachers take pride in being a faculty member and claim they fought hard to get the job at the school. However, teachers commonly fall into what parents call the "tenure cushion"... After receiving tenure, teachers lose motivation to help struggling students and to go above and beyond. They no longer care about whether a student receives an A or a C on exams and finals. Teachers verbalize to their classes that they are protected under tenure and will be unaffected with our general satisfaction of the class. Teachers almost completely lose interest in classes with seniors. They basically beg the students to care about the course and to be attentive in class, yet most teachers don\'t even have set lesson plans for students. Also, I have found that some teachers make personal opinions about students based on stereotypes! Teachers will decide if they like or dislike a student based on what they look like and what they "seem" like.', 'The teams are competitive and filled with driven athletes determined to be the best they can be. I love the teams and the bond you make with certain people is truly a once in a lifetime experience', "I moved here my junior year. Everyone was pretty accepting. Teachers and staff have been always there for you whenever you need. Sporting events are awesome and it's always a ton of fun!", 'Awesome teachers. Just sometimes unfair grading or policies.', 'Overall, the teachers and staff at this school are highly supportive and friendly. However, some of the students were somewhat unsavory in nature. The lunch food leaves something to be desired.\r I enjoyed taking Latin and Studio Art at this school.', "If you don't play lacrosse, aren't in all AP classes or are queer you will have a very tough time fitting it.", 'security at initial entry point and at entrances', 'lunch room is overcrowded ,  limited staff', 'Guidance, and administration is easily accessable', 'The school is very old, therefore the space for indoor sports facilities is very limited.\r Recently a new turf filed was put in', 'My personal experience I found a very large majority of my teachers who genuinely cared about the students.\r Most would go above and beyond what they are required to do.  My experience at MHS is a very positive one, and\r despite my early education academic difficulties, I have fond memories of elementary, middle school and high school.\r It was thanks to the extra efforts put forth by my teachers in elementary school, who worked very diligently with me that I was able to perform well in high school, and have given me a solid foundation to continue to work hard in my continuing higher education', 'MHS stdents and parents take a vested interest in the school and community and are very organized and well attended.', 'It was great be uase it gave every one an opportunity to play and try out for teams.', 'We have a great support system for our children']

column2: ['I like that my school is very diverse. The school itself offers students a variety of extracurriculars and ways to be involved. I wish that it was a little bit cleaner.', 'I joined this school in my junior year and my experience so far has been amazing. All the teachers are so kind and helpful while the students are so sweet and willing to help anyone that seems lost. I joined a sports team this year and it has been amazing. The Coach is so sweet and welcoming, she pushes us to do better and always encourages the team. All facilities provided are available to everyone and the district continuously works to better them.', 'Bad at sports which does relate to school spirit but school events usually make up for it. Could be more helpful to students with mental illness but they are taking action to improve. Overall I had a good school experience and education at Herricks and I was more than ready for college as a result of it.', "Herricks High School is only a good place for you if you're an Asian kid who is willing to study 40 hours a week on top of homework, and not want to go out on a Friday or Saturday night, instead be in your room studying. Herricks is basically isolated from the rest of Nassau County, because it's practically a ghost town. We're terrible at sports because we promote academics way too much. Those with a high GPA may consider themselves smart, but the people who know about the world around them are truly the smartest, because nobody is going to ask you obscure information you learned in high school 20 years after. Normal high schools in the movies and on TV show students having parties and going out, here that doesn't happen, just more studying instead. The demographics are getting more and more Asian and less and less white. Starting with say the class of 2040, the school is probably going to be completely Asian.", "Herricks is a very diverse school with a lot of great things to offer. Our teachers were pretty engaged for the most part and I had a few that were really good about challenging you to do stuff but not all of them.  Music programs were really good and so were our art teachers.  Volleyball and Football coaches were good and so were the girls coaches but our baseball coaches not so much. The overall staff was dedicated and willing to help but you have to make sure you seek it out.  My guidance counselor rarely helped out so it didn't feel like anyone was offering advice for getting in to college or help to get grades up until there was a problem.  Overall it was a great high school with plenty of community support and some great teachers. We also just had a new football field and track installed recently.", 'In one word: Asian. Herricks is extremely academically competitive and their main focus is to prepare students for college. Teachers are generally willing to help during both class and off periods. The science and music extracurricular programs really stand out. Sports are mostly for fun or adding to resumes, though there are some actually dedicated athletes on each team. There are enough clubs that everyone can find a place to be involved after school.', 'Herricks High School is academically competitive and has a great selection of hard-working and attentive teachers.', 'Herricks High School is a place filled with opportunities and places to pursue and discover your passions. From the administration, which is unsurpassed at managing and leading the school district, to the teachers, who are incredibly supportive, the students at Herricks have an ample amount of a safe space to grow.', 'I love Herricks High School and I am extremely proud to call myself a graduate from here. Four years of great memories. A lot has probably changed since my time here but, I can say that my high school experience was a positive one due to the many wonderful teachers and staff people who helped me on my journey.', 'Herricks has a strong focus on academics and prepares students very well for college. They lack the budget in the arts. They do not put much emphasis on the arts. Art facilities and equipment are dated and funding towards the arts is considerably lacking compared to other facilities/equipment like sports, for example.', 'My experience at Herricks High School has been great. This high school keeps me motivated and driven every single day. We have great teachers and our education is definitely one of the best! There has never been a day where I have not left without a smile on my face. I would not change one thing about this school!', 'I graduated Herricks High School in 2016, after attending both their respective middle school and elementary school. Herricks High School felt more like a home to me than school. The teachers were extremely personal and aided individuals to do their best. The community embraced uniqueness and diversity in individuals rather than making people feel out of place for being different. There was a strong emphasis on growth in the school to the point where I did not have a difficult transition into college, whereas I know many students do. There was an ample amount of resources available through being a student there, such as access to databases and other important tools. Our music department excelled every single year, along with our improving sports program. The school allowed students to create their own clubs about almost everything that they wanted, giving students a chance to discover new interests.', "It is a pretty fun place, although there is too much obsession over grades. There could be better food, as the hot lunch is pretty terrible. The budget should've also been used more for books, equipment and improvement of classrooms", "We've been living in the District for 15 years; my older 2 children went to parochial HS's and my youngest is currently a student at Herricks.  Far and away, Herricks has provided the better overall educational experience.  The teachers are first rate, the curriculum is challenging and the extracurricular activities help round out the entire experience.", 'Herricks schools are great.  It is very diverse and the students are all very inclusive. The teachers are always available for extra help.  The guidance department was very involved in my college planning and I feel that I am very prepared for college.', 'The way teachers work here actually teaches you stuff of value unlike most schools. For most people school is a waste of time and I also agree with that. But school is not an option and we dont have any substitute for it yet. But if you really dive in, you can actually benefit from a lot of things, if not everything, because kniowledge is everywhere. It is up to us what we do with it.', 'Being a Herricks High School student is a rewarding experience. It is hard work but I know I will be well prepared for college.', "Herricks High School provided me with the education, opportunities, and resources I needed to prepare myself for college and be continually challenged. Generally, students are very involved in clubs, sports, and music and deeply care about what they do. As a violinist, I appreciate Herricks' especially strong music program.", "Herricks high school's teachers genuinely try their best to have their students excel and legitimately understand the class material rather than just gain knowledge for one test only to forget about it later on. The student body is generally very respectful, helpful, and friendly.", "Herrick's High School is  an amazing high-school and a great district in general. It offers several course that students actually would want to take instead of a more forced curriculum. Everyone here is motivated, driven, and I have not seen one kid who doesn't have the will to succeed. Being that I just came to this school this school year 2017-2018, as I came from Cardozo High School in Flushing (Approx. 4k Kids). I found the transition of course a little difficult. But eventually I saw such bright kids that were all passionate for things that I wanted to do, not what my parents or faculty was forcing upon me. Overall, I am glad I came here and have absolutely no regrets."]

Could be more helpful to students with mental illness but they are taking action to improve. Overall I had a good school experience and education at Herricks and I was more than ready for college as a result of it.', "Herricks High School is only a good place for you if you're an Asian kid who is willing to study 40 hours a week on top of homework, and not want to go out on a Friday or Saturday night, instead be in your room studying. Herricks is basically isolated from the rest of Nassau County, because it's practically a ghost town. We're terrible at sports because we promote academics way too much. Those with a high GPA may consider themselves smart, but the people who know about the world around them are truly the smartest, because nobody is going to ask you obscure information you learned in high school 20 years after. Normal high schools in the movies and on TV show students having parties and going out, here that doesn't happen, just more studying instead. The demographics are getting more and more Asian and less and less white. Starting with say the class of 2040, the school is probably going to be completely Asian.", "Herricks is a very diverse school with a lot of great things to offer. Our teachers were pretty engaged for the most part and I had a few that were really good about challenging you to do stuff but not all of them.  Music programs were really good and so were our art teachers.  Volleyball and Football coaches were good and so were the girls coaches but our baseball coaches not so much. The overall staff was dedicated and willing to help but you have to make sure you seek it out.  My guidance counselor rarely helped out so it didn't feel like anyone was offering advice for getting in to college or help to get grades up until there was a problem.  Overall it was a great high school with plenty of community support and some great teachers. We also just had a new football field and track installed recently.", 'In one word: Asian. Herricks is extremely academically competitive and their main focus is to prepare students for college. Teachers are generally willing to help during both class and off periods. The science and music extracurricular programs really stand out. Sports are mostly for fun or adding to resumes, though there are some actually dedicated athletes on each team. There are enough clubs that everyone can find a place to be involved after school.', 'Herricks High School is academically competitive and has a great selection of hard-working and attentive teachers.', 'Herricks High School is a place filled with opportunities and places to pursue and discover your passions. From the administration, which is unsurpassed at managing and leading the school district, to the teachers, who are incredibly supportive, the students at Herricks have an ample amount of a safe space to grow.', 'I love Herricks High School and I am extremely proud to call myself a graduate from here. Four years of great memories. A lot has probably changed since my time here but, I can say that my high school experience was a positive one due to the many wonderful teachers and staff people who helped me on my journey.', 'Herricks has a strong focus on academics and prepares students very well for college. They lack the budget in the arts. They do not put much emphasis on the arts. Art facilities and equipment are dated and funding towards the arts is considerably lacking compared to other facilities/equipment like sports, for example.', 'My experience at Herricks High School has been great. This high school keeps me motivated and driven every single day. We have great teachers and our education is definitely one of the best! There has never been a day where I have not left without a smile on my face. I would not change one thing about this school!', 'I graduated Herricks High School in 2016, after attending both their respective middle school and elementary school. Herricks High School felt more like a home to me than school. The teachers were extremely personal and aided individuals to do their best. The community embraced uniqueness and diversity in individuals rather than making people feel out of place for being different. There was a strong emphasis on growth in the school to the point where I did not have a difficult transition into college, whereas I know many students do. There was an ample amount of resources available through being a student there, such as access to databases and other important tools. Our music department excelled every single year, along with our improving sports program. The school allowed students to create their own clubs about almost everything that they wanted, giving students a chance to discover new interests.', "It is a pretty fun place, although there is too much obsession over grades. There could be better food, as the hot lunch is pretty terrible. The budget should've also been used more for books, equipment and improvement of classrooms", "We've been living in the District for 15 years; my older 2 children went to parochial HS's and my youngest is currently a student at Herricks.  Far and away, Herricks has provided the better overall educational experience.  The teachers are first rate, the curriculum is challenging and the extracurricular activities help round out the entire experience.", 'Herricks schools are great.  It is very diverse and the students are all very inclusive. The teachers are always available for extra help.  The guidance department was very involved in my college planning and I feel that I am very prepared for college.', 'The way teachers work here actually teaches you stuff of value unlike most schools. For most people school is a waste of time and I also agree with that. But school is not an option and we dont have any substitute for it yet. But if you really dive in, you can actually benefit from a lot of things, if not everything, because kniowledge is everywhere. It is up to us what we do with it.', 'Being a Herricks High School student is a rewarding experience. It is hard work but I know I will be well prepared for college.', "Herricks High School provided me with the education, opportunities, and resources I needed to prepare myself for college and be continually challenged. Generally, students are very involved in clubs, sports, and music and deeply care about what they do. As a violinist, I appreciate Herricks' especially strong music program.", "Herricks high school's teachers genuinely try their best to have their students excel and legitimately understand the class material rather than just gain knowledge for one test only to forget about it later on. The student body is generally very respectful, helpful, and friendly.", "Herrick's High School is  an amazing high-school and a great district in general. It offers several course that students actually would want to take instead of a more forced curriculum. Everyone here is motivated, driven, and I have not seen one kid who doesn't have the will to succeed. Being that I just came to this school this school year 2017-2018, as I came from Cardozo High School in Flushing (Approx. 4k Kids). I found the transition of course a little difficult. But eventually I saw such bright kids that were all passionate for things that I wanted to do, not what my parents or faculty was forcing upon me. Overall, I am glad I came here and have absolutely no regrets."]
column6: ['Herricks High School offers excellent academics (as one of the best high schools in the country) and superb college readiness. However, it does boast of being a diverse school which, in reality it is not as it is in one of the wealthiest areas to live in the nation.', 'For me personally, I know that I loved all the teachers I had and thought that the school really did a good job at preparing us for college, whether it was through the school curriculum or the large number of AP courses available. My guidence counselor was very approachable and helpful through my high school career.', 'Herricks is competitive but it prepare you well for college. Be prepared for the workload. The teachers are good but have high expectations and pile on work.', 'Herricks High School is the optimal place for a student to experience an abundance of educational and cultural diversity.Herricks High School is a place of college readiness, where I can take honors and AP courses, from Honors Chemistry to AP Literature, as well as have the ability to join many clubs and extracurriculars. I can be a part of the Pep Band while on the Herricks Spring Track Team, which demonstrates opportunities for the interests of the students.\tThe teachers at Herricks provide courses and guidance to all students who want pursue a subject to those who need help studying. The guidance counselors are open to meet everyday and care about the well being of their students.Also, I am surrounding by an accepting crowd of diversity. I have friends from all cultural, ethnic, and racial backgrounds that encompass a worldview of culture all in the confines of one school.Herricks is the amazing combination of education and culture that I would not change for anything else.', "I am so happy to be in HHS. The teachers here and offered academical supports are so good. I do appreciate teachers' help a lot. Also, I am glad that I finally found a school with various club activites and sports teams. I love the school culture too. I think students in HHS works hard and also play hard. I really like the school culture. Everything is perfect!", 'Herricks High School is considered a community more than a school to me. I am a senior here as of now, and it has been an overall excellent experience. Herricks not only prepares you extremely well for college, but also for life. At Herricks High School, we are all one family. From the student body, to the caring teachers and staff, Herricks is a family and community that you want to be apart of.', "Herricks has plenty of nice teachers and everyone is competitive about grades and scores.Herricks also has nice music but that's about it.If you really fall behind they'll try exploiting you and if you are different or shy you won't fit in or make many friends. Most people have the same goals and such and it's quite boring especially if you like different things others would hate it. A lot of the students are just mean and cocky.I personally wish I wasn't in herricks however it's the only public school nearby. I feel like we're are sheltered too much and even putting this message out here I know I'll probably get hate and such and I can't even say this in front of herricks people because they'll just ignore me.And to change it would take too much as well as being teens it's too unstable. I do not trust herricks staff.", 'The school itself is really competitive since some students either go to ivy or top ranking schools, while most get scholarships into local schools such as Adelphi, Hofstra, Stony Brook, Macaulay, NYIT, and Binghamton.', 'everything is boring and could use more student freedom or hands on experiences. clubs are decent, sports are not bad, most teachers make life hell with homework.', 'Herricks High School was quite the experience. Whereas the teachers were extremely qualified, my classmates were particularly mean. I felt abused, yet I could not place that feeling until after I graduated and was able to move on. It was only during my time spent in my next learning facility that I came upon the realization that Herricks sucked.', 'There is a sense of community that exists within Herricks despite the wealth of diversity in the student population, which is one of the many reasons it continues to succeed.', "I came into the Herricks School District in the 7th grade and switching was the best decision I've ever made.", 'I would like to see more racial and economic diversity. Herricks was a very homogeneous place in terms of financial status and race--everyone was white or Asian, and there were close to no low income, Hispanic, or black students. This created a very powerful bubble effect, making the students unaware of their privilege and making them feel entitled to many opportunities they never worked for.', 'Herricks High School is the best high school district on Long Island. The teachers are amazing and attentive and will help your children out.', 'I love Herricks. The diversity of the community is so different than those outside of the district. Herricks high school is a safe environment. The teachers are amazing as well as the students. The acceptance level in this  school is amazing because it is different. There are so many accepting students. Herricks promotes an anti-bullying zone and it is commendable in the amount of comfort I feel to be able to go to any teacher as well as the guidance counselors.', "The school is really amazing and the teachers are very helpful. When you need help or don't understand something they will take time to explain it to you and make sure you understand it ", 'Teachers know so much about the subjects they teach. Scheduling process is very effecient.', 'So many different options for all students. Many sports to choose from.', 'From my experience, I barely have any instances where I have been discriminated against.', "The teachers are always looking for student's opinions. Voices are always heard. Teachers go above and beyond to make sure every student understands."]

column2: ['Staples High School affords its students wonderful opportunities for learning with caring and dedicated teachers, a nurturing environment and a wide range of course options, extracurricular activities and clubs. Students could benefit from less competition and more support of each other.', 'The support at the school was very beneficial. All of the faculty made it a safe environment, and the police presence at the school guaranteed our safety. The amount of courses offered at the school was incredible, and I found the opportunity to find myself during the four years', 'guidance counselor told me to lower my expectations for my college apps... ended up getting into the school of my dreams with no help from them. only thing SHS gave me was trauma, even more mental health issues, and low self esteem. :D', 'Staples is a phenomenal public high school equipt with every resource and club imaginable. While the academics, athletics, and college preparation are amazing, two flaws that stand out to me the most are: school culture and diversity. College seems to be an overstressed subject at Staples, where it begins to stir competition between peers and high levels of stress and anxiety among many students. In addition, there is not much diversity at the school. However, with all that being said, I think the pros of Staples definitely outshine the cons.', "Staples is a great place for some and not so great for others. I really loved being constantly pushed by my amazing teachers and taking classes that I might not be fortunate enough to take otherwise. The main downfall for me was how unnecessarily competitive the environment was. Really wish that hadn't been the case as it would have made the overall experience a lot more enjoyable. In the end though, I am very grateful for the education I got. In college, I feel more prepared than any of my classmates and that's due to how prepared Staples made me. Oh and the food really needs improvement for such an affluent town, more healthy options would be appreciated.", "This school is amazing. The teachers are tops of their field and payed well to match. Some classes are taught by PhD. The athletic and art departments are extremely well funded which increases student involvement outside of school hours. There's a scandal with one or two teachers a year, however, so keep an eye out for that.", "I was a student and athlete at Staples High School. I participated in a varsity sport for 10 out of 12 seasons and took 3 AP classes in my time at Staples. Despite all of this, Staples prepared me for college in an amazing way. Once I got to college it was easy to adjust and the course load wasn't too much to handle. Staples was very helpful throughout the entire application process as well. Overall, I think Staples was a great high school and very helpful.", 'like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it like it .', 'Staples provided me with an unbelievable abundance of opportunities. Truly, anything was possible. Whether it be play on an inclusive and competitive team, build robots and machines with a nationally-ranked science club, or travel to Washington DC to participate in a mock Congress, the possibilities were endless. Any student can find something they are passionate about here, and can be guided by the amazingly friendly, knowledgeable, and supportive teachers. It has quite a competitive atmosphere, but that only served to encourage me.', "Staples High School has been a great experience. Staples focuses on college preparation very well. While there could be some more guidance on selecting a college or other things that needed to be done, I still feel that, as disorganized as I was, I was still going to do fine.The best part of Staples has to be the teachers. Sure, there are some that aren't as fun to have, but there are some true gems that really care about the material they teach and engaging students. The wide array of classes are helpful for finding your passion as well.Clubs and Activities are great, there's plenty of selection and the ease of starting new clubs is fairly high. Sports I can't speak of, since I never really participated in one, but we do have great school spirit.", 'I really loved going to high school here. Sure, its full of rich kids, but honestly the education was great. the extra curricular are unparalleled, sports are amazing, and everyone is so smart.', "If you have learning disabilities the school doesn't care about helping you as much as reducing the cost of how much they spend on your education. it's like if you don't follow the traditional way of learning then you will amount to nothing.", "Really enjoyed going to high school here. Nice and clean environment. Most teachers really care about each individual student's success as long as they are respectfull", 'I liked that Staples really prepared me for college and it taught me how to acquire a fantastic work ethic. I think it should improve school start times by making school start later because fatigue slows students down and makes them less happy and less likely to perform well on assessments.', 'The academics are great and teachers are committed to your learning, although the pressure is intense. Additionally, there is much competition among students.', 'Like that there’s a lot to offer between academics, sports, and clubs. Would like to see a better culture and more diversity, though.', 'Excellent school that puts emotional health at the top of the list with academic excellence.  Teachers are inspiring and are very interested in the student as an individual.', 'I think Staples High School is such a great school.  I have truly enjoyed my time here so far and I think almost everyone can say the same.', 'Amazing school  love to see less pressure about grades  there’s too much pressure on the students and It less about what they learn and more about their grades', 'Very competitive environment academically and athletically. There is no room for kids to do sports unless you are very good at the sport. Does not promote healthy living for those that need it and would enjoy sports for the fun and health of it. Many options for AP classes or interesting electives.']

column6: ['I loved some of the teachers, mostly english and math, but there were many teachers that were subpar. The athletic opportunities are incredible, I was able to play football, rugby, baseball, and water polo throughout my career at Staples. Unfortunately they have a 3 concussion rule that I massively exceeded which ended my sports career halfway through my senior year and decreased my desire to attend and stay in college.', 'I liked the fact that we always had all necessary technology for teachers to carry out their lessons.', 'I had an incredibly nurturing and enlightening experience at Staples High School. I felt as though it prepared me for my college experience by enhancing my skills in academics, athletics, and social networking', 'I overall enjoyed my experience at Staples. They do a really good job or preparing their students for college.', 'The teachers at Staples are amazing, and the classes definitely prepare you for college. There is a very intense culture when it comes to college admissions. Overall, I had a really positive experience at Staples.', 'Vast academic opportunities but somewhat of a high stress environment. There are many clubs that students can get involved with too.', "There's something about the teachers at Staples that sets the school apart from the rest. Not only are they all extremely intelligent, they are also very personable. My biggest critique is the environment of the school. It is overall a very competitive space that is way worse than it needs to be.", "Good education, horrible atmosphere. People take classes that are way too hard for them and get tutors just to be able to do well. Everyone's obsessed with being the best but won't admit it.", 'Staples High School is a fabulous public high school. It grants students the freedom to explore their interests through a variety of different electives in art, music, sciences and so much more. The athletic facilities and academic facilities are carefully attended to and always clean. The administration is most often willing to hear out student requests and abide by those requests if within reason.', 'Attending Staples High School was an incredible experience. The teachers  create both an encouraging and challenging environment for students to learn and succeed in. Through various experiences, such as the senior year internships, students are given the opportunity to create a network of connections, witness work environments, and get real life experience in a field of their interest. The academics and experiences at this school are top notch, and truly prepare the students for their future, whether it be through further education or a career.', 'Great school; prepares you well for college with difficult classes; great teachers; excellent opportunities; and amazing extra curriculars.', "It was an amazing school , unfortunately didn't deal well with transfer high school student from lower income towns.", 'I am beyond grateful to have joined the Staples community in my junior year. I had unparalleled opportunities to pursue my topics of interest as well as to establish an academic journal. It is a school that is supportive of any niche or passion one might have.', 'The teachers and advisors were very helpful. The overall environment is competitive but it helps because it makes you work.', 'Staples is a school of intense competition that sadly leaves many behind. Those who keep up do very well for themselves, and I would say that anyone who cares is comes out knowing alot more than when they came in. Teachers are amazing, preparation for college is second to none.', "Lots of extracurricular activities to choose from so there is something for everyone. Also many electives to add to your schedule to make your day a little bit more fun. Whether it's culinary, pottery, journalism, etc.", 'Staples High School has it all!  Great teachers, sports, theater, music, radio/tv, clubs and academics.', "I really thought Staples challenged me very well, and prepared me for college very well. I think a problem that Staples has is that the teachers are not all ways very good. There are some teachers that just love being at school and want to teach the students the material, then there are those who it feels like they just are trying to get through each day, and then there are a few teachers who it seems like they don't have any understanding of the material they are teaching. Over all I really liked Staples, because of the way it prepared me for college, but I think that there are teacher that students need to watch out for.", "Staples High School is a place of great opportunity. They have many academics and extracurricular activities for students. This high school has a variety of sports, and really works hard to keep the children active. Academic wise the students have the freedom to take challenge courses, also the schools try to teach children to their pace. The school environment is welcoming and tries it's best to give the students voice through student assembly and inklings. If the school was just based on the Academic and extracurricular aspect alone then they would score an A+. Unfortunately, the students don't seem to reflect the schools perseverance. There are racial issues within the school, diversity problems, and some issues that seem to be ignored by the staff. If the school was rated on the students behavior, they would easily get a C-.", 'Academics- A large variety of courses are offered to meet ever student\'s need level. In most subjects B, A, Honors, and APs are offered with a few C level courses. Teachers- For the most part, teachers are very dedicated and passionate about their work. Every teacher has office hours and encourages coming to see them for extra helpClubs& Activities- While most clubs have been created by students to give themselves "leadership experience" for college applications, some clubs and activities, Like Staples Players or Mathletes, are very serious, time consuming, and respected activities. Sports- A huge part of the school school and very time-consuming for those who participate. Parent Involvement- Parents are extremely involved. Most of the teacher and the administration are scared of them. Diversity- Diversity is almost non-existent. College Readiness- I do not know a single person that wasn\'t prepared for the course load college they attended.']
column8: ['I loved some of the teachers, mostly english and math, but there were many teachers that were subpar. The athletic opportunities are incredible, I was able to play football, rugby, baseball, and water polo throughout my career at Staples. Unfortunately they have a 3 concussion rule that I massively exceeded which ended my sports career halfway through my senior year and decreased my desire to attend and stay in college.', 'I liked the fact that we always had all necessary technology for teachers to carry out their lessons.', 'I had an incredibly nurturing and enlightening experience at Staples High School. I felt as though it prepared me for my college experience by enhancing my skills in academics, athletics, and social networking', 'I overall enjoyed my experience at Staples. They do a really good job or preparing their students for college.', 'The teachers at Staples are amazing, and the classes definitely prepare you for college. There is a very intense culture when it comes to college admissions. Overall, I had a really positive experience at Staples.', 'Vast academic opportunities but somewhat of a high stress environment. There are many clubs that students can get involved with too.', "There's something about the teachers at Staples that sets the school apart from the rest. Not only are they all extremely intelligent, they are also very personable. My biggest critique is the environment of the school. It is overall a very competitive space that is way worse than it needs to be.", "Good education, horrible atmosphere. People take classes that are way too hard for them and get tutors just to be able to do well. Everyone's obsessed with being the best but won't admit it.", 'Staples High School is a fabulous public high school. It grants students the freedom to explore their interests through a variety of different electives in art, music, sciences and so much more. The athletic facilities and academic facilities are carefully attended to and always clean. The administration is most often willing to hear out student requests and abide by those requests if within reason.', 'Attending Staples High School was an incredible experience. The teachers  create both an encouraging and challenging environment for students to learn and succeed in. Through various experiences, such as the senior year internships, students are given the opportunity to create a network of connections, witness work environments, and get real life experience in a field of their interest. The academics and experiences at this school are top notch, and truly prepare the students for their future, whether it be through further education or a career.', 'Great school; prepares you well for college with difficult classes; great teachers; excellent opportunities; and amazing extra curriculars.', "It was an amazing school , unfortunately didn't deal well with transfer high school student from lower income towns.", 'I am beyond grateful to have joined the Staples community in my junior year. I had unparalleled opportunities to pursue my topics of interest as well as to establish an academic journal. It is a school that is supportive of any niche or passion one might have.', 'The teachers and advisors were very helpful. The overall environment is competitive but it helps because it makes you work.', 'Staples is a school of intense competition that sadly leaves many behind. Those who keep up do very well for themselves, and I would say that anyone who cares is comes out knowing alot more than when they came in. Teachers are amazing, preparation for college is second to none.', "Lots of extracurricular activities to choose from so there is something for everyone. Also many electives to add to your schedule to make your day a little bit more fun. Whether it's culinary, pottery, journalism, etc.", 'Staples High School has it all!  Great teachers, sports, theater, music, radio/tv, clubs and academics.', "I really thought Staples challenged me very well, and prepared me for college very well. I think a problem that Staples has is that the teachers are not all ways very good. There are some teachers that just love being at school and want to teach the students the material, then there are those who it feels like they just are trying to get through each day, and then there are a few teachers who it seems like they don't have any understanding of the material they are teaching. Over all I really liked Staples, because of the way it prepared me for college, but I think that there are teacher that students need to watch out for.", "Staples High School is a place of great opportunity. They have many academics and extracurricular activities for students. This high school has a variety of sports, and really works hard to keep the children active. Academic wise the students have the freedom to take challenge courses, also the schools try to teach children to their pace. The school environment is welcoming and tries it's best to give the students voice through student assembly and inklings. If the school was just based on the Academic and extracurricular aspect alone then they would score an A+. Unfortunately, the students don't seem to reflect the schools perseverance. There are racial issues within the school, diversity problems, and some issues that seem to be ignored by the staff. If the school was rated on the students behavior, they would easily get a C-.", 'Academics- A large variety of courses are offered to meet ever student\'s need level. In most subjects B, A, Honors, and APs are offered with a few C level courses. Teachers- For the most part, teachers are very dedicated and passionate about their work. Every teacher has office hours and encourages coming to see them for extra helpClubs& Activities- While most clubs have been created by students to give themselves "leadership experience" for college applications, some clubs and activities, Like Staples Players or Mathletes, are very serious, time consuming, and respected activities. Sports- A huge part of the school school and very time-consuming for those who participate. Parent Involvement- Parents are extremely involved. Most of the teacher and the administration are scared of them. Diversity- Diversity is almost non-existent. College Readiness- I do not know a single person that wasn\'t prepared for the course load college they attended.']

column2: ['I like how rigorous the academics at this school are and how well it prepares you for college. It would be much better though if the school had a gym and more variety of courses.', 'Baccalaureate is a school that helped me discover my identity as an individual. In such a small yet tight community, I learn how to be friendly or at least on good terms with others. I know that the staff and teachers will provide the resources and help for my success.', 'Baccalaureate School for Global Education is a great school for those focused primarily on academics. Students are very intelligent and have great grades. Teachers give tons of work and lots of the students life revolves around school. However, this is good because it adequately prepares students for what is to come during college. Peter Willson, the college advisor, hosts a summer program after junior year which excellently readies students for the college process in senior year. In accordance to school culture, there are often dances every couple months held in the lunch room which are a good stress reliever from all the work. In addition, the school is somewhat diverse with most kids being asian, some white and or hispanic and very few African American students. One negative about the school is that there are few sports programs that students can attend because the school is very small (about 500 students).', 'Excellent school that prepares you well for college. Great teachers with high expectations. Excellent college counselor. Highly recommend.', 'As an incoming freshman, I had absolutely no idea what to expect. I had never heard of BSGE before, other than from my parents. But how could a 14 year old teenager possibly believe what their parents say. The academic environment was extremely challenging at first. Not only were the people highly competitive, but the material was difficult. It required me to learn a different type of thinking. Unlike other public high schools, BSGE has the IB curriculum, which teaches its students to become critical thinkers, to question everything that comes their way. One thing this school did lack throughout my four years though was the availability of resources. The school building does not have an auditorium or gymnasium, so it is difficult to split activity space among clubs and the sports teams. Additionally, the sports teams that the schools does have receive barely any funding. I also do think the school could have more learning opportunities like research.', 'Teachers are amazing great.very few lucky student who ever get admission there.building is small but resources are great for student.', 'Baccalaureate is a very special environment.  The community is supportive and the teachers and students want you to succeed and thrive.', 'The academic experience at BSGE is beyond extraordinary. I am constantly challenged in all of my classes to be a critical thinker and am continuously supported by my peers and teachers. However, BSGE, due to its lack of funding, cannot provide many extracurricular opportunities that I would like and does not have funds for our own gymnasium.', "Overall, this school provided me with an excellent understanding of the diversity of the world's populations and problems. The teachers and administrators were extremely intelligent and engaged individuals. The only drawback is the lack of resources/facilities such as a gymnasium or outdoor space!", 'Being a student at the Baccalaureate School For Global Education since the 7th grade, I have encountered nothing but positive experiences from my time in the school. Frequently, I found myself speaking to various teachers about their classes and as a result, building strong relationships with my instructors. With about 450 enrolled, class sizes are small thus allowing strong relationships to be nurtured. Furthermore, working towards the International Baccalaureate Diploma, I have learned a set of skills that are truly influential to my further studies in college. Going through rigorous assignments and having an idea of how to conduct extensive research are just two of the various skills that are incubated during an IB students career. Altogether, the rigorous academics and the wonderful social environment are two characteristics that I think make BSGE a phenomenal choice for students who are interested in intellectual growth and preparation for the real world.', "In the Baccalaureate School for Global Education, students are hardly ever given  a break and this might be seen as negative to some but it really helps prepare us, the students, for college and life in general. It does suck that sometimes we can't participate in much clubs (due to the scarcity of them), and aren't given as much time for extracurricular activities due to our IB Diploma Programme, which is the program that all junior and seniors and enrolled in. The school consists of really friendly students and teachers and if you stay on track with your work, chances are that you will excel.", 'The Baccalaureate School for Global Education is a very academically driven school however it lacks resources that could make the school better. While the curriculum itself is meant to be well done, the teachers and implementation of the IB curriculum is not always the best. Furthermore, the work hard culture present at the school can be mentally deteriorating. Nonetheless, the close community atmosphere can be nice.', 'This school helped me prepare for college very well. Courses were tough but made college doable. Wished it was funded more.', 'In terms of education, academic rigor, and college readiness, BSGE is at the top of its league. The teachers are for the most part knowledgeable, dedicated, and passionate about the subjects they teach. The small class sizes make forming personal relationships with your teachers much easier and more rewarding in the long term. It is important to understand that the academic rigor of the IB diploma programme is not to be taken lightly: I found that the school depleted my social life almost entirely over the course of 6 years. But to those that are hard workers and up to the challenge, this school offers everything that you need in order to succeed in college, and later on in life.', 'The motivation teachers have in helping their students succeed while creating a relaxed atmosphere. The aid the school facilitators offer further provide support for the students during stressful times. It is a small school but it allows you to know everyone there, like a little village. All the teachers are friendly and care for your safety as well.', 'The teachers are invested in you so long as you show an interest in their class. This meaning that you hand in all home work assignments on time and participate frequently. There are clubs and sports opportunities that I think anyone can enjoy. The classes are great, but they get better once you start IB in the eleventh grade.', "This is my first year at BSGE, and it's been great so far. I hope that the next few years will be even better!", "I like the closeness that the entire staff and student body feel towards one another. Some might see the school's small size as a disadvantage, but I see it as a way to make it all the more personal. With these bonds between students and teachers, the classroom experience is way more enjoyable, and the students' ability to learn is not hindered by apprehension of the teacher.", 'My overall experience with Baccalaureate School for Global Education was great. One thing that does suck about attending BSGE was how small the school really is. However, small schools come with benefits. As I am going off to college soon, coming from a small, tight-knit, and diverse high school really helped set an example for what I expect to continue throughout my college experience.', 'This school prepared me very well for the academic rigor of the outside world. One on one attention from faculty has proven to help foster a community that cares for each other.']

column6: ['The people are pretty bland as everyone is focused on their schoolwork. The teachers are a mixed bag. The extra curricular activities are pretty awful as the school receives almost no funding. Also, there is no gymnasium so we have PE in a park a couple blocks away.', 'BSGE did a great job preparing me for higher education as I was well equipped with the skills needed to succeed and thrive in a college setting. The academic coursework at the school was rigorous and forced students to work hard.  The facilities offered at the school are quite poor, which slightly diminished the high school experience.', 'Personally, I love the competitive nature of the school where the staff is not only pushing the students to succeed but make themselves extremely available during assignments that we do not understand. I find it important to see that the students and faculty have such a personal relationship because it enhances how much we are able to learn and grow as students, rather than just taking endless tests for grades. The only drawback that I have personally is the grade that I have had, for there is an overly competitive nature with a lot of drama unfolding. Especially within a small school, this drama gets out rather quickly and people tend to have a tough time balancing school with social life.', 'Facilities and school culture were severely lacking despite the excellent quality of the academics. This school suffered from inadequate funding and a very bad building without a gymnasium and other essential facilities.', 'The Baccalaureate School for Global Education takes in well-rounded individuals and turns them into so much more than that. Through discussion-based classes and an incredibly welcoming environment, students are taught how to think and analyze the world around them rather than focusing on test-taking. Though it lacks in clubs, activities, and sports, it makes up for it in spirit and student involvement. There is an incredible focus on helping the world around us and the teachers spend so much time with the students they become family just as the students do.', 'The Baccalaureate School for Global Education is an incredible school for high achieving middle school and high school students in New York City. The small student body creates a tight-knit community where students can always feel at ease. Students can easily form close relationships with their teachers and peers. Although the Pre-IB and IB courses at the school are very rigorous, help from teachers allow for a smooth academic transition.  At BSGE, students quickly become well-rounded and mature individuals both inside and outside the classroom.', 'I think that Baccalaureate School for Global Education is overall a great school. I think that it does have a very family-like environment, but there is a lot of pressure within the school, with deadlines often back to back. Another thing that BSGE could improve in is informing parents of changes in schedules. A group of students in my senior class was pulled from their classes due to complications in their schedules, which was unacceptable. However, the teachers are incredible.', 'At the Baccalaureate School for Global Education, I really enjoy how the work that the teachers assign the students is not "busy work", in fact, the work that the teachers assign allows students to think outside the box and the challenging problems allow students to be prepared for the real world after school.  The in-class discussions that go on in the classroom allow us to take in different points of views that can alter or help one\'s argument.  The Baccalaureate School helps us develop into great thinkers and learners because of the vigorous IB program.  One thing I would like for our school to have is a gym.  We do lack having great school spirit.  We cannot display the love we have for particular sports because we do not have a gym. The fact that we do not even have a baseball team or any competitive sports teams is something the school definitely lacks.', 'Amazing school. I just graduated and I now see how much the school has helped me mature as a person. It has been a challenging, enlightening and fullfilling journey.', 'Great students, great teachers, great atmosphere. I love going to BSGE because of the at-home feeling of the small intimate school.', "Baccalaureate School for Global Education delves into deeper levels of education that not only readies us for standardized tests, but builds students' intellect. Teachers and faculty make our education their first priority, teaching us how to be critical thinkers, inquirers, and well-rounded students.", 'BSGE is a small school of fewer than 600 students, and that is what makes BSGE such a good school. The IB diploma program is extremely rigorous, leaving BSGE students with an advantage of already doing College-level work, or even higher. On the downside, however, many of the teachers at BSGE are new, some even with no experience in IB level classes. This has been a downfall for especially students graduating in 2018 as many of their teachers, of whom they may have been betting on for a recommendation, are new, and ultimately have no time to get to know the teacher before applying to colleges. As well as this, being in a small school means that there are limited facilities within the school. What BSGE has- instead of a gym or auditorium- is what students call the "Gym-cafeter-ium" where students are often given announcements, can also play indoor soccer, and practice for the various varsity teams inside of the cafeteria.', 'The school is absolutely amazing! It is in close proximity to my house, and I have amazing friends there. The day passes by so quickly, its so much fun in this school and I enjoy every single day there.', "I love the tight-knit feel of the school, the workload is tough but it's full of people who will get you through those long sleepless nights.", 'BSGE has a great environment with teachers constantly willing to help with educational and personal issues. There is sometimes lots of work and the stress from that can be heavy. However, the social environment is amazing.', "It's a good school, the education and work load prepares you for college. You have to develop a good work ethic and manage your time efficiently. But, you have to also make sure you want to take IB curriculum before coming here. Small, but they make it work.", 'I love the environment and culture in my school. The academics are great, and you get a wonderful and valuable education without the hassle or competition of a super large school. However, there are definitely changes being made that are causing the school to shift to a more conventional style of schooling, and while some of these changes are positive (ex. the introduction of a physics department, installing wall pads in our cafeteria which quite unfortunately doubles as a "gymnasium", etc.) a lot of them have kind of taken away what makes BSGE special and charming. The new teachers we\'ve hired go against the very ideals of our school, bringing a much more hostile and competitive environment to our family-oriented climate. If I had been filling out this review a couple years earlier, I think my input would have been far more positive. I love this school and the way it\'s shaped me, but I feel like it\'s in the beginning stages of eroding.', "BSGE is a school that can be greatly appreciated in retrospect as the workload does interfere with one's life. However, if managed well, which rarely is the case, it can be enjoyed and the life of a student here can be somewhat admired. I am happy that I get to be part of such an academically, challenged environment but am upset that it has to  take priority over the rest of my life.--", 'Overall great school but needs to expand its horizons beyond just intensive studies in hummanities and Liberal Arts.', 'Overall, this school is great with its challenging and competitive work environment, and homework loads that ranges from too much to an ok amount. There are also an ok amount of clubs but not too many, especially when it comes to the sports.']
