The academics are great, and you get a wonderful and valuable education without the hassle or competition of a super large school. However, there are definitely changes being made that are causing the school to shift to a more conventional style of schooling, and while some of these changes are positive (ex. the introduction of a physics department, installing wall pads in our cafeteria which quite unfortunately doubles as a "gymnasium", etc.) a lot of them have kind of taken away what makes BSGE special and charming. The new teachers we\'ve hired go against the very ideals of our school, bringing a much more hostile and competitive environment to our family-oriented climate. If I had been filling out this review a couple years earlier, I think my input would have been far more positive. I love this school and the way it\'s shaped me, but I feel like it\'s in the beginning stages of eroding.', "BSGE is a school that can be greatly appreciated in retrospect as the workload does interfere with one's life. However, if managed well, which rarely is the case, it can be enjoyed and the life of a student here can be somewhat admired. I am happy that I get to be part of such an academically, challenged environment but am upset that it has to  take priority over the rest of my life.--", 'Overall great school but needs to expand its horizons beyond just intensive studies in hummanities and Liberal Arts.', 'Overall, this school is great with its challenging and competitive work environment, and homework loads that ranges from too much to an ok amount. There are also an ok amount of clubs but not too many, especially when it comes to the sports.']

column2: ['Teachers are always there to help, and the school gives many amazing resources for both parents and students. Very wealthy and students may gather in cliques.', 'I really enjoyed the great teachers as well as the great sports teams. I am playing tennis on varsity for the 4th year now. I really like how many teachers encourage students to pursue their goals.', 'My experience is generally good.  However, the school lacks diversity and the teachers, facilities and food are not as good as what I would expect from a school in an upscale neighborhood.', 'It is a great school, very challenging and offers a lot of electives. The teachers are knowledgeable and the school offers great opportunities.', 'Provided a lot of support and resources. Very good academics and extracurriculars. Wished there was more diversity.', 'Love!! One of the best public schools in the country. Amazing environment to be in and always positive. Never wanted to leave after school and always came back every day excited to learn and meet new people.', 'I like that the school system itself is very highly acclaimed. People come from many places to Great Neck simply so that their children can achieve greatness through an excellent pubic school system. The sheer knowledge that I have personally gathered throughout my high school career will hopefully allow me succeed in the future.', 'My experience at North High school was unique as I had 2 different principles. The teachers at our school motivate us to do better. I also enjoy that we can go out during lunch and relax outside on nice days. Overall, north has made me a better student, and overtime, I’ve been more diligent with work and held myself at a high standard.', 'I love my high school since it has so many different classes and electives that you can take. One of my favorites is orchestra since we have one of the best orchestra/band teachers in the country. In addition, my high school has tons of clubs and sports teams that will satisfy any student’s needs when it comes to extracurricular activities. Also, when it comes to safety, my school is on point because we practice many drills and we make sure that we would be safe if a certain situation were to happen. Lastly, the teachers in my school are excellent and I only have complaints about only a few out of the hundreds at the school. In conclusion, I think my high school is absolutely excellent and that it gives an experience like no other.', 'Great Neck North is a great thriving school full of ambitious students. I enjoy going to school every day. The teachers are helpful and  facility strive to create a good learning environment. The athletics are very bad but everything else makes up for it. The school is open campus during lunch and we are allowed to leave. Although some think  this would make it unsafe, the school never has problems with open campus.', 'Great Neck North is a great high school overall, and one of th best in the country. The best quality of the school is without a doubt the wonderful teachers who prepare you so well for college, along with the academic rigor of the classes. They truly want to see you aucceed and there are so many resources available at your fingertips to help you advance your knowledge. On the other hand, the culture of the school could be better, student-wise. There are a lot of problems among the student life being that Persians dominate the school, and there are issues with things such as dangerous car driving since the school is located in a wealthy town. But overall, the school is wonderful and I wouldn’t have wanted to learn anywhere else.', 'I had the best high school experience here. I loved my teachers and felt aced calls challenged. I enjoyed the various clubs and after school activities. I cherish my relationships with teachers who helped me grow socially and acedmically. I appriceate all their support and encouragement as I navigated my high school career.', "I have absolutely loved attending North! The teachers that work here are almost all above-par and excellent at not only teaching but being people who you can talk to about personal issues (the majority of them at least). The community here, while lacking in diversity, is open to those who personalize their experience and time at North. In addition, the clubs, activities, and sports offered are expansive and give everyone the opportunity to explore their true passions (if you don't find the club you want, make a new one). Personally, the grade culture was very united so that everyone, no matter if you were a nerd or a jock, communicated and interacted. But if you ever feel lost in your grade's culture, you can still find new homes in the clubs, activities, and sports you participate in. Finally, North supplies its students with SO many resources, from iPads to helpful guidance counselors. Created by the students, North is truly a special place- treasure the time you spend here.", 'Great opportunities, some teachers are terrible, but the majority are trying to help you score your best and grow.', 'As a younger student, my parents chose to move the family to the Great Neck school district to ensure a better education. North High is the culmination of this choice, one I can now say was definitively for the better. Though resources are excellent, and activities are very diverse, the high point of the school is the faculty, who (mostly) strive for a complete education for their students, especially those who reciprocate. North offers students multiple options, from education rigor to subjects of electives, to club offerings, and a relatively sane administration and PTA ensure that the school is heading in an even better direction for the future. For me, North is more than I could expect in a high school education—and one that helped me cash in my "million-dollar check" of potential.', 'The teachers are invested in the success of each and every student! They are always willing to provide extra help before and after school.', 'Great Neck North High School is a melting pot of cultures.  There are people from all corners of this world enrolled in this high school.  This diversity truly makes Great Neck North High School a wonderful place.  The academic standards at this school are superb as students are pushed to their intellectual limits every passing school day.  The staff here is excellent as they are friendly and willing to help others in need.', 'I love that Great Neck North has amazing teachers who do anything and everything in their power to make sure their students succeed. I would love to see our student body be more united as classes and as a school as a whole.', 'There are incredible resources at your disposal. Great Neck North High is an overall fantastic school! Classes are rigorous and prepare you well for future endeavors. Go Blazers!!!', 'Many opportunities to explore, such as the wide variety of clubs and sports offered. If you can not find a club that fits you, then you have the ability to create it. Also, teachers are really helpful and prepares you for college and life.']

column6: ['Teachers are great with new ones being hired every year but it is a little lacking in terms of the food and with the recent change in administration there are a few changes, like the one to alumni day, that have left most unhappy.', "Serious corruption, what administrators care about is how they look, they don't care at all about the students. They often scream at and curse at the students, as do the evil people in the library. The administrators do lots of things that are not kosher", "Overall, I really love Great Neck North in the sense that I have access to so many opportunities in the world of academia as well as extracurriculars such as science research and sports. However, there are times where I feel as though my high school experience would be richer if I were to go to another school. For instance, there is a lack of opportunities for demonstrating school spirit. While we have pep rallies, spirit week, and battle, we don't have fundamental events like school dances or widely-advertised sports games. Even the homecoming didn't have a dance or a football team. Even so, I consider myself lucky to be attending this school, because of the opportunities I have been given and the experiences I have been exposed to in the world of academia, such as a great science program and extensive AP preparation.", 'john l miller great neck north high school is great - i really love the school. the teachers are great, the education level is one of the highest in the country. the town it is located in is beautiful and the people are kind and friendly.', 'I loved how focused everyone at North was.  People really aimed to succeed, and that ultimately helped me a lot in my education.  Nevertheless, I wish there had been a stronger connection with my guidance counselor when it came to picking classes.', 'My experience here was amazing. I enjoyed my three years at this high school and am looking forward to my fourth year as a senior. The school is very caring, and the teachers can range from very good and excellent to sometimes outright terrible, however overall the staff here in the school is amazing. There is little to no bullying at this school and have yet to meet anyone who has been bullied in this school, all the students here are very nice and kind and I truly love this school.', 'I enjoyed the school spirit when it came to football and basketball games yet I wish that other sports could have received the same attention. I also loved the various AP and Honors choices and how teachers pushed students to attempt those classes. I do wish that there would have been more promotion towards diversity and parent involvement.', 'Great Neck North is a wonderful school for the person who likes to be around friendly people. Most staff is kind and understanding of how students are in Great Neck.', "Great Neck North High has some solid teachers, as well as lots of clubs and events you can participate in. The administration is ok, but the principal, who was once great and known for his creation of an alternate community school for self-motivated learners is too old and should retire.  If you are a creative type and interested in theater or music or art it's a great school. The science dept is adequate and the math dept is weak. Also a good place for special education.", 'Honestly I loved my high school. We were all one big family. I loved our school spirit. It gave our school a great atmosphere. The education here was also amazing, we had a surplus amount of classes to take besides from the ones required. I had so much fun playing sports and learning here. It was a very friendly place. I think that all the teachers here are very devoted to their jobs.', 'There is something to do everyday, if its either a club, sport, or activity. A lot of people go to the cafeteria to hang out.', 'Some teachers are not great, but majority of them are good. Some teaching styles are effective, while some are not. Teachers have a lot of knowledge.', 'Not a lot of bullying happens. Should have more security guards that are armed. Should tighten up on special security measures, even though there was never any incident. School nurse is good.', 'Teachers are great. Curriculum is good. Workload is semi-heavy, depends if you take AP classes.', 'great neck north does anything give give their students an opportunity to excell in what they have a pssion for', 'The teachers truly want the students to succeed. There are a lot of resources to take advantage of. We even have an open campus policy so that students can walk into town and eat at the restaurants. The actual school is great, but the environment set up by the students is not healthy. There are a lot of shallow and judgmental people', 'Some students in class fool around a lot and try to make the teacher frustrated, but overall the teachers in the school teach well.', 'Teachers were amazing. My friends were amazing. Schedule was great. Great system. However there are some issues with the way things run and the behaviors of some professors.', 'definitely wouldnt change schools if i had the chance', 'not the best food, but you can always leave campus for lunch']

column2: ['The UCTech environment is competitive and driven. They offer a substantial amount of actual college classes correlated with Rutgers where we can earn college credits. This is mainly in the Clinical Care and Exercise Physiology academies. These academies take classes like; medical terminology, anatomy and physiology 1&2, scientific priniples of nutrition, intro to physical therapy, dyanmics of healthcare, intro to pharmacology, and much more.  School of Design, Sustainable Science, and Teaching Education Academies all go to Kean University their senior year of high school. The Law and Justice academy is also very challenging in which they take AP psychology, AP government, crime scene investigation, intro to the criminal justice system, criminal law and procedure, and more. Students in some of the academies have the opportunity to go on an internship their senior year too. UCTech challenges students academically and prepares them so well for college, like no other high school does.', "This high school is a very unique experience. The work load is intense and the skills you will learn are invaluable. It's wonderful to be in such a close-knit community on this campus. The dual-enrollment program is difficult socially, but this high school prepares you for college well beyond the average student.", 'It is a great experience. They push their students to the limit through academics and extracurricular activities. For example, all students enter taking honors their whole time there. Multiple AP classes are offered and students are able to choose what vocation they want to major in and they receive specific experience and certifications from that specific career. There are even certain academies in which students attend Kean University their senior year, free of cost. They receive 30 college credits and they can get ahead on their college career. Without UCTECH, I would not be where I am today.', "Honestly, if I didn't have my friends with me at this school I would suffer. The workload is lighter than the workload at other schools, but the overall material and curriculum is still pretty difficult. However, I do love the teachers at this school, as I've found them to be more laid-back and easier to talk to than the teachers I've had at other schools. I just wish there was more involvement and encouragement of extracurriculars like sports and music & arts.", 'Education is great and is a very safe place to be. Students are very focused and facilty is very helpfull in all all situations.', "Theres no sports, the education was alright but depending on your course don't get any electives, and can't take advanced courses.", 'I attend the Academy for Information Technology at Union County Vocational Technical School. It is a wonderful place to have spent my high school years. It is a difficult school, but the students, teachers and administration are always supportive and willing to lend a helping hand.', "I feel like I have gained an education from this school that I would not have received in any other. However, having such an academically rigorous school has set me back in other activities. I would like to see a system implemented where the administration keeps the students' personal lives in mind. Many students in our school suffer from mental health issues and our school does not seem to take it into consideration.", 'The five schools on campus are all very connected. You can explore a wide variety of classes at any school and meet new people from all over Union County.', "When I came to UCVTS I was so ready to embrace this new environment. Previously, I had attended elementary and middle school with the same group of people so I was excited to see new faces and be challenged not only socially, but academically as well. Surrounded by the top students in Union County, it's easy to get intimidated, but the teachers make the transition a breeze. Now a senior, I can confidently say coming here was the best decision of my life thus far.", 'It is a good school. I really enjoy being a student there. I have made and I am still making great friends that will last me a lifetime. The education system is very great. I love it here', 'My experience with Union County Vocational Technical High School was one of happiness and great memories. The devotion to education and learning that the faculty and staff had there was so uplifting, making almost every day at school a refreshing experience. The teachers and administrators care so much about the students and they know exactly how to captivate their attention. I’ve made so many memories there as I grew as a student. I made lots of friends and had the time of my life. I’ll never forget it.', "There's a reason why UCVTS is considered to be one of the best school districts in NJ. With its small class sizes, challenging honors curriculum, and amazing faculty/staff, there's no place quite like it. The UCTECH School of Design program has challenged me immensely, and has helped me prepare for a career in the arts. If you're considering any of the schools at UCVTS, I definitely encourage you to go to one of the information sessions to see the campus firsthand. I guarantee that you'll fall in love with it!", 'Amazing honors high school. Amazing but very stressful coursework, teachers, and academies. Very nice, safe, clean, and college-like campus. Everyone is very committed because of the quite low acceptance rate.', "Great, challenging school with a nice environment. Most teachers are able to build amazing relationships with students and always encourage them to work their hardest. I have enjoyed my previous years as a student in this high school. I especially like being able to move around between each building on the campus. However, this school has had it's fair share of problematic teachers and strange curriculum. Overall it is a much better choice than most district high schools.", "What I absolutely loved about this school was the ability to make a choice in your future and stick to that path. I chose to go into the design field and it helped keep me on track to go into the same field in college. Things that I would like to see change are the ways of teaching. Some of the teaching materials and ways are very outdated and don't provide flexibility toward everyone's individual learning ability.", 'other than the principles giving me problems, my school is the most public high school out of the 5 high schools here at UCVTS. its super hard for students that were reading at a 12th grade level in 4th gradethis school made me cry and depressedbut ayygood job im smart ish', 'This school challenges students to do their best, it may not be like a typical high school but it is still a good school.', 'I believe that the rigorous coursework is beneficial towards preparing students for college. Because it is a campus, integration between different schools of engineering, business, medicine, the arts, and more has been an experience of diversity and open-mindedness.', 'UCVTS is a system of five high schools that share a campus and are all in close proximity to each other. It is extremely diverse, and the people you meet are unique and intelligent individuals you can share your "quirks" with. The academic experience is rich and challenging, and a variety of AP classes are offered here. However, the district does not offer sports or the arts (music, visual art, etc.), and these must be done on your own time.']

Previously, I had attended elementary and middle school with the same group of people so I was excited to see new faces and be challenged not only socially, but academically as well. Surrounded by the top students in Union County, it's easy to get intimidated, but the teachers make the transition a breeze. Now a senior, I can confidently say coming here was the best decision of my life thus far.", 'It is a good school. I really enjoy being a student there. I have made and I am still making great friends that will last me a lifetime. The education system is very great. I love it here', 'My experience with Union County Vocational Technical High School was one of happiness and great memories. The devotion to education and learning that the faculty and staff had there was so uplifting, making almost every day at school a refreshing experience. The teachers and administrators care so much about the students and they know exactly how to captivate their attention. I’ve made so many memories there as I grew as a student. I made lots of friends and had the time of my life. I’ll never forget it.', "There's a reason why UCVTS is considered to be one of the best school districts in NJ. With its small class sizes, challenging honors curriculum, and amazing faculty/staff, there's no place quite like it. The UCTECH School of Design program has challenged me immensely, and has helped me prepare for a career in the arts. If you're considering any of the schools at UCVTS, I definitely encourage you to go to one of the information sessions to see the campus firsthand. I guarantee that you'll fall in love with it!", 'Amazing honors high school. Amazing but very stressful coursework, teachers, and academies. Very nice, safe, clean, and college-like campus. Everyone is very committed because of the quite low acceptance rate.', "Great, challenging school with a nice environment. Most teachers are able to build amazing relationships with students and always encourage them to work their hardest. I have enjoyed my previous years as a student in this high school. I especially like being able to move around between each building on the campus. However, this school has had it's fair share of problematic teachers and strange curriculum. Overall it is a much better choice than most district high schools.", "What I absolutely loved about this school was the ability to make a choice in your future and stick to that path. I chose to go into the design field and it helped keep me on track to go into the same field in college. Things that I would like to see change are the ways of teaching. Some of the teaching materials and ways are very outdated and don't provide flexibility toward everyone's individual learning ability.", 'other than the principles giving me problems, my school is the most public high school out of the 5 high schools here at UCVTS. its super hard for students that were reading at a 12th grade level in 4th gradethis school made me cry and depressedbut ayygood job im smart ish', 'This school challenges students to do their best, it may not be like a typical high school but it is still a good school.', 'I believe that the rigorous coursework is beneficial towards preparing students for college. Because it is a campus, integration between different schools of engineering, business, medicine, the arts, and more has been an experience of diversity and open-mindedness.', 'UCVTS is a system of five high schools that share a campus and are all in close proximity to each other. It is extremely diverse, and the people you meet are unique and intelligent individuals you can share your "quirks" with. The academic experience is rich and challenging, and a variety of AP classes are offered here. However, the district does not offer sports or the arts (music, visual art, etc.), and these must be done on your own time.']
column6: ['UCVTS takes a holistic approach to educating with the small class sizes and the consistent mentoring of the students by the principal and counselors.  They encourage the students to pursue opportunities in and outside of the school environment that enriches their academic and community service growth.', 'The Union County Vocational-Technical Schools are among the best high schools across the country. From its superb teachers to its profound resources, from its unique diversity to its beautiful campus, there is really no place like it.', 'UCVTS is a great school that focuses on college preparation. Yet, I would love to see the schools focus on fortifying their respective programs, rather than expanding the school before it is completely built up. Also, the school needs to have more clubs and try to encourage more student involvement, which will in turn help students get in to the college of their choice. Finally, safety needs to become a priority at these schools. It has put on the back burner and has caused some serious issues. Overall, this school is a great option for students.', 'Terrible school full of teachers who actually do not care about the well-being of the students (minus one or two). Extremely stressful and full of faculty who cares more about the rankings of the school and sees every student as a statistic. Would not recommend unless you would like to develop several mental illnesses and have a distaste for learning within a span of four years.', 'Very chill place with cool teachers. You make a lot of friends from different towns in Union County.', "UCVTS is a very diverse campus that prepares it's students for college very well. Unlike other high schools, UCVTS students all take honors level classes and are given the chance to take college-level classes. Most teachers are very helpful, and the resources are pretty plentiful.", 'My school consists of students from towns all over Union County, NJ. I enjoyed that I got to be surrounded by people who appreciated academics like me, but were still of all different religions, cultures, background and more. Union County Vo-Tech promotes diversity very well and being a person of color, I really appreciated that over the past 4 years. The teachers and staff are always there to push you and help you with the end goal of college preparedness. However, some things I did not particilarly like was the lack of sports. We only had intramurals and no sport teams. I think with actual sprots teams, it would have put my school over the top. Without sports teams, I feel like I missed out on a normal high school experience. I never got to go to any football games or homecoming games. I really wish I could have gotten to participate in that.', 'The school is acedemically challenging especially when you may have come from a school where you were the smartest without any effort. Students will learn to study and definitely be stressed out. You’re grade depends on how hard you work.', 'One of the most prestigeous high school with top notch teachers and highly performing students.Teachers are very supportive and knowledgeable. Students are well trained to aim high.', 'I started the first semester of high school in a new program at my school, and in a newly constructed building with new labs. My favorite teacher did move on last year, but the program continues to be very enriching. I highly recommend applying to my school.', 'Great Community.  Great Place to Learn. The environment is a great place to educate a child with a promising future.', "I'd like to see a lot more happening with college readiness, or newer programs, but since I've left the school has really evolved. Every class was on an honors level and I learned a lot!", 'This school/ facility is an awesome environment for students, teachers and parents. It is full of diversity and culture within the student body and faculty. Students come from all towns in Union County and combine together to help one another learn and more!', 'I loved the campus at Union County Votech.  There was much diversity and it built a community that will last generations.  The passion and drive of the students and faculty is unmatched.  It really prepared me for my college experience.', "Apart from the extreme stress that one experiences while here, there isn't a better school that I could have chose. The amount of work is a lot, but I feel more prepared for college than ever before.", 'You are sacrificing a social life for academics. Increasingly competitive school, academic progress is number one in all aspects of this school.', 'I loved the environment of UCTECH. It was very welcoming and the people who worked there were very friendly and supportive of students. It was also a great learning environment that challenged students to be their best selves.', "The teachers are excellent and very helpful so is my guidance counselor. The teachers offer office hours that can easily meet the student's schedule. The one thing I would like to change is the lack of varsity sports and a music program.", "I love this school because it really prepares you for college; from the workload to time management. The faculty and staff are very experienced and make you feel welcomed. The administration is the best because they treat you like you're one of their own children. The entire atmosphere of this school is basically like a home away from home.", 'UCVTS is a place full of difference, diverse people that aim to achieve higher. It is not a place in which people can afford to goof off due to the high academic nature that is present within the community. Straight from freshman year, people aim higher with rigorous courses such as AP Calc BC, AP Physics, etc.']
column8: ['The amount of opportunities that UCVTS has given me is endless. I have to say that I was blessed to go to this school rather than my town\'s high school. This high school has the best resources to help us with our schoolwork and the teachers here have "out of the box" ways of teaching that benefits the students the most. Even though we do not have sports, we have amazing events such as Relay for Life and American Heritage Awareness Day. This is also a great experience because of the diversity. We have people from all over Union County from different towns and I believe that is a reason we strive; making new friends in a new environment.', 'To begin, if you are a student who is already challenged by the regular public school system, do not apply. Certain schools on the campus are easier than others, but the one that I attended, The Academy for Information Technology, was arguably one of the most challenging. Some students had to go sleepless for up to 2.5 days in order to complete their assigned coursework. The school is built to challenge the smartest kids that the county can turn out, so it is not a place for the faint of heart. My junior year, more than half of my entire grade had intense mental breakdowns in the guidance offices. The school gives students the opportunity to learn a lot, but it takes a heavy toll.', "I really like the education. Even if some teachers aren't the best, the classes are all challenging and make you learn. After coming here i went into college feeling more prepared in areas such as math, science, english, and technology than i noticed other students felt. The block scheduling really does prepare you for college because after going to school four years with each class being an hour and 23 minutes, a two hour class in college isn't as bad.", 'It is the best they can tech you somethings you would need for college, medical information and extra curricular subjects/activities.', "Great school district. Too focused on grades, though. It's a very competitive environment and if you're not ready to compete for everything, you'll be having a breakdown daily. Even if you are prepared, you'll probably have a break down once a week. I wish there was a library on campus. Most teachers are great, a couple oddballs in the mix. They can't all be winners I guess.", "I attend the Academy for Performing Arts (within the UCVTS campus). The staff throughout the campus are friendly, approachable and willing to help all students. They make you feel comfortable and at home. The campus, although it's big, feels like a bonded and diverse community. The academic opportunities the school provides is exceptional compared to other high schools. I have made many friends and have several memories that I will never forget and I am glad my parents chose to send me here. My time here has expanded my knowledge in Theatre history, etiquette and performance.", "There is a wide range of teachers. Some couldn't care less and some go above and beyond.", 'There has never been a time that I feel unsafe.', 'There are so many different clubs and organizations at this school. Every year we have a Club Fair where everyone can see all the different clubs and sign up for them.', 'What makes this school unique is that even though we are 5 buildings with completely different interests we come together under one title; UCVTS. All of the separate schools have classes with one another which brings us even more together. Both teachers are students are very supportive of one another. In the spring we have our Day of Silence for the LGBT Community where about 65% percent of the student body participates. We also had a silent protest in the morning before school once because the Board of Education were going to cut several teachers without tenure. Both students and teachers wore Red in support. I overall love my school and the decision to go here was probably one of the best decisions in my life.', 'I love just about every teacher that I have ever had. I am always excited to learn something new and the learning environment is great.', 'There are virtually no activities because this is a county school', 'The teachers here are great', "As a parent of a minority student, I felt a little more effort was needed in exposing them to 'other' colleges, experiences and activities related to minority issues.  I dont feel my children were completely nurtured or valued.", 'they take bullying and our personal safety seriously. Our campus is very safe and few to none incidents happen', 'There are alot but since everyone lives in different towns, they are hard to participate in.', 'Our school is very unique because we have to take a test to get in. This allow students who are very smart and care about their education. It provides a great environment because everyone wants to get the best education possible.', 'My school is the best because they offer so many classes that are gear towards a career. These classes help prepare us towards what job we choose to go to in life. Also, these classes are rigorous and it helps us to more knowledgeable than the average student in New Jersey. These rigorous courses helps us to learn how to study and how to manage our time before we go to college. This will be an advantage when we enter college.', 'There is absolutely no tolerance for bullying at this school, not that this is a problem between students.', 'There are many extracurricular activities available at this school. Some include FBLA, Hosa, and SkillsUSA.']

column1: High School of American Studies at Lehman College
column2: ['Passionate, engaging, interactive teachers. The teachers love what they teach and hence, make an interesting class. They set aside time after school to help those who need help. As a relatively small school, we have great bonds with one another, forming a very close-knit and accepting environment. In summary, it is a school that is genuinely enjoyed and loved by students, faculty, and parents and highly recommended to prospective students.', 'I really enjoyed my years at HSAS. The students were very nice for the most part and for the most part teachers cared about students and worked very hard. But it did seem like some teachers were the absolute best and others were just awful. There was not a lot of guidance through the college process, which could be improved upon with another counselor to help out.', 'The High School of American Studies at Lehman College is one of the specialized schools in New York City (admissions through the SHSAT). It offers a wide range of courses, as well as AP classes. The teachers are amazing, and have been recognized by the New York Times for awards. However, the work load is heavy, and the school includes about 100 students per grade. It is a very small school, but many students are nice, and friendly. Students are also able to use the Lehman Campus facilities, and take college classes.', 'HSAS was the best, but also the worst. It’s a lot of work in a very competitive atmosphere, but the kids are very smart and interesting. Be prepared to have your self perceived level of intelligence shot down, a lot. One complaint Is that there should be some computer coding, hsas kids are learning like luddites.', 'HSAS (as the students call it) is a fairly small and unknown school right across the street from Lehman College.  As a matter of fact, the students from our neighboring school, Bronx Science, ask HSAS students what and where HSAS is, even though the schools are in a three block vicinity of each other.  Though, despite this, HSAS has managed to be ranked the best school in the state on more than one occasion likely because of the school’s small and comforting community and because the students are overachievers. However, this is not to say HSAS lacks any drawbacks.  The most noticeable problem is likely the weak math department; while all the other departments in the school are exceptional, the math department in the school is, oddly enough, average and it shows on student’s regents scores.', 'I liked the sports and clubs that they offered. Teachers were awful for the most part and rude. I’m glad I graduated and never have to go back.', "It is an amazing school! The History and Science departments are very strong; They have amazing teachers, subject matter, and topics. I would say that the math department can be a bit stronger, but it still is amazing nevertheless. Because of the great teachers' efforts, I have done amazingly in all my regents and AP exams.", 'Teachers really challenge you to do your best. This is a great school to go to and the environment is pretty nice.', 'My experience at HSAS was definitely an enriching one. The teachers truly wanted their students to learn. Coming from a background where I was told I would not amount to anything by past teachers, I found strength and encouragement from the faculty. The courses were rigorous but I felt prepared for college. If I could change the school, I would change the demographics. As an under represented minority, I felt out of place. There have been efforts to diversify the student body which I truly hope continue.', 'Great academics, but not the best teachers, and terrible administration. The students are very intellectual and hardworking', 'My son is finishing his senior year at HSAS, and we could not be happier with the  education he has received. More importantly, perhaps, he has fostered good and lasting friendships, and HSAS deserves credit for creating an atmosphere in which strong social bonds thrive. Although this is a highly competitive school in terms of academics, students are not competitive with each other as might be expected. There is very little downside to this school, but the college counseling can be placed in that realm. I think most parents struck out on their own during that "all important" search. We were very careful in our search for an excellent school, particularly because our son had to commute a long way to come to HSAS, but we are very happy that he\'s had the high school experience that he has had here. Highly, highly recommend it!', "High School of American Studies is an excellent school that has helped me so much in the transition from middle school to high school, and has also helped me feel extremely prepared for college.  It's very small, with about 100 students per grade, which can be a great thing because it feels like a family and all of the teachers know you, but can also be a con because it can feel too small at times. There also aren't as many options in regards to AP classes or language classes, but Lehman college offers a lot of college classes that are open to high school students.  Regardless, the kids are very smart and the faculty is very supportive.  I'm very glad I went here!", "Very close knit school with excellent teachers in the history department but subpar quality teachers in the mathematics department. Slightly lacking in clubs. Faculty is excellent overall, and if you try hard you'll do well.", 'I had a great time at the school but I was also lucky in terms of teachers and my ability to handle the workload. Your experience definitely depends on who you get for Math and English soph/junior year. Excellent history teachers, the strongest part of the school. Good science classes, but not for AP. Fairly average/weak math department. English is a mix: half are great teachers, half are terrible, no real middle ground. Also, limited activities/resources due to size, but if you make an effort you form closer relationships with teachers which can help with college. Counselor can be unhelpful (pushes SUNYs and CUNYs very hard) and gives vague advice. Personal experience went well, but many students struggle both with the workload and mental health due to the difficulty/stressfulness and unhelpful teachers/administration.', "I love the community at the High School of American Studies at Lehman College. It's a very small school, and for that reason, most students get to know each other really well. This creates a strong sense of belonging, and I value that a lot. I do wish the school was more diverse, however.", "As a senior, I'm glad I have had the chance to go to this school. This school pushes you to your maximum capability every day and makes you become both a better student and person. Everyone at the school is friendly and a feeling of a community is established. Everyone knows each other and you never feel alone.", 'It was nice to have a small community in which all the students knew each other however it was a very competitive atmosphere. Grades and numbers are definitely emphasized over mental health and resources for those who may suffer from depression/anxiety resulting from the pressure of the school are basically nonexistent.', "I would say that academically it's a mixed bag. The history and english departments at the school are absolutely amazing, and probably the best anywhere in America. Having said that, the science department is a mixed bag. Physics is great, and Chemistry is alright, but the AP class isn't awesome. Moreover, the math department is a joke, and the arts department doesn't exist. Also, the guidance counselor might be the worst person on the face of the planet. I want to be absolutely clear here, HSAS will make the college process a living nightmare. I actually go to professional therapy it was so bad. I would say it ruined my entire high school experience, but there are many positive aspects of the school that shouldn't be forgotten.", "While it is admittedly a small school, the High School of American Studies (HSAS) is a sleeping giant in New York City's secondary public education roster. The competitive nature of enrollment assures that the best and brightest of the City's youthful aspirants receive a place in one of the friendliest and rigorous academic institutions this side of the Pond. Most, if not all, of the teachers are professionals with not only several years of teaching experience under their belts, but also boast MBAs, Ph. Ds, and cumulative decades of experience in high positions in their respective fields (in both the public and private sectors).", "Very bad school. I disliked my time there and I wanted to attend another school either way. If you don't like social studies don't go."]

I disliked my time there and I wanted to attend another school either way. If you don't like social studies don't go."]
column6: ['High School of American studies is one of the few schools that makes you feel like you are home. With a welcoming, supportive family, all students have the resources they need to succeed in life. The history and the english department is exceptional.', "HSAS is an interesting environment full of students who are academically passionate, but can be competitive. The environment sometimes veers on unhealthy because everyone's high standards for themselves can cause negative feelings in others. Also, there is an appalling lack of racial diversity. But overall, the academics are really excellent and everyone is really excited to learn and cares a lot about what they are learning.", 'i learned alot and was thankful that I attended and even though the student body and faculty were small I feel there was a very diverse group of people.', 'this is a large cafeteria which is primarily utilized by the college faculty and students for Lehman College.', "Our principal stands outside the school every morning and greets each student by name. The parents are advised to call the school before classes start on the day of their child's absence so the teachers don't worry that something happened to the student on the way to school.", 'Lehman College is part of the high school campus and we are able to use the facilities of the college which are top notch.', 'once again , since the school has a small enrollment the teachers are able to give us individual attention and really get to know us.', 'This high school has prepared me by having all honors classes or college level classes.The teachers treated us as adults and not high school students.', 'Our principal greets us every single day at the door.', "We don't have our own facilities; we usually use areas in Lehman College or the surrounding fields and parks.", "The teachers are awesome to talk to. They're super cool and understanding.", "It could be better, and there isn't much funding provided because it's a small public school.", "The school is very supportive and the students are very supportive of one another. If you fall (academically or physically) someone will be there to pick you up and help you. Everyone cares a lot about one another and wants for everyone else to succeed. We're not a cutthroat school. No peer pressure, everyone accepts one another for who they are and the school is fairly economically diverse. While different races could be better represented at our school, there are people of different ethnicity at our school. And while the school is mostly liberal, that doesn't mean that everyone is accepting of everything, you will have people who spark conversation and get you to think and learn about what you believe in.", "School is very safe. No concerns regarding the location or the people in school. Everyone is very nice and there isn't any bullying that I've seen (and at a High School, that's rare). Health services are always available and are competent.", "Our school has everything from an environmental club, to a drama club, to a Mock Trail (Champions!) and Moot Court Teams (Also Champions!). It's available to everyone of different interests and there are clubs available for whatever you want to do.", "The school offers many sports and activities to those who want to go out and participate. Basketball, Baseball, Cross Country, Softball, Bowling, Tennis, and more are all offered. The school spirit isn't the best for athletic events, but everyone cares greatly about the school and there are plenty of opportunities to get active and play sports at our school.", "The best ones are amazing, and the worst ones are downright awful. There's a lot of variety. All of the teachers are interesting people, and seem to be very intelligent, but sometimes aren't the best at leading a class or being compassionate with students. The math department is extremely lacking in good teachers.", 'There are plenty of clubs and after school activities to choose from. Most students are in at least one club. They are not as popular as the sports teams, but are still very nice. Some of the best ones are the Environmental Club, Key Club, and Spanish Honors Society.', "Being less than 400 people and a specialized high school in NYC, the High School of American Studies is a very unique place. Each student gets individual attention and can make their academic experience what they want. My only problem was the inflexibility of student's schedules. The administration doesn't really believe in free periods and AP classes are relatively limited. I have had a very positive experience at this school.", "We eat lunch at the Lehman College cafeteria, which has just OK food. The pizza is pretty bad. The burritos are OK. The Chinese food is OK. The salads and sandwiches are pretty good. It's also not that well-priced. A lot of kids buy food from the Mexican food truck outside the Lehman College campus or the halal cart down the block. The cafeteria is nice and warm in the winter but it can get pretty loud."]
column8: ['High School of American studies is one of the few schools that makes you feel like you are home. With a welcoming, supportive family, all students have the resources they need to succeed in life. The history and the english department is exceptional.', "HSAS is an interesting environment full of students who are academically passionate, but can be competitive. The environment sometimes veers on unhealthy because everyone's high standards for themselves can cause negative feelings in others. Also, there is an appalling lack of racial diversity. But overall, the academics are really excellent and everyone is really excited to learn and cares a lot about what they are learning.", 'i learned alot and was thankful that I attended and even though the student body and faculty were small I feel there was a very diverse group of people.', 'this is a large cafeteria which is primarily utilized by the college faculty and students for Lehman College.', "Our principal stands outside the school every morning and greets each student by name. The parents are advised to call the school before classes start on the day of their child's absence so the teachers don't worry that something happened to the student on the way to school.", 'Lehman College is part of the high school campus and we are able to use the facilities of the college which are top notch.', 'once again , since the school has a small enrollment the teachers are able to give us individual attention and really get to know us.', 'This high school has prepared me by having all honors classes or college level classes.The teachers treated us as adults and not high school students.', 'Our principal greets us every single day at the door.', "We don't have our own facilities; we usually use areas in Lehman College or the surrounding fields and parks.", "The teachers are awesome to talk to. They're super cool and understanding.", "It could be better, and there isn't much funding provided because it's a small public school.", "The school is very supportive and the students are very supportive of one another. If you fall (academically or physically) someone will be there to pick you up and help you. Everyone cares a lot about one another and wants for everyone else to succeed. We're not a cutthroat school. No peer pressure, everyone accepts one another for who they are and the school is fairly economically diverse. While different races could be better represented at our school, there are people of different ethnicity at our school. And while the school is mostly liberal, that doesn't mean that everyone is accepting of everything, you will have people who spark conversation and get you to think and learn about what you believe in.", "School is very safe. No concerns regarding the location or the people in school. Everyone is very nice and there isn't any bullying that I've seen (and at a High School, that's rare). Health services are always available and are competent.", "Our school has everything from an environmental club, to a drama club, to a Mock Trail (Champions!) and Moot Court Teams (Also Champions!). It's available to everyone of different interests and there are clubs available for whatever you want to do.", "The school offers many sports and activities to those who want to go out and participate. Basketball, Baseball, Cross Country, Softball, Bowling, Tennis, and more are all offered. The school spirit isn't the best for athletic events, but everyone cares greatly about the school and there are plenty of opportunities to get active and play sports at our school.", "The best ones are amazing, and the worst ones are downright awful. There's a lot of variety. All of the teachers are interesting people, and seem to be very intelligent, but sometimes aren't the best at leading a class or being compassionate with students. The math department is extremely lacking in good teachers.", 'There are plenty of clubs and after school activities to choose from. Most students are in at least one club. They are not as popular as the sports teams, but are still very nice. Some of the best ones are the Environmental Club, Key Club, and Spanish Honors Society.', "Being less than 400 people and a specialized high school in NYC, the High School of American Studies is a very unique place. Each student gets individual attention and can make their academic experience what they want. My only problem was the inflexibility of student's schedules. The administration doesn't really believe in free periods and AP classes are relatively limited. I have had a very positive experience at this school.", "We eat lunch at the Lehman College cafeteria, which has just OK food. The pizza is pretty bad. The burritos are OK. The Chinese food is OK. The salads and sandwiches are pretty good. It's also not that well-priced. A lot of kids buy food from the Mexican food truck outside the Lehman College campus or the halal cart down the block. The cafeteria is nice and warm in the winter but it can get pretty loud."]

column1: Bard High School Early College Queens
column2: ["Some of the teachers don't really care about your well being or just how you are doing in the class. You would rarely find or have a teacher whom would actually care enough about you to give you advice or suggestions to raise up your grade. I understand this is an early college, but we are still high school students and Bard just overworks us to the point where we barely have lives outside school. Most of the teachers are also pretty stuck up. It is nice that they come from IVY league schools, but that doesn't mean they can teach and I don't think bard gets that. On my interview, my interviewer starts flexing over the number of teachers that came from Harvard, Yale, etc. but honestly, all I could think about is whether they can teach. Some teachers depend on you to teach yourself but then what is the point of going t school when I can just stay home and teach myself. Also, everyone who goes there knows the math department sucks, and it only started getting diverse in 2017-2019.", 'I am a senior at Bard and I received an amazing education. All of my teachers have been very approachable. My courses have been rigorous and I feel prepared for college. The student body is diverse and and makes everyone feel welcome.', 'Bard is honestly a unique high school. The faculty is amazing especially the math department, but like every High school some teachers are honestly terrible. The school talks about diversity but there’s barely any. Most students are racist and entitled and think they’re better. But there are good support systems and if you make real friends it’ll be great. Science department is great and there is a huge variety of classes offered. Best part is the ability to choose your schedule in Year 1 and Year 2 (junior and senior year).', 'Bard High School Early College Queens allows students to have access to college classes and graduate with both a high school diploma and an associates degree (A.A).', 'Although the curriculum is rigorous, most classes are small and discussion based making it easier to have a good relationship with your teachers. Entire staff and students are extremely welcoming and accepting. Bard has felt more like a home to me than a school.', 'Teachers and community is the ideal learning environment. Very liberal and diverse school with a lot of variety in classes related to real life. Students graduate with an associates degree.', 'It was a good experience and really beneficial because I was able to graduate with a associates degree and many college credits that can now be transferred at my next college. It saves me a lot of time and money and I learned how to be a college prepared in high school.', "I like that BHSECQ has a very diverse population. In the short time I have attended, I've been lucky enough to meet people from all different types of backgrounds and cultures. The school goes out of its way to involve all student from these backgrounds. There is a variety of clubs at BHSECQ that serve academically, emotionally, and spiritually.  It's also great because students who spend 4 years here graduate with 60 college credits and an associates degree.", 'Great school and generally small school, few students but all work at a very fast pace. Getting extremely better with diversity and involvement in sports.', 'I really liked the diversity at Bard and how nice and helpful the staff were. The staff had constant availability. A lot of the education I learned I found it to be harder than most of the things I learned in college. I took volleyball and besides not having a gym it was a great team, and it was really welcoming.', 'amazing teachers. hardworking students. good looking people. i like it. i like it a lot. i like it very much. you should like it very much...because i like it very much.', "I honestly owe everything to Bard. I'm a current senior here, and I'm graduating in ~ three weeks. This place is truly somewhere to flourish academically and socially. The friendships and teacher relationships that I've made were all meaningful, as the Bard community has a special essence and the professors are all absolutely amazing! The professors care tremendously about their own work and their student's work. The small school atmosphere has especially added to my experience!", 'I love Bard because of the diversity and the college program that it offers! THE college program really helps low-income families support their children to get a college education. However, I think that Bard could work on their school safety. By that, I mean that when a problem is presented they should take action instead of just pointing out that we have a problem and that when the solution is in place it should be known to the students and parents.', 'The teachers are great and genuinely care about their students. The school is such an accepting place, has a lot of diversity, and very welcoming. The workload can be overwhelming, however, as long as you manage your time, it isn’t as bad.', 'Bard High School Early College Queens (BHSEC) is a wonderful place for children devoted to learning, thinking, and expanding their knowledge. The transition from middle school to this school will be tough being that the curriculum is extremely rigorous and accelerated. The first two years students will be in 9th and 10th grade like other highschoolers. Once they get to their junior year, students start their first year of full college courses. Instead of 11th and 12th grade it becomes Year 1 and Year 2 of college, eventually graduating with an Associates Degree in Liberal Arts in addition to the High School Diploma.', 'I feel at home here. A better, more stimulating, more mature school culture than anywhere else in New York.', "I went to middle school at Success Academy and got into Brooklyn Tech, but came to BHSECQ - I'm glad. The facilities are awesome and well-kept. The classes are really rigorous; all teachers know their stuff. Many will go out of their way to support their students and ensure students are performing well. However, even for outgoing people like me, some teachers seem intimidating and hard to get along with. All teachers care about their students but do definitely have favoritism and value communication with students. Relative to other top schools city-wide, cultural appreciation and diversity are strong. Clubs meet once a week or every other week - disappointing since in middle school extracurriculars were an hour daily. The clubs are cool but could be better. The homework load and stress remains a challenge, but if you don't procrastinate, it's okay. If you make the most out of the resources you're given (and make friends with upperclassmen!), then you will gain a lot from BHSECQ.", 'If you’re thinking about going here, you shouldn’t have to, because it’s a great school. The academics are great; don’t let the fact that it’s a humanities school scare you, because there’s a great STEM program offered too. It’s a small school (only about 600 students), so if you’re a student athlete, Bard probably isn’t the place for you to further your athletic talent; our sport teams are mediocre at best. The college program is great; they all say that it gets harder once you’re in the college program, but I think it’s the opposite. You get a ton of frees and the work load is manageable. The only downside I can think of is that the administration doesn’t fire teachers, even if they’re awful at their job. All schools have “those teachers” though, and while it sucks, I guess you can’t really avoid it no matter what school you go to.', 'Bard Queens stretched me academically to explore topics I had never learned about before in an engaging, thought-provoking environment that encouraged student discussion and seminar style teaching. The humanities program at BHSECQ is extremely good with amazing professors who are passionate about their classes. Science classes are also very strong at BHSECQ. They teach material that goes beyond what is taught in typical AP and IB classes at other NYC high schools. In addition, the Associates Degree received from Bard College is incredibly useful and can be transferred at your next institution. Despite the rigorous academic environment at Bard, the community is very close knit, encouraging strong relationships between professors and students as well as student to student. BHSECQ is overall a very inclusive, nurturing institution that will teach you life skills and give you many connections.', 'I’m currently in 10th grade and so far, Bard has been a great experience. It’s both a challenging and supportive environment and I love it.']

column6: ['Transferred into this school for more of an academic challenge and was not disappointed! The quality of education is unlike any other, and the people are super nice and supportive!', "I was able to read great and difficult works of literature every day in this school under the guidance of professors who truly cared about their student's education. The ideas discussed in our seminars have always stuck with me because it gave me a foundation of understanding how one topic can bring about multiple points of views.", 'The professors here are amaizng. They are always supportive and understanding of the work load students get and factor that into their own class assignment due dates. Tons of resources for students and teachers are genuinely passionate and educated in the field they teach.', 'I love how challenging yet managable the classes are, the faculty genuinely care about what they teach and the students whom they teach both inside and outside of the classroom, and overall Bard does its best to produce students who are in a very intuitive and analytical mindset. I wish there was a wider variety of languages and perhaps a psychology class!', 'The diversity is pretty amazing and the teachers really do care about their students passing.  There are many cliques but students are welcoming. It’s very helpful to low income families.', 'This high school has a great class environment with many amazing teachers who really get to know each individual and do everything they can to help you succeed.', 'One good thing is that its very diverse and the classrooms are fairly small. The only thing i would change is to make it less rigorous.', 'Academics, teachers,community feeling where everyone succeeds together, the diversity and the way Bard truly prepares the students for college.', 'Bard High School is a very diverse school where the students get their voices heard. The professors actually care about your success and they will do everything in their power to push you to succeed. There were always help available whenever needed. Some of current college professors struggle to teach properly compared to my high school professors. Most professors, at Bard, have PHDs from some of the top universities in the world.', 'I was able to make really good relationships with teachers, and feel more than prepared to attend my future college.', 'Amazing academic environment with dedicated teachers and engaging classes. The associates degree allows for a head start on any college student and allows for a wide variety of classes to be offered.', 'I think There should be more diversity. Yes there are a lot of cultures present but there are a significant amount of Caucasians and Asians but very few Hispanics and African Americans. On the other hand the schools teacher are really good for the most part and the school tries to make everyone happy which I appreciate', 'It was a great space to express yourself, be yourself, and learn things about the world around you. It was the best place to think.', 'One of the things that makes Bard unique is the level of support students have for each other. Bard has a mixture of very academically strong students and non-competitiveness that I think is incredibly unique for such a strong school. I never feel afraid to ask a "stupid" question, teachers are more than willing to help you with anything from homework to answering questions about exams or projects, and resources like peer tutoring provide in credible support systems. Aside to academic support, the guidance counselor office is also great for support; they will listen to your problems and really take the time to talk through with you so that you never feel like they want you out of their office. I also love the discussion seminar based classes that not only include history and english but also appear in math and science classes. Peers are often encouraged to work with each other and share ideas, which really builds strong communication and skills at future institutions.', 'Bard High School Early College Queens is the best place I could ever imagine spending my high school years. Every member of the faculty is incredibly involved in the wellbeing of the students, and have helped me achieve everything I set out to do. the environment is welcoming and the students are diverse, creating a space that is safe and inviting for anyone and everyone.', 'Bard is a really good place for a student who is determined and willing to put in the extra effort to achieve an Associates degree at the end of their high school career. The teachers in this school are absolutely amazing, they are willing to help student out whenever they have time. It is really easy to take to them!', "Bard High School Early College Queens is an amazing environment to learn and find yourself. The curriculum can be hard at times, but it's not something you can't overcome, especially with the amazing teachers here in your corner. Whether you like it or not, Bard High School Early College Queens is that big loud family that will always support you, and when you leave, you will often find yourself coming back to visit.", "BHSECQ is a liberal arts high school in New York City best known for it's two year college program. Students graduate with 60 credits and an Associates degree which is accepted by most colleges. The environment encourages free thought and open mindedness in both the classroom and social circles. The faculty is always willing to support students and are required to offer office hours for their classes. Additionally, the CTO is incredibly helpful and definitely prepares students for the college application process and beyond. However, the administration often fails to keep faculty, staff, and students in the loop about school programs and important disciplinary issues. Though the student body is diverse, the faculty lacks Professors of color.  In terms of academics, in order to do well, students must put a lot of time and effort into their studies.  I highly recommend attending the school if you are hard working and willing to be an advocate for your student community.", "Looking back as a graduating Year 2, I am really thankful for all the opportunities Bard has given me. If it wasn't for Bard, I would not have obtained the amount of opportunities, resources and guidance that I did because of my family's financial situation. Bard opened the doors for me to have a shot at a good college education and preparing me very well for it. The workload can definitely get tough at times, but at the end of the day, this is so that we are prepared to handle anything that comes our way once we transfer to our next college. Something I would like to see some improvement on, however, would be in checking up with students more often. The workload we get at Bard definitely prepares us for life after high school/early college, but it can also be incredibly stressing at times. Having an advisory where we meet every week definitely helps, but perhaps also checking up on students individually here and there may help a bit. Other than that I love Bard the way it is.", "As a middle school student searching for my next institution four years ago, I was attracted to the early college aspect of Bard Queens. This school provides a $120,000 Associates Degree upon graduation for no cost. In addition, the rigor of the academia cannot be compared to any school in the city. There are very little places where students can take anthropology and calculus III courses. Furthermore, professors are incredibly knowledgeable in their fields of study. Despite their doctorate degrees, professors are down to earth and sweet. They're always there to help with assignments and explain difficult concepts. However, the close knit community is what defines Bard's identity. It is inclusive of all regardless of race, financial background, sexuality, etc. The school encourages students to break away from social conventions and stereotypes. Bard isn't a school. It is a home."]
