This school provides a $120,000 Associates Degree upon graduation for no cost. In addition, the rigor of the academia cannot be compared to any school in the city. There are very little places where students can take anthropology and calculus III courses. Furthermore, professors are incredibly knowledgeable in their fields of study. Despite their doctorate degrees, professors are down to earth and sweet. They're always there to help with assignments and explain difficult concepts. However, the close knit community is what defines Bard's identity. It is inclusive of all regardless of race, financial background, sexuality, etc. The school encourages students to break away from social conventions and stereotypes. Bard isn't a school. It is a home."]

column2: ['Such a strong learning environment. I have had a great 4 years and feel very prepared for my future endeavors.', 'At Roslyn High school, the teachers and academic programs are great. There are hundreds of clubs to choose from and the school culture is pretty good. However, the athletic programs are not great.', 'My experience at Roslyn High School was good. For the most part, teachers are engaged, involved, and want to help students be successful.', 'Roslyn is a very good school. There is a multitude of resources available for students, very good academics', 'I like RHS as it has endless opportunities for every student.  Teachers are highly qualified and are available to meet before & after school.  Every Counselor is great.  They have guided me throughout my high school career.  School offers vast variety of clubs and sports activities.', 'Many challenging courses offered, but not Latin.  Seniors get priority with Guidance Counselors. Many resources are available to the students to help them succeed, like after school help with the teachers.  Smart boards in many if not all classrooms. Broad range of classes, including coding and American Sign Language. There is a requirement that students do volunteer work before they graduate.', 'The academics at Roslyn High School are very good, the teachers are very qualified and my courses were very rigorous, however, many teachers were very susceptible to parents coercion for better grades or better positions in clubs. Also, the diversity at the school is very small and students are not encouraged to befriend students of different backgrounds. Many students were very privileged and they were not taught any better about the real world.', "I really like Roslyn HS because it is not too large or small.  My class has less than 300 kids and I have been going to school with all of them since kindergarten.  The teachers are great and very supportive of the students.  I am fortunate the school offers a very good honors program and I have been able to take several AP courses over the past few years.  The school has a great reputation but not so intense where you feel it is overwhelming.  I am surrounded by other students that strive to excel but everyone is very collegial and not competitive with another.  I don't think I would change anything about the school.  It sounds naive but I feel it has helped shape the person I am today.  It's not perfect but neither am I.", 'Roslyn High School is a school with strong academics and an encouraging staff. I liked the self-selection option with choosing our courses and the various clubs and activities offered. This gave the students the opportunity to dabble in classes they were passionate about. Furthermore, the many courses offered at Roslyn High School reflect the abundant resources that can be utilized by its students. The teachers and the administration in general communicated frequently and well with their students and were very approachable. While I enjoyed my overall experience here, one place this school is lacking in is in the diversity of its students. There is an overwhelming amount of Caucasians, and a much smaller percentage of other ethnicities. Overall, however, this school is certainly a good one.', 'As an incoming student, I was able to find my way and fit into the social dynamic here. What I really like about this school is that the teachers are always so willing to help, there are always additional resources that I could take advantage of, the community atmosphere is always present, people are really nice, and the school offers a variety of classes, and clubs. There are extra steps the staff takes to involve the students in the school community. For example, we have a pep rally, clash of the classes, Halloween costume parties, and so much more. Also, I am a senior right now and my guidance counselor is always willing to go the extra mile to help me in any way. One thing that I wish would change is the quality of the food. Lastly, another thing I would like to change is the diversity of this school. There isn’t a lot of diversity, as students tend to stay and hang out with individuals  from their own background. Overall, I am satisfied with the quality of this school.', 'I like that there are an abundant amount of resources at your disposal and it’s not hard to find your group of friends.', 'Guidance counselors are very flexible with helping to prepare students for not only college but their time at Roslyn High School. Administrators make an effort to have parents involved in the college preparation and teachers are there to be one on one with students..', 'Stuck up kids in Gucci slides run rampant through the hallways blasting music on their Bluetooth speakers high from juuling. Not the best place, not the worst place', 'I attended Roslyn High School for 4 years, consecutively, and after attending Roslyn Middle School for 3 years. It fares very well for a public school, allowing students free speech in the wake of mass shootings that have affected people here at a personal level, but also moderating that speech. The people here are sometimes judgemental, sometimes eccentric, but they’re often just people, with struggles that they run from or hide from. I’m grateful for attending school here, I’m grateful for the opportunities it has provided me in the form of the humanities, but ultimately, I’m ready to leave. In some ways, the administration is manipulated by the parents in a way we consider uniquely Roslyn-esque, but likely exists in other pockets across the United States. The teachers are some of the best, and I appreciate all of them very much. Overall, a problematic, but above-average school.', 'the peole are very welcoming and kind to each other. There are different clubs and sports you can join. There is a lot of help from teachers and other staff.', 'Roslyn High school has been great for me to start my future at. I have made many friends, learned a lot about the world around me, and I have learned how to be a successful student. I will take the qualities and lessons that I have learned in this building into the future and carry them with me throughout college and the rest of my life. I feel ready to start the next chapter of my life and will always have the teachers and school to thank for that. I have felt comfortable and safe in this building 99% of the time and I know that hundreds of others will continue to feel the same way as me for the years to come. I received a lot of help with college applications and everything in between with the help of the guidance office. I will miss this building and all of the relationships that I have made over the last 4 years. I will never forget any of it and will be sure to visit in the future.', 'As a considerably motivated student , I have found the academic resources and faculty support at Roslyn High School to be very strong. The rigor of the classes is significant and I have been very well prepared for standardized testing. Additionally, the extracurricular activities I have been involved in, primarily the DECA Business Club and Public Forum Debate Club, have offered me invaluable mentorship opportunities that have been some of the cornerstones of my high school experience. However, at times the administration of the school has not been very supportive of my endeavors, and in some cases tried to undermine the leadership of myself, and others in extracurriculars, as well as undermine some of my academic pursuits. The student body as a whole, however, is very supportive of one another, and my four years at Roslyn have been filled with growth and development socially, and academically.', "Roslyn exists in a bubble where the parents are more involved in the schoolwork than the students. Many families like to flex their wealth and buy their sixteen year olds BMW's an Audi's. Arguably smart school, but would not wish anyone to attend.", 'My experience at Roslyn High School has been absolutely amazing. Many say that they cannot wait to get out of High School, however for me, that is not the case. I do believe that high school has definitely prepared me for the future not only academically but also socially. The teachers are extremely approachable and present in the students\' lives, and the multitude of courses available ensure that regardless of your academic focus, you will learn and grow intellectually. The social environment at Roslyn is inviting and open, and very dissimilar to the "stereotypical cliquey high school". Everyone is allowed and encouraged to socialize with everyone, and nobody is excluded. I have friends now who I met from my different classes, sports, and even clubs. I have only good memories from high school and would definitely rate Roslyn 5/5.', 'This school has really gotten ready for college and has given an expectional education. This school may not have the best diversity, though the people are really nice and have become some of my best friends']

column6: ['Great staff members in the school. Kids are very friendly! Personally, i believe that almost all of the classes are engaging and fun. In addition, there are many clubs and sports after school for different seasons. Sports like football, basketball, soccer, and others and very popular.', 'Overall, I had a great experience at Roslyn High School. I had many academic resources available to me and was able to take a variety of challenging courses that prepared me for the rigor of college academics. Socially, it is a very cliquey atmosphere but it is also very easy to find people you fit in with.', "My 4 years at Roslyn High School were the worst 4 years of my life. Il start off by saying that the school is extremely clique-y I was bullied a lot during my 4 years... I had absolutely no one. Everyone was extremely mean to me. The teachers didn't even care about me. I actually enjoy learning but I nearly failed out of all my classes sophomore uear because I couldn't go to school. I used to cry every day begging my parents to take me out of school. I ended up getting severe depression and a lot of insecurities due to all the bullying and insults I received in HS as well as people starting rumors about me. No one ever cared. I ended up not even wanting to go to college just because I never wanted to go to school again. (needless to say I did end up going to college eventually) but it took years of therapy to undo the damage caused to me in high school. I strongly urge you not to send your child to this High School unless they happen to be a clique-y bully themselves.", 'Classes are challenging .Lots of electives and teachers are helpful. School has lots of spirit. Clubs are pretty good with a good variety', "Arrogant school with arrogant teachers. Some teachers are not interested in the success of students. Students should be able to evaluate teachers. Administration does not act on student's behalf. If you can move to a different district, do it.", 'The teachers are amazing and do their best to help you in every way possible. The facilities are great and there are tons of clubs that are bound to spark your interest. Although it can sometimes seem "clique-y" i\'ve found that overall if you\'re nice to everyone your experience will be more smooth.', "Roslyn offers a variety of AP classes and electives that are beneficial to the students' learning. Most of the teachers are very qualified. However, the school doesn't seem to spend their money in efficient ways; they recently bought new SmartBoards and the cafeteria walls are littered with useless flatscreen TVs, but many of the classrooms don't hair A/C and/or heat.", "It is okay if you can avoid the fact you are surrounded by a room full of pretentious pricks. The workload and all is hard to manage, but I'm sure it's for the best.", 'All the teachers strive for there students success', 'After school activities are a great way for students to get together and plan something for either their club or organization. There are a great number of clubs that anyone could take part in because many people enjoy being with their friends as well as being productive for what they fight for.', 'Everything makes this school unique which includes the school spirit when it comes to homecoming, making it a great place for everyone to be with. During sport games many people come to cheer the athletes, being one myself many people do care about us and support us when it comes to these types of events. I would definitely come back to enjoy the moment I had with the boys soccer team leading them to the quarterfinal and my friends that came to support us on our success throughout the season.', "The teachers at my school are very outgoing especially when you are able to start up a conversation with them. They have the same interest as us students no matter what the topic of conversation is. When it comes to learning they truly care and want us to understand the lesson at all times. Some teachers are more understanding than others, of course many have flaws when it comes to communication skills. Other than that I'm am truly happy with my experience during High School.", 'The school is great there are some people who are not so friendly', "They are very caring but sometimes they don't know how to control a class", 'Every parent looks out for how their children and only their children will look to colleges, not caring about anyone else. Keeps the school on top though.', 'Every teacher I have had was very smart but not always the best at teaching.', 'Samantha is the President of the Fashion Club, Secretary of Medical Explorers, Asst. Manager of Marching Band, and a member of Yadac. There is a lot of Administrative support at these clubs and the kids have a lot of fun at them.', "I have always had a positive experience when dealing with any of Samantha's teachers. They are all very genuinely concerned about her grades and are always willing to help her in any way she needs. They encourage her and help her to succeed. They are all very knowledgeable in what they are teaching and consistent with grading.", 'I feel the school is somewhat safe. The two main doors where kids can enter and exit from are monitored by school parent volunteers and everyone has to be buzzed in. All visitors must present there drivers license and get a name tag. They get the license back after exiting and turning in name tag. I would feel better if there were security guards at the main doors though. School nurse is very sweet and caring. She really cares for the students health and well being.', 'My experience has been amazing and very life fulfilling. I have been part of the badminton team and marching band color guard. I have met a lot of friends that I will know for a lifetime. My friends and teachers made my high school experience worth while and has prepared me for the future I have ahead of me. I am very grateful for all my teachers have done for me and look forward to my college experiences.']

column2: ["While the academics and faculty are usualy very helpful and good for my classes. I would like to see less e days in the rotating block schedule, because it makes it easier for a student to manage their homework when they have more regular days that aren't packed with classes. Another thing is that with the new block schedule it is harder to find classes at the beginning of the year, so the school should set the student potal up with a schedule for each letter day so the student can find their class more easily. Although I like how the school also offers chromebooks many students damage them because they aren't being monitored. A chromebook that is missing keys will make it increasingly hard to write with and will slow down the students ability to type. I recommend that the school assign numbered chromebook so that we can find out the students that are doing this and discourage  them from doing so.", "The academic aspects of the school is amazing. There are amazing student resources, teachers, facilities and more to help a student be successful. The only thing I'd like to see change is the peer environment.", 'The teachers were very good and the academics really prepared me for college. The students are very "cliche-y" and I sometimes felt very excluded because I was part of the minority of the student body which was very surprising.', "Tenafly High School is an amazing institution. Throughout my four years, I've encountered passionate teachers, taken a plethora of interesting classes and electives, and been able to participate in a wide variety of clubs.", "I liked Tenafly High for the fact that it prepares you very well for college. Studies are rigorous, and most teachers in the school are top tier. However, the science department lacks in really engaging teachers. There are distinct cliques within the school, which aren't so pleasant. Overally good studies, low school spirit.", 'I have gone to Tenafly ever since kindergarten and I am happy to say I have had a very positive experience. I have struggled with various learning issues which have made school difficult. Fortunately with the help of most people at Tenafly I have been able to grow into a confident person and an engaged student which is something neither I or many other people though was possible.', 'Teachers are great, many overqualified for their position, which makes the learning environment advanced and great. Students are generally motivated to learn and receive good grades.', "Like any school I would assume, there are really amazing teachers, mediocre ones, and terrible ones, and I've had all three. Overall, however, I don't regret my experience. The administration is disorganized and there isn't enough room in the cafeteria and gym for all the students to sit during lunch, leaving many to sit on the floors of the halls, even with many kids leaving campus for lunch. But it's easier to find the things to complain about because it's easy to take the other parts for granted. Ms. Ryan from attendance is an angel and her odd smiley faces should be protected at all costs.", 'The education at Tenafly High School is exceptional. Teachers are driven by a love and devotion for educating students. The schools ranking has dropped in recent years for unfair reasons but this institution remains extrodinary.', "Tenafly High School is an amazing school with phenomenal teachers that are genuine about both teaching and their students. The teachers make it their duty to be inclusive in their methods of teaching and that creates an environment in which I loved to be immersed in. However, Tenafly High School has a problem with school spirit, as its students take organized events, such as the Olympics, for granted. Tenafly High School also has a problem with students Juuling in the bathroom. I feel that the problem is not being combated effectively by the administrators who are resorting to indirect methods such as posting posters and alerting parents instead of having officers directly infiltrating the bathrooms more often. From a student's perspective, the administration seems to mismanage the school's money, having accumulated debt. Although there are some flaws, Tenafly High School provides a friendly learning environment and fosters an inclusive atmosphere for students.", 'Tenafly High School has allowed me to branch out and meet new friends while getting a valuable education with teachers that actually care about there students. I love my school.', 'All the teachers are wonderful in not only making you a better educated person, but also a good one. The education you receive at Tenafly high school, though quite rigorous, prepares you extremely well for college. The amount of work you receive may be greater than what you may get in other schools.', 'Certain teachers were amazing, others underwhelming. Overall, the school is very focused on college readiness and does so in a successful manner. School spirit and diversity were a bit embarrassing, though. Positive experience but much room for improvement.', 'I had a very good experience at this school. I feel it prepared me for my intended field of study in college, and had many resources available.', 'Solid but not excellent academics. Diversity - almost everyone is white or Asian - could be better. In particular, interracial interaction should be improved.', "Academics were amazing.   Teachers and resources were also great.   My biggest challenge was 'not completely fitting in with the norm'.   I had a learning disability (which was addressed and helped me prepare for college), but not enough clubs to try to reach students who might need more social skills.", "It's a very nice school for academics. The teachers are definitely great and hard working except a few. The only set back is that Tenafly tends to have its own bubble. There are many Asians and Jewish students and there is no diversity. Also, the school is very competitive and the stress can get to the students.", 'Tenafly High School provides a great science research program. There are always one or two schools police officers around who provide safety. The courses in Tenafly are rigorous like the many AP classes Tenafly teaches. There are a numerous amount of well founded clubs like math club and constant new clubs being created like robotics club. Tenafly should increase lunch quality like most high schools, however, it would probably be more costly.', 'Tenafly provided me with a good education. No school is perfect, however, and it would have been helpful if this was a more supportive environment.', 'It was an interesting experience. I was in mostly Honors and AP courses throughout my high school career, and the support within these programs was phenomenal; however, a few of friends were in the special education programs, and their experience was one of being trapped in the program versus the support they should feel.']
column4: ["While the academics and faculty are usualy very helpful and good for my classes. I would like to see less e days in the rotating block schedule, because it makes it easier for a student to manage their homework when they have more regular days that aren't packed with classes. Another thing is that with the new block schedule it is harder to find classes at the beginning of the year, so the school should set the student potal up with a schedule for each letter day so the student can find their class more easily. Although I like how the school also offers chromebooks many students damage them because they aren't being monitored. A chromebook that is missing keys will make it increasingly hard to write with and will slow down the students ability to type. I recommend that the school assign numbered chromebook so that we can find out the students that are doing this and discourage  them from doing so.", "The academic aspects of the school is amazing. There are amazing student resources, teachers, facilities and more to help a student be successful. The only thing I'd like to see change is the peer environment.", 'The teachers were very good and the academics really prepared me for college. The students are very "cliche-y" and I sometimes felt very excluded because I was part of the minority of the student body which was very surprising.', "Tenafly High School is an amazing institution. Throughout my four years, I've encountered passionate teachers, taken a plethora of interesting classes and electives, and been able to participate in a wide variety of clubs.", "I liked Tenafly High for the fact that it prepares you very well for college. Studies are rigorous, and most teachers in the school are top tier. However, the science department lacks in really engaging teachers. There are distinct cliques within the school, which aren't so pleasant. Overally good studies, low school spirit.", 'I have gone to Tenafly ever since kindergarten and I am happy to say I have had a very positive experience. I have struggled with various learning issues which have made school difficult. Fortunately with the help of most people at Tenafly I have been able to grow into a confident person and an engaged student which is something neither I or many other people though was possible.', 'Teachers are great, many overqualified for their position, which makes the learning environment advanced and great. Students are generally motivated to learn and receive good grades.', "Like any school I would assume, there are really amazing teachers, mediocre ones, and terrible ones, and I've had all three. Overall, however, I don't regret my experience. The administration is disorganized and there isn't enough room in the cafeteria and gym for all the students to sit during lunch, leaving many to sit on the floors of the halls, even with many kids leaving campus for lunch. But it's easier to find the things to complain about because it's easy to take the other parts for granted. Ms. Ryan from attendance is an angel and her odd smiley faces should be protected at all costs.", 'The education at Tenafly High School is exceptional. Teachers are driven by a love and devotion for educating students. The schools ranking has dropped in recent years for unfair reasons but this institution remains extrodinary.', "Tenafly High School is an amazing school with phenomenal teachers that are genuine about both teaching and their students. The teachers make it their duty to be inclusive in their methods of teaching and that creates an environment in which I loved to be immersed in. However, Tenafly High School has a problem with school spirit, as its students take organized events, such as the Olympics, for granted. Tenafly High School also has a problem with students Juuling in the bathroom. I feel that the problem is not being combated effectively by the administrators who are resorting to indirect methods such as posting posters and alerting parents instead of having officers directly infiltrating the bathrooms more often. From a student's perspective, the administration seems to mismanage the school's money, having accumulated debt. Although there are some flaws, Tenafly High School provides a friendly learning environment and fosters an inclusive atmosphere for students.", 'Tenafly High School has allowed me to branch out and meet new friends while getting a valuable education with teachers that actually care about there students. I love my school.', 'All the teachers are wonderful in not only making you a better educated person, but also a good one. The education you receive at Tenafly high school, though quite rigorous, prepares you extremely well for college. The amount of work you receive may be greater than what you may get in other schools.', 'Certain teachers were amazing, others underwhelming. Overall, the school is very focused on college readiness and does so in a successful manner. School spirit and diversity were a bit embarrassing, though. Positive experience but much room for improvement.', 'I had a very good experience at this school. I feel it prepared me for my intended field of study in college, and had many resources available.', 'Solid but not excellent academics. Diversity - almost everyone is white or Asian - could be better. In particular, interracial interaction should be improved.', "Academics were amazing.   Teachers and resources were also great.   My biggest challenge was 'not completely fitting in with the norm'.   I had a learning disability (which was addressed and helped me prepare for college), but not enough clubs to try to reach students who might need more social skills.", "It's a very nice school for academics. The teachers are definitely great and hard working except a few. The only set back is that Tenafly tends to have its own bubble. There are many Asians and Jewish students and there is no diversity. Also, the school is very competitive and the stress can get to the students.", 'Tenafly High School provides a great science research program. There are always one or two schools police officers around who provide safety. The courses in Tenafly are rigorous like the many AP classes Tenafly teaches. There are a numerous amount of well founded clubs like math club and constant new clubs being created like robotics club. Tenafly should increase lunch quality like most high schools, however, it would probably be more costly.', 'Tenafly provided me with a good education. No school is perfect, however, and it would have been helpful if this was a more supportive environment.', 'It was an interesting experience. I was in mostly Honors and AP courses throughout my high school career, and the support within these programs was phenomenal; however, a few of friends were in the special education programs, and their experience was one of being trapped in the program versus the support they should feel.']
column6: ["Tenafly is an amazing school with hundreds of opportunities for students. No matter what you're interested in, you can find a class or club that matches your interests and if you don't-- create your own! The academics is also phenomenal and the reason most people move to this town.", 'Great education. All nice teachers that seem very educated in their subjects. The premises are clean and constantly being renovated and updated. Their is a real sense of achievement in the students which helps drive you to do better and teacher genuinely care about your success as a student.', 'Teachers are all extremely intelligent. It is an amazing environment to learn and be a student in. I enjoyed every day I spent in THS. The administrators are a little too strict but overall the kids work very hard to submit all of their assignments on time. There is nice school spirit and a truly unbelievable soccer team. Most students at this school are involved in many clubs.', "I began suffering from anxiety my freshman year of high school. It became a burden and I wasn't able to get the support services that I needed. I have since created two businesses and almost finished writing a novel after admin at Tenafly High School continuously discouraged me from overcoming my obstacles and refused to support me.", 'Overall, Tenafly High School is an extremely competitive school. It is very motivating to be part of such a hardworking community of students and staff. From music to sports, the students work their hardest to aspire for their future careers. It is great place!!!', 'Tenafly high school is rather small so each student gets the attention that they deserve. This school has a phenomenal staff of teachers, I am very proud to have graduated from Tenafly.', "Tenafly High School creates ambitious, intelligent, accepting, and politically aware students who often excel at the nation's top universities and jobs. Students are leaders themselves, often changing the school and the community with their own actions and projects. Most, but not all, teachers treat their students like adults, fostering a very independent and almost college like environment. Students also have a lot of freedom during the school day to do homework and leave campus. While academically Tenafly is amazing, college readiness and grades is the administrations only interest. A substantial amount of pressure is put upon all the students. This immense pressure causes intense competition among top students and makes students less interested in grades feel insecure and often unintelligent. This preoccupation with grades also takes focus away from sports and school spirit and has led to a prevalent drug and alcohol culture.", "More competition and academics than social. It's a very good school in terms of how hard students work.", 'Great educational experience. Teachers generally willing to go the extra mile to help. Facilities were clean and new. Athletics are lacking with the exception of soccer.', 'THS is very rigorous and prepares you well for college but the atmosphere is very competitive and overly obsessive about grades.', 'My experience in Tenafly high school is like any other high school experience. Teachers are friendly, lots of school spirit and events to look forward to and lots of things to stress about. Tenafly high school is very competitive and hard but it really prepares you for college and for your future.', 'I like it here, and it is very nice, although some teachers are whack. Teachers make it fun here, and many actually cares and take time out of their day to help with your problems and such. The athletics are great, and we have had and have state track runners and the soccer program always finishes in the top 5 of our county. Overall a very nice school.', 'many different types of clubs and organizations.', 'overall help you when struggling and respect you', 'The teachers are very knowledgable on their respective topics and really want the student to succeed.', "Honestly, my daughter was always in sports after school, so we didn't have much interaction with clubs", 'I find the quality of the teachers to be a mixed bag.  Some are outstanding, others, not so great.', 'The nurse sometimes forgets to update medicines on hand, i.e.; epi-pens', 'I am glad I participate in three running sports.  It keeps me healthy and in contact with great people.  There is a lack of ethnic diversity at this school.', 'Classes are offered on all Levels']

column2: ['I liked the sense of community at Allied, however it was often pushed too much.  They definitely prepared me for college level courses although I wish there was a greater variety of courses offered, even if this was just more APs.  Some teachers were excellent and some teachers were less than satisfactory.', 'It’s a small (300 students at most) magnet public high school that will prepare you to further your education towards a career in the medical sciences.  It’s a National Blue Ribbon School several times already with the latest being in 2018.Great teachers that are willing to go out of their way to make sure you succeed.  Amazing principal & office staff!   Smaller teacher/student ratios & you will get to know everyone.  It’s a career academy with a rigorous curriculum that will definitely prepare you for college.  You can graduate with college credits.  I will graduate come June 2020 & I would make the choice to attend AAHS all over again.  I will be pursuing a future in medicine and AAHS has given me the perfect foundation to build upon.  I am grateful for the many opportunities that AAHS provides their students.  From hospital rotations to community-based partnerships, and mentorship, Thank You!  I would highly recommend the Academy of Allied Health & Science, Neptune.', 'Academically, this school has prepped me to my full college potential. However, class sizes are too small.', 'Allied has a rigorous curriculum. In the very beginning of freshman year, all students realize how much effort they must put into their classes. All students are extremely competitive, but they do help each other study. All students are very dedicated to school and they push each other to do their best.', 'If you get in, you probably feel accomplished and excited. Just know that everyone who goes to Allied is just as smart and at least as motivated as you are. In fact, a lot of students have their lives and careers planned out in detail. Nobody gets by on their intelligence. You have to work hard every day. You won’t have the same high school experience as your friends outside of Allied. But, you will be prepared for college. And, if you have a sense of humor, you will find plenty of things to laugh at... for instance, gym!', "It is a great school with a lot of staff members willing to push you to succeed in addition to providing you with lots of medical opportunities. I'm glad I went there as it has given me a foundation in medicine I can build upon. The kids in the school are very friendly and open. While we could use more clubs, we have plenty of activities students can get involved with. Since it is such a small school I got to know many of my classmates very well. In a way, this school kind of feels like a big family. While there will always be a level of competitiveness, everyone works together to succeed.", "Going to Allied was one of the worst mistakes I've made. Drugs are huge among every class but I guess it's high school, right? But the community within Allied is just toxic which makes it go a step further. Not that hard of a school other than the science courses honestly. But they spend their budget so badly, especially for how small the school is they could easily spend more on resources and the interior in general. With a class of only 85 students, giod luck finding actual friends that arent toxic. Oh yeah if you want food poisoning eat the chicken during lunch. Also the clubs arent actually real clubs for the most part... However pur science department is strong with great teachers. Good history department too. Everything else about this school really is trash.", "I am a senior right now and I have to say, I wouldn't want my high school education to be in any other school and that's EVEN after I'm pursuing a future in Computer Engineering. Even when I realized that the medical profession wasn't for me, this school still went above and beyond to help me build my resume for this future. Sure there are some good and bad teachers, but there are far more amazing teachers than bad ones. I love this school and I recommend it to anybody hoping to apply soon. Good luck!", 'Challenging but rewarding and I enjoyed reaching out and helping the community in multiple classes. The medical classes like anatomy and physiology are so interesting but as expected they are challenging', 'My experience at AAHS was truly eye-opening and allowed me to understand my passion for the healthcare field. The classes and instructors provided an environment that nourished the interests of all students even if they were not interested in medicine. I was able to excel at this school because of the incredible students and guidance and would not be where I am today without it. I would not have traded this experience for any other public high school in Monmouth County, New Jersey.', 'AAHS has been a rewarding experience.  The teachers are amazing and have prepared me well for college.', 'I loved the health and science classes available. It was amazing that we could earn college credits in high school. I would like to see change with the general education classes. I wish we could have taken tests to get more college credits for general education classes.', 'Not only is it an academically challenging school, but it teaches you so much about yourself and your goals as a professional. Coming in, I had only a small interest in a medical career; after nearly four years there, I know for a fact that I want to be a doctor. I do wish they offered more AP courses, but overall, I had a very good experience at Allied.', 'AAHS is a great school to explore the medical field and find out if you really want to invest your time and money into an area in medicine', "When I applied to this school, I thought there would be a great community with people I can truly connect with. The community makes the school the worst educational experience here. Its all about making fun/bullying the nicest students everyday and getting into drugs, so if you get admission into this school dont go. Average amount of good teachers, so you are better off going to your local public school. I'm popular within the freshman, but the freshman class needs major reforms. Surprised that freshman students can get into drugs at such a young age, it just appalls me.", 'The school has excellent teachers and resources to foster academic and extracurricular growth and allow students to maximize their potential.', 'Allied is a competitive school that offers an education for students that hope to pursue a medical career. It prepares each student for college whether or not they choose to go into a field of medicine', "AAHS is a very challenging school but I'm confident the rigorous curriculum will prepare me for college. Generally  the teachers are know their subject matters and they are always available to help during lunch time if you request for additional help. The only negative aspect is there are no sports program so a student will need to go back to the home school to participate in sports. We all know that when we applied to the school. I have no regrets in my decision.", 'This school has been good so far. The classes are very engaging and educational and I have learned a lot from them. I wish there could be more AP classes to challenge students more. There is a lack of clubs, especially competitive ones. For the only ones that exist, hardly any one is enthusiastic about them. My middle school had many academic competitions and clubs, so I there is a bit of a hole in that area. I think it could be easily fixed by adding more meaningful clubs.', 'Good school but unfortunately there is only one class that you can take and receive AP credits for which is unfortunate since they help a lot in college if you have the scores for them. Other than that it does a fantastic job of preparing you for the medical field.']

column6: ["This is a difficult school. Definitely one of the top ten in the country. I'm suffering now but it'll pay off later. All classes are honors or AP. The teachers are well versed. Some are professors, some are doctors. Surprisingly, this is also one of the most diverse schools I've been to. You can trust your classmates. That is why all the lockers are left open.", "The Academy of Allied Health and Science, more commonly known as AAHS, has been more than a blessing. During my time there I was only met with the highest caliber of respect and education. The teachers all do whatever they can to make the student's life better. Also, the number of students per each grade level calls for a very close knit group of many different personalities and backgrounds. In fact, there are not that many bad things to counter the good. The biggest flaw the school has is the size of the school itself. It can be a very cramped environment that has little breathing room. Aside from that, AAHS has my highest accommodations.", 'This school has solidified my passion for the medical field and taught me so much about myself.', 'The teachers are truly passionate about what they teach, and care about the students.', "The workload and stress was difficult to manage on more than one occasion, but I definitely felt prepared for college by the time I graduated. The opportunities to experience the medical field while in high school made this a worthwhile experience, especially because, for me, I learned that I was more interested in the arts rather than medical science. The time management skills I learned at Allied helped me throughout my first year of college, and now it feels like I'm not being challenged compared to my high school classes. Most of the teachers are great and you really get to form a personal connection with each of them throughout your four years at Allied, you'll meet some amazing people, and overall I wouldn't have traded my time at Allied for the world.", 'The students at AAHS are alright. There are groups of students that are caring and reliable, and there are groups of students that are the stereotypical "partygoers" and make the school seem worse than it actually is. The faculty at AAHS are very understanding, but they can be harsh on students. I would still choose this school again, though because if you are thinking about going into the medical field, the education is much better than your average high school\'s education. You learn things ranging from Clinical Skills to Anatomy and Physiology, and there are a few required computer-based courses that you have to take in this high school.', 'The principal, guidance counselors, and staff were very reasonable.', 'We only had a weight/fitness room available.', 'Teachers were very willing to help in any way they could and best prepare us for college.', 'We had many clubs and organizations but we did not have any after-school activities.', 'I chose to go to the University of Maryland- College Park. I definitely felt ready for my biology and chemistry courses here but not so much the "real world".', "When students don't follow the rules, there are certainly measures taken to demonstrate what they did was wrong.", "We didn't have sports, but we have a great fitness department.", 'The teachers at Allied definitely made a huge difference in my high school experience. They are all very approachable and want to see their students succeed.', 'I enjoyed the extracurricular activities I participated in, but there could have been more options available.', 'Most of the courses I took at Allied prepared me for my college-level courses. The school also prepared me with my speaking and organizational skills. I learned how to conduct myself in professional and health-related situations, as well.', "Average policy, because we have good kids and a low student count there isn't too much trouble", "I love all of my teachers, they do their job very well and wouldn't trade it for the world", 'We have a variety of clubs attended by who ever is interested in that type of thing, such as chess club or mock trial or deceorating committee', "No matter how bad a day I'm having, I'd rather be at Allied than anywhere else."]

Most of the teachers are great and you really get to form a personal connection with each of them throughout your four years at Allied, you'll meet some amazing people, and overall I wouldn't have traded my time at Allied for the world.", 'The students at AAHS are alright. There are groups of students that are caring and reliable, and there are groups of students that are the stereotypical "partygoers" and make the school seem worse than it actually is. The faculty at AAHS are very understanding, but they can be harsh on students. I would still choose this school again, though because if you are thinking about going into the medical field, the education is much better than your average high school\'s education.
